loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua O. cooks "jollof rice" (rice cooked in a tomato-based sauce) for sale at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. The tomato sauce gives the rice a different colour and flavour. Ekua lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for ten years. She assists her husband feed, educate and cloth the children. The loan will be used to buy additional bags of rice and other food items to prepare food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in expanding her selection of dishes. (In the picture, the pot of reddish sauce is the tomato sauce that is served with the jollof rice.)

loans.use: To buy rice and other food items to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles achètent avec les  prêts des chaussures, des  articles d’étalagistes, et avec  Djénébou K. pour acheter des céréales.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Djénébou K., compte acheter, 4 sacs de 50 kg de riz fumé, 2 sacs de 100 kg de Maïs et 2 sacs de 100 kg de petit mil.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins au niveau des cultivateurs pour en suite revendre au marché en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are all married women with an average age of 35 and 5 children who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of BOUGOUNI (third largest administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through their businesses as well as neighborhood contacts. In order to satisfy their customers and increase the size of their businesses, they decided to join the loan program offered by microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

They will use the loan to purchase shoes, window displays and, for Djénébou K. in particular, to purchase grains. With this new loan, K. plans to purchase four 50 kilo bags of smoked rice, two 100 kilo bags of maize/corn and two 100 kilo bags of millet. She stocks up on products from farmers in the nearby villages and then re-sells them at the market for both cash and credit, to a customer base comprised of both women and men. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCF [approximately 42 USD], a part of which will be reinvested in her business and the part used to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: Achat  Céréales

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: Policarpio, es natural del distrito de Kimbiri, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con doña Julia de 43 años y tienen 04 hijos y juntos residen en su propia casa en el distrito de Kimbiri departamento del Cusco. La labor que realiza Policarpio es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantaciones de piña y hojas de coca en total cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia chacra, y ahora con los ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propia parcela. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 20 años, y en los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le proporcionan buenos frutos, de eso depende para obtener buenas ganancias. Asimismo menciona que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo. El préstamo que solicita es para poder comprar su propia movilidad una moto carguero y así poder trasladar con mayor rapidez sus productos  a los mercados. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras y variar sus sembrios, para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará su propia movilidad una moto carguero para así poder trasladar con mayor rapidez sus productos  a los mercados.
texts.en: Policarpio, born in the district of Kimbiri, is 43 years old. His wife Julia, also 43, have four children and sive together in the district of Kimbiri in the department of Cusco. Policarpio's job is in agriculture; he grows pinneapples and coca leaves and owns a total of 5 hectacres. His parents taught him to till the land and he grew up hoping to some day own his own farm. Now with the savings he has accumulated he was been able to make those dreams of owning his own parcel of land a reality. He knows the hard labor of farm work well having done this work for 20 years. During harvest time he hires temporary workers to transport his prodcuts to different markets. He is very dedicated to his job because thanks to his every day labors he is able to see his plants bear fruit. He asserts that he does not like the winter because during these months the insects are abundant and this negatively affects his crop yields. The loan that he is applying for will be used to buy a cargo motorcycle to quickly deliver his products to the markets. With time he hopes to buy more land and vary his crops more thus providing economic stability for his family. This will be his sixth loan with MFP, and he has been very punctual with the payments from his previous loans and plans to continue this practice. At his community bank he is well liked by the other members.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport his produce to the market.

loans.name: Martha Vannessa

texts.es:
Martha de 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora ya que vende productos de uso personal por catalogo a diferentes clientes fijos que ella tiene. 

Su papa le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas ya que la ayudo con la comprar de los productos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. Ofrece los productos a clientes cerca del sector donde vive. Vende perfumes, cremas, lociones, bisutería etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who sells personal care products, through catalogs, to regular customers.

Martha's dad helped her to improve her sales since he helped her buy products.  She currently works from 8.00am to 1.00pm every day.  Martha sells her products to customers who live near her neighborhood.  She sells perfumes, creams, lotions, costume jewelry, etc.

Martha has many aspirations for her business.  She would like this loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es: Macedonia es natural de Huanta, tiene 46 años de edad; viuda hace 11 años, es una señora muy trabajadora y  lucha por dar lo mejor a sus 06  hijas y juntas viven en su propia casa en la ciudad de Quimbiri. Macedonia, empezó su aventura como agricultora desde muy niña en las tierras de sus padres, su pasión por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras comprados con el esfuerzo de su  esposo ya fallecido y el de ella. Ha trabajado durante 25 años en su propia parcela; y hasta el momento continúa cultivando cacao y café. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometida con su labor; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas producen, obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de fruto vendido. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socia muy querida. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Macedonia is a native of Huanta. She is 46 years old and has been widowed for eleven years. Macedonia is a hardworking woman who struggles to provide the best for her six daughters. They live together in their own home in the city of Quimbiri. She began her adventure as a farmer from a young age, working on the land of her parents. Her passion for farming led her to acquire her own land which she purchased with the help of her late husband. Macedonia has worked her parcel of land for 25 years and to this day continues to grow cacao and coffee. During the harvest season, she has the help of workers who are in charge of quickly picking the fruit of each crop in order to complete their work in less time. Macedonia is very committed to her work because her efforts have resulted in the fruits that her plants have produced. She generates good earnings for each kilogram of product that she sells.

The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire cacao plants to add to her fields and to take advantage of the shortened harvest season. At the moment, her greatest priority is to acquire additional farmland so that she can expand her plantings and increase production. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is willing to complete all of her payments on time. Macedonia wants to be able to access additional loans in the future. She is a well-respected member of her Communal Bank. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy cacao plants that she will later plant in her fields in order to take advantage of the abbreviated harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase cacao plants.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto a su familia en el sector Chepito Bajo del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Natividad se dedica desde hace 8 años  a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos. El cria sus animales en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente se dedica a agricultura.

Natividad desea adquirir más cerdos (lechones) para engorde y alimento balanceado que le permita incrementar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Natividad is 63 years old, single, and lives together with his family in Chepito Bajo sector, in Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural district which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Natividad has been raising and selling pigs for eight years.  He raises the animals in a farmyard behind his home.  He feeds his animals natural grains and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who frequently visit his area.  In addition, he also farms.

Natividad would like to acquire more pigs (piglets) to fatten and also balanced feed.  This will enable him to increase his business and make more income.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.; Aurelia, ella tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 14, 8; la socia  se dedica  a la artesanía, la socia trabaja de forma independiente ella compra al por mayor artesanía y lo vende en el mercado artesanal también ella aprendió a realizar diferentes trabajos como bisutería y otros, la otra parte de su negocio está compuesto,artesanias compradas en el poblado al por mayor. La soica solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de artesania y materiales para realizar. 


La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Aurelia, 36, is the member.  She’s married and has three children who are 15, 14 and 8 years of age.  She is a craftsperson.  She works independently.  She buys crafts at Wholesale and sells them at the crafts fair.  She also learned how to make various things like costume jewelry and others.  The other part of her business is composed of selling crafts bought at wholesale in town.  She is asking for the loan to buy crafts and crafts making supplies.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy crafts and crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a successful father and dedicated husband and together with his wife he has two children.  Taleh began a small grocery store seven years ago with a small amount of savings that he had earned as a carpenter.  He was assisted by his father who helps him with serving his clients.  

Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular.  He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.  Taleh is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff to increase profit

loans.name: Amimobosa

texts.fr: Mariée à un chef personnel dans une société, elle est mère de 03 enfants et est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Depuis 1998, elle s’adonne à cette activité en achetant à ANIE et en revendant  à domicile. Ce premier  prêt lui servira à acheter des charbons de bois pour accroitre son stock.
texts.en: Amimobosa, the wife of a human resources manager in a company, is the mother of three children. She trades with charcoal. She has been in this business since 1998. She buys her supplies in Anié and resells them from her home. This is her first loan and she will use it to buy charcoal to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofia desde que amanece planea su dia porque se mueve en los espacios familiar, productivo y personal. En el barrio San Fernando de la ciudad de Cartagena todos la conocen por efecto de su negocio de vender mercancia variada entre empleados, trabajadores independientes, amas de casa, jovenes y especialmente mujeres, que son sus principales clientes, a las que sofia consiente porque ellas son fieles. Su negocio consiste en vender a crèdito mercancia por encargo, para que la gente lo pague a plazos acuerdo con sus posibilidades.  En la actualidad se està preparando para responder a pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, a propòsito del dia del padre y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para satisfacer esta gran demanda, por eso teniendo en cuenta que invirtiendo un capital nuevo a su negocio llegaria a muchos mas clientes, ella ha decidido acudir a asu Credikiva que es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Sato Domingo, para invertir en  calzado y ropa masculina, pues son las mercancias que tiene encargadas y que auguran su éxito, porque conoce muy bien el mercado y sabe que es una oportunidad de impactarlo con ventas oportunas. Sofia vive con su cònyuge y su hijo de 5 años, con el que sueña ofrecerle, cada diamayor bienestar hasta convertirlo en un profesional con posibilidades de tener èxito. Cuando iniciò su negocio lo hizo pensando en adicionar mas ingresos a su hogar y comenzò vendiendo a pocos clientes plateria, gradualmente ha ido agregando ropa, calzado, accesorios y en general todo lo que sus clientes le pidan, porque tiene como meta principal desarrollar mas adelante un almacen muy diversificado de productos en oferta. Sofia agraece a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo su apoyo, pues gracias a ella tiene casa propia y esto ha dado mayor bienestar a sofia y a los suyos.
texts.en: Starting at dawn, Sofia plans out her day because she is dealing with family, business, and personal life. In the San Fernando neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, everyone knows her through her business of selling a variety of merchandise to workers, individuals, housewives, youth, and most especially women, who are her main customers. Sofia caters to them because they are faithful. Her business consists of selling on credit so people can pay her when and where it is possible for them. She is currently getting ready to fill some customers' orders for Fathers' Day, and her working capital is not sufficient for satisfying all the demand. This is why she is realizing that she needs to invest more capital in her business to bring in more customers, and so she has decided to request a Kiva loan. This is the second loan that she will receive from Kiva partner Fundaciòn Mario Sato Domingo. It will be for purchasing men's shoes and clothing because these are the items that are on order and that have helped form her success. She knows the market very well and knows that this is an opportunity for impacting her sales. Sofia lives with her husband and five-year-old son. She dreams of offering her son a better quality of life every day so he can become a professional with opportunities to be successful. When she started her business, she wanted to bring in more household income, and she started by selling silverware to a few customers. Gradually she added clothes, shoes, accessories, and, in general, everything her customers asked for because her main goal is to grow into a store that offers a variety of merchandise. Sofia is grateful to Kiva partner Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo for their help, because thanks to the organization, she has her own home and and a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase men's shoes and clothes

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been into bananas and vegetable growing for eighteen years and this has aided him in providing for the family. His hardships are pests, price fluctuation, thieves and high transport costs. His vision is having a well-maintained and model banana farm plus a well-educated family. Augustine needs the loan facility to buy manure.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Manuel Andres

texts.es:
Manuel Andres tiene 47 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los 4 hijos de 15, 14, 10 y 3 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca  en tierras propias. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo para salir a pasear con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la esposa a caminar.
texts.en:
Manuel Andrés, 47, is married living with his wife and four children who are 15, 14, 10 and 3 years of age in El Progreso belonging to Chillanes Canton.

The members of the El Progreso communal bank are located fifteen minutes from the Chillanes office.  There are 13 members and this is their third loan request to the cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans, corn, banana, soya and manioc.

Manuel farms cocoa beans, corn, bananas, soya and manioc. He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and his sales take place at the Chillanes Sunday market.

The loan will help him buy supplies, fertilizer and manure for the crops.  The loan has helped him in that he’s increased crop yields.  He has faced such challenges as illnesses among his field hands and infestations and illnesses in his crops.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to go out on excursions with his family.

In his spare time he enjoys going for walks with his wife.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Bismillah's Group

texts.en:
Bismillah is 44 years of age, married and has four children. Her husband is involved in the milk selling business. For this reason, he has kept some buffalos. Two of her children work in a factory and the other two are studying.  She is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. In her spare time, she offers full support to her husband by milking the buffalo and taking care of them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get more milk and increase his sales and profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 12 years. Bismillah hopes that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will not only grow but it will also allow him to buy an asset for his business. She is a new loan applicant and very confident about the better financial future of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bismillah.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is 47 years old and makes a living selling bananas. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is $6 per day. She has six children, four of whom are in school while the other two work and earn a combined income of $6.50 a day. Every month, the family has to spend $99 on food, $15 on electricity, $25 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan of $200 to repair her house. Her goal in life is to ensure that her children get at least a high school education.

loans.use: to repair a house.

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en: Hayam is a 35-year-old young woman.  She is married and has five sons and two daughters. She lives in Rafah City in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a decent salary. His salary is the only source of income the family has. Hayam wants to help pay the university fees for one of her sons. For this reason, and because of the low income the family has, Hayam need to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Hayam gets the FATEN loan, she will help her son to continue his university study and enable him to have a better education level. Hayam is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay university fees for her son.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonieta; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora, ella tiene tiendas de fotocopiadora, ella hace servicios de fotocopias, impresiones y tipeos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papeles al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “QORIMANCACHA”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

This is Antonieta; she is 29 years old, single, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her photocopying business.  She has copy and print shops, and does photocopying, printing, and typing.  She works from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm.   With this work she moves her children forward.  She wants to grow her photocopying business.  She requests the loan to buy wholesale paper.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale paper.

loans.name: Enjeresha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Violet is the facilitator of the Enjeresha group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and ensure food security for the family. 

With income from the maize sales, Violet will pay her loan and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Enjeresha group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells matooke (a Ugandan stew made with plantain, beef and fish) from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last nine years. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van and to build rental houses and educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

May Ann has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

May Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, May Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 28-year-old business woman. She lives in Juba. She is divorced and has three children between the ages of 3 and 8. All of them go to school.

Christine runs a grocery business and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach of Finance Sudan‘s loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to buy food items for sale like onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables. Other than her business, she has no other source of income.

In five years' time, she is hoping to build a good house and pay for her children to school. 

Her major challenges include high commodity prices and the lack of some items in the market.

Christine says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale like onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables

loans.name: Lutaso Youth Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is the facilitator of Lutaso youth group. Carolyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Carolyne takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Carolyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 26 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Carolyne was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Carolyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance

With income from maize sales, Carolyne will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing

In 2012, the members of Lutaso youth group will each plant maize plots on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Erdenegerel

texts.en: Erdenegerel is 53 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter is employed. She started her grocery retail business in 1997 with a small shop. Now she has decided to rent a counter in the market, which is a big step for her. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "Now that my daughter is old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Fatou est une femme de 43 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est gérante d’un salon de coiffure.  Elle fait  en meme temps  du petit commerce.  En plus elle évolue dans le milieu du théâtre.  Elle  a choisi son  métier par passion.  Ce qui lui plait le plus c’est l’encadrement qu’elle assure à ses élèves. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone ou est localisé son salon, de coiffure depuis mars 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévu pour l’achat de mèches, greffages, et autres produits divers qu’elle  va revendre à sa clientèle. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité sont utilisés pour soutenir sa famille mais aussi pour moderniser son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Fatou is 43 years old and lives in Senegal. She runs a hair salon and is also a small retailer. She is also active in the theatre. Fatou chose her line of work because she felt an affinity for it. What she loves the most is giving her students a good foundation of knowledge.

She has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since March 2006 and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that she can buy hair extensions, hair weaves and other products to sell to her customers. She uses the profits from her business to support her family and modernise her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy hair products for resale.

loans.name: Mouroussiatou

texts.fr:
Mouroussiatou est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un tapissier. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Mouroussiatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment,elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Mouroussiatou a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mouroussiatou voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mouroussiatou is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a tapestry craftsman. She has two children.

Mouroussiatou has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells grain to clients at home. She purchases her stock in Anié. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties. Mouroussiatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase grain. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Mouroussiatou would like to increase the size of her business. She says that she plans to use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grain for resale.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem is a responsible mother who has spent most of her life working in the agricultural business in the Prey Chor district. She has lived there with her husband and 3 children for ages. Most of her main income is made from farming. Presently one of her daughters is married and works in a shoe factory in Phnom Penh city. Her husband always assists her on the same farmland to raise the whole family. Together, they typically earn approximately $2.50 per day. Mrs. Kem now is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL to pay for local laborers harvesting and threshing her rice crops. In the future, she will own a general store from her house and sell many kinds of merchandise to satisfy the people in her commune.

loans.use: to pay for local labors harvesting and threshing her rice crops.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 43 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, he sells mainly passion fruits.  He has employed two people in this business.  He also practices dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business with his previous loans.
Elijah has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and happily lives in La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a pure farmer. She helps her husband generate revenue to sustain the daily needs of the family and for the education of her children.

She is in the agricultural business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this business for 3 years. She earns about 2,050 PHP a month doing this type of work.  

She joined GDMPC to gain financial assistance to help engage in business activities and requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy banana fertilizer for good growth and banana sprouts to plant. 

She hopes that her business will be successful, because she plans to buy a motorcycle to use for banana delivery.

loans.use: to buy banana fertilizer and banana sprouts to plant

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is one of the members of the Grupo La Buena Nueva 1, 2, y 3 (The Good New Group 1, 2, and 3), located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and fruits and who also provide services including a Beauty salon, shoe repair, Motor taxi, etc. 

Marcelina is a businesswoman who lives with her husband and  their six children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to serve God. Marcelina is very excited to receive her 8th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her earlier loans, and with each one contributing to growing her business. She has had her business for about four years. She started it with the aim of making money and being useful and that is when she took her first Esperanza loan. She is planning to use her new loan to purchase different styles of clothing.  She plans to use her earnings to help her husband with extra income. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house. 

The group pictures are separated; these three pictures make the complete group of 15.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Suzanne Françoise

texts.fr: Suzanne est une femme de 34 ans célibataire mère d'un enfant . Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail (arachides, maïs, haricot, huile et autres...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera s'approvisionner en mortiers, sacs d'arachides, maïs et couscous et pierre à écraser pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Suzanne is a 30-year-old, single woman with one child.  She is a retailer and has been selling seasonal food products (peanuts, maize, beans, oil, etc) in the market place for five years.  She knows her suppliers very well, and also her customers, who she has built up thanks to her long experience in this business.

Unfortunately, she often runs out of stock because her low level of working capital forces her to sell all her stock before she can afford to replace it.  She plans to use her loan to buy mortars, sacks of peanuts, maize and couscous, and grinding stones.  This will build up her stock levels, enable her to respond to the demand of her customers and avoid her running out of stock.

Suzanne will save her profits in order to expand her business and also to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: P. Lina is a hardworking single mother. In addition to caring for her three sons and two daughters, P. Lina owns a sewing business. She earns about $1.25 per day from her business. Her eldest son and eldest daughter both help provide for the family as well. Her daughter works in a factory and earns $60 per month, and her son earns about $40 per month. P. Lina is requesting this loan of $500 to purchase raw materials to make repairs on their home. She is looking forward to making their home safer and more comfortable for her family. In the future she would like to be able to add fruit sales to her sewing business in order to be able to provide a greater income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make repairs on home.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz has a plot of land, where she grows fruits and vegetables. Solmaz has been in this business for 10 years. 
Solmaz was born in 1948 in Khaladj village, Salyan region. 
She requests  a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Toeafe

texts.en: Toeafe is a young, single mother.  In order to support herself and her child, she opened a shop directly after she finished school.  Her shop is a small general store in her tiny Samoan village, providing the basics to the villagers.  She can earn a steady income stream from her shop, and she takes half of the money from her sales and deposits it into her savings account.  She uses the savings as needed to reinvest in her business and to save for her child’s future.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale at her shop

loans.name: Uryi

texts.en: Uryi runs a business helping people with something very important in Ukraine – keeping warm in the winter. He sells and installs small, self-contained gas heating units that work very well with the traditional hot water heating found in many buildings in Ukraine. Not only do the units provide heating, they also can provide hot running water if necessary. Uryi has been in business for six years. He supports himself, his wife Lena, an eight-year old daughter and a three-year old son. Uryi has requested a loan to help purchase a supply of flexible plastic pipe that he uses for installations. He has proven to be an excellent loan client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist him with his business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic pipe

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: At forty-five years of age, Adama is married with four children.  She sells fresh fish and has been in business for a long time but her business was disrupted by the civil war.  Due to lack of sufficient capital, she started again 3 years ago on a small scale.  With her previous loan, she managed to increase her sales and profit but as this is her only source of income, the profit was spent mostly on household expenses.  Adama is now requesting a loan of $200 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Increase fish selling business by purchasing more inventory

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia K. is 35 years old and single, with 6 children to raise. She has a small retail shop called The K. Shop which she has run for the past 9 years. Her shop carries soft drinks, local fruits, sugar, salt, etc. She is able to pay for school fees for her children, rent, medical expenses and other family needs. She plans to use her loan to buy more supplies for her store such as soap, personal hygiene items, rice, sugar and salt. She is a very hard working lady and is determined to pursue her dreams. One day she hopes to be able to build a home for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, personal hygiene items and staples for her store

loans.name: Rachel Julio Dos San

texts.pt:
Rachel is married and mother of 8 children. She lives in the city of Maxixe, in the province of Inhambe. Rachel joined the credit program this years and this is her first loan request. Rachel wants to use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for the chicken she raises and sells. Her sons are studying except for the youngest that is too little to attend school. She wants to help her husband supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rachel é casada e é mãe de 8 filhos. Ela vive na Cidade de Maxixe, na provincia de Inhambane. Rachel entrou para o programa ainda neste ano. O valor que ela vai tomar é o 1º empréstimo. Rachel para além de fazer negocio ou negociante, ela é trabalhadora. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de ração e vacina dos seus fragos antes da venda. Os filhos da Rachel estão a estudar a excepção dos mais novos que ainda não tem idade. Ela pretende ajudar o seu marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: To buy foor and vaccines for chicken

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, in the Kurdmakhmudlu village. He was born in 1952; he is married and has four children.

Tahir buys calves to fatten for sale; he has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
Maria Haydee E. M. is a young wife, she has three children, two of whom are studying primary school. This woman´s business is a general store. She has had the business since she was young. She tells us that the business began when her husband had an accident at work and was put on disability. She tells us that it was very hard at the beginning as she had no idea how she was going to support their children. At one time she had worked in the fields but she realized that work in the city was very different from work in the country.

Maria Haydee´s general store has been gradually growing as she has been working with CEPRODEL over the past 4 years. She feels quite satisfied with the loans granted as they have come at very opportune moments, helping her to supply her business and helping the family's economic situation. She has a record of 6 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Haydee E. M., es una joven casada, tiene tres niños dos de ellos están en estudiando su primaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven tiene este negocio, nos comenta que el negocio lo comienza cuando su esposo tuvo un accidente en el trabajo y por tal razón lo pensionan. Nos comenta que fue muy duro el inicio de su negocio ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, en un momento de su vida ella trabajó en el campo pero se dio cuenta que el trabajo de la ciudad es muy diferente al trabajo del campo.

La pulpería de la señora Maria Haydee ha venido mejorando gradualmente a medida que ha venido trabajando con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y de la situación económica en que se encontraba su familia, ella tiene un record de 6 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase goods for a general store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edita A. is a 36-year-old woman who is married to Emilio Gonzalez. Together, they have five children, most of whom are in high school. The husband and wife pair work together in their small business selling various goods.

Now they want to invest in a new variety of goods, including tennis shoes, fans, blankets, and sheets. They are hoping to buy a vehicle that will help them to expand their clientele and to look in other places for goods.

loans.use: To buy tennis shoes, pants, fans, blankets, and sheets.

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mr. You K. is a 63-year-old widower who lives in Trapeang Krapeu Village, Kampong Cham Province. He makes $1.50 per day as a farmer. His daughter, You Kunthea, earns $2 per day cutting wood in a factory. K. asks for a $200 loan to purchase pigs to raise and to grow sugarcane. He hopes this loan will help him expand his business and improve his ability to support his family. The photo is of Mr. K. and his daughter Ms. You Kunthea.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and to grow sugarcane

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
A. Mary sells charcoal and red oil. She is married and has 3 children. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, wife of Mr.E., is the mother of five beautiful children. The eldest son is in 9th standard. The third son is in 2nd standard. Her husband works in a workshop. She is a housewife and does household work. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan. She took a loan for her son and made a rickshaw. Her son drives a rickshaw and supports the family. Now she applies for a loan for her husband to start his welding workshop. She hopes to make a profit from this loan that she can use to better her sons' futures.

Razia B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. Safia B. wants a loan to start a grocery shop. Nazia B. wants a loan to buy a paint machine. Shazia B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem T., age 53, is a widow and lives with her five children in Phnom Penh. She makes approximately $2.50 each day, making Khmer cakes. Four children are married and no longer live at home; the last child is a garment worker. Now Kem would like a loan of $200 to purchase more rice to make Khmer cakes. This is a good way to increase the amount of cakes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make Khmer cakes.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a hard-working mother and grandmother who looks after the welfare of her family; she works extremely hard at her restaurant. In the morning she prepares the delicious dishes that are offered at lunchtime. The competition is very difficult in their area so the only way to be successful is best flavor; Luis is winning on this front, but more than that she likes to have her restaurant looking attractive and welcoming, thus enticing the customer. The amount she is asking for is 800 soles; she hopes that you can help her cope with the stiff competition in a healthy and honest manner.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre y abuela que vela por el bienestar de los suyos, por ello trabaja arduamente en su restaurante, durante las mañanas se dedica a preparar los deliciosos platos que ofrecerá a la hora del almuerzo.La competencia es muy reñida por su zona, por ello que la única que forma de sacar ventaja es por la sazón, y en eso Luisa lleva la delantera, pero además de eso, le gustaría ambientar su local para que se vea más atractivo y acogedor, y así aumentar la clientela.El monto que requiere es de 800 soles, espera que usted le pueda ayudar a hacerle frente a la dura competencia, de una manera sana y honesta.

loans.use: Implement and improve the appearance of her restaurant.

loans.name: Hayakuwa's Usawa Group

texts.en:
Hayakua is a widow with 2 children aged 18 and 6. She has sold charcoal and clothes (khanga) since 2003. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Hayakua now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and khanga for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with owing a shop, selling perfume, clothes and shoe sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Marcela Guilherme

texts.pt:
Marcela Guilherme C. é natural de Maputo e tem 26 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 8, 5 e 2 anos respectivamente, sendo que a maior estuda na 3ªclasse. Assim sustenta apenas 4 pessoas. Vive numa casa própria.

Marcela estudou até 7ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições para custear os estudos. Nasceu e viveu com os pais e aos 8 anos divorciaram e ela teve que viver com a madrasta e assim a vida lhe foi muito difícil muito cedo tive que dedicar se ao negocio para sustentar se.

Marcela é negociante tem um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 8 anos, tem dois empregados e abre das 8:00 às 19:00h, aprendeu a fazer este trabalho num salão de Cabeleireiro como empregada durante dois anos. Para alem de venda de produtos de Beleza e serviços vende produtos de primeira necessidade onde destaca o amendoim que vende o copito por 10,00mt cada onde um quilo cabe 5 copitos.

Marcela tem um rendimento diário de 1500,00mt e poupa mensalmente 5000,00mt. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com amigas que já eram clientes. O seu Maio sonho é ter uma viatura para facilitar o seu negocio nas compras e vendas.
texts.en:
Marcela Guilherme C. is a native of Maputo. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of three. The children are 2, 5, and 8 years old, and the oldest is in third grade. Marcela supports four people and lives in her own house.

Marcela studied through 7th grade and then did not continue because she could not afford to pay for her studies. She was born and raised by her parents for 8 years, at which point they got divorced and she had to live with her stepmother. Live became very hard; very early on she had to work to provide for herself.

Marcela has been in business for more than 8 years, and she has two employees. Her salon is open from 8am to 7pm. She learned this trade by being a hair salon employee for two years. In addition to selling beauty products and services, she sells some basic necessities. Among these, peanuts sales are big; she sells them for 10 meticais (MZN) per cup (five cups make up one kilogram).

Marcela makes 1,500 MZN per day and saves 5,000 MZN per month. This is her first loan from Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner). She learned about Hluvuku by talking with friends who were already clients. Her big dream is to have a vehicle to facilitate buying and selling supplies for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock for her salon

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr: Né en 1980 dans le village d’Amégnran, Monsieur A. Messan réside actuellement dans le même village avec sa famille. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Ayant abandonné très tôt ses études, il a appris la conduite, métier qu’il exerce avec passion. Avec le souci d’avoir son propre véhicule pour pouvoir réaliser plus d’économie, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés lui permettront de mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille avec une amélioration des conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in the village of Amégnran, Mr. Messan A. presently still lives in that same village with his family. He is married and the father of 2 children. Having left off his studies very early, he learned to drive, work he performs with passion. Intent of having his own car to use as a taxi so as to be able to save more, he is requesting a loan. The earnings he will make will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a taxi

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr: A. Zénébou est née en 1957 à BEMBEREKE dans  le Nord du Benin. Elle est mariée à ISSIAKA Abdoulaye, agent des forces armées béninoises à la retraîte et a trois enfants dont elle n'a plus la charge. Elle n'a pas fréquenté à cause du décès prématuré de sa mère. Depuis son jeune âge, elle revendait divers articles à savoir savons, fruits et autres. Elle alla en apprentisage de couture et  reçut  son diplôme de fin d'apprentisage. Parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier, elle a commencé  la vente de farine d'igname, de conserves, de pâtes alimentaires et d'autres produits de grande consommation. Elle sollicite ce prêt de 180000f d'une durée de 12 mois pour rehausser le niveau de son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en maïs et ignames.
texts.en:
Zénébou A. was born in 1957 in Bembereke in northen Benin. She is married to Abdoulaye Issiaka, a retired Beninese armed forces agent, and she has three children, none of whom are in her care anymore. She was unable to attend school thanks to the premature death of her mother. Since her youth, she has bought and re-sold various items such as soaps, fruit, and so on. She began an apprenticeship as a seamstress and received her diploma at the end of her apprenticeship. While working at her job, she also started selling yam flour, canned goods, food pastes, and other consumer goods. She is asking for this 12-month loan of 180,000f to raise the level of her business. She intends to supply herself with maize and yams.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of maize and 3 bags of yams

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
El señor Facundo S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  Pasankeri, ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Elsa Pérez y sus dos hijos.
El señor Facundo trabaja como albañil en obras de construcción particulares, su esposa se dedica a las labores de su hogar.
Su vivienda solo cuenta con dos habitaciones, por lo que el señor Facundo realizará la construcción de dos habitaciones que complementarán la vivienda y les dará mas espacio a sus hijos.
El crédito será para la construcción de la estructura para las dos habitaciones en planta baja.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Facundo S. lives in his own house in the Pasankeri neighborhood, which is located on the west side of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, señora Elsa Pérez, and their two children. Facundo works as a construction worker, and his wife is a housewife. Their home only has two rooms, which is why Facundo will build two more rooms onto their house, which will give more space to their children. This credit will be used for the construction of the frame of two rooms on the ground floor. This is the fourth time that he is requesting a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies him favorably for access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two rooms onto his house to give more comfort to his family

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.es: Doraliza tiene 29 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda en sus propósitos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, así como también, zapatos y otros accesorios, prendas que deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás. Doraliza trabaja muy duro con la sola intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego crecer con su  negocio, ya que más adelante quiere tener su propia tienda. Y como lleva a vender sus prendas por los caseríos (zonas rurales de los distritos) le va muy bien, porque es la única persona que les lleva ropa por esas zonas. Comprometida a ser responsable con sus pagos, es la primera vez que trabaja en un banco comunal y con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada. Con el dinero solicitado alquilará un local para implementar su tienda de ropa, también comprará más prendas para seguir con su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Doraliza is 29 years old and a mother of 3 school-going children. She lives with her significant other who supports her with her purpose. She sells clothes for children and adults as well as shoes and other accessories to clients who pay by installments or cash. She has been doing this for the past 2 years. Doraliza works very hard in order to help her children get ahead and to make her business grow as she wants to have her own store in the future. She sells her clothes in the hamlets and she does very well as she is the only person selling in these areas. She is commited to be responsible with her payments as this is the first time she works with a community bank and with MFP and therefore she is very enthusiastic. With the loan she will rent premises to set up a clothing store and she will also buy garments to go on with her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent premises for business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret T. is 41 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Margaret loves sellingCurrently, all her kids are in school. She lives with her family in Bawjiase community, near Accra, the capital city of Ghana, in a family house. She works very hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband sells hardware.

Margaret loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains a daily source of livelihood. She has been selling cassava for seven years to support her family. Cassava is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in people's diets. It is mostly used in preparation of local dishes like “fufu” and “banku”.

Margaret takes delivery of goods from farmers who provide her with direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who would buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to purchase cassava in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her kids'n schooling. Margaret is a member of a community group called "Maranatha Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase cassava in bulk

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.en:
Egamberdi S.  is a gentleman who dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock. Egamberdi is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today, thanks to his example, are working adults. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this reason he is seeking a loan of $700to purchase cattle to sell. Egamberdi is grateful to everyone supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria S. se dedica a la compra de variedad de panes en varias panaderias para revenderlo en diferentes comunidades, ella tiene 20 años de hacer esta actividad, anteriormente no se dedicaba al este negocio al 100% porque ella tenia la ayuda de su esposo, pero el fallecio y le ha quedado sola salir adelante con su negocio en el cual le va muy bien pero necesita comprar mas pan ya que las ventas son muy buenas y se queda sin producto rapido y ella quiere extenderse mas por otas comunidades, ella es madre de 5 hijos, 2 de ellos son jovenes y los otros 3 son de edad menor, asi ella tuvo que dedicarse a tiempo completo al negocio y como su esposo en ocasiones la llevaba a vender el producto ella se aprendio las rutas y asi sale adelante, ella ahora posee dos carros repartidores, ella lleva uno y sus hijos jovenes le ayudan con el otro.
sus hijos grandes en estos momentos no estan estudiando ya que estan dedicados al negocio al 100% pero ella quiere que estudien para que se graduen de la unversidad.
ella sale a vender su producto en diferentes comunidades y minicipios del depto de El Paraiso.
texts.en:
Maria S. buys a variety of bread in various bakeries and resells it in the villages. She has been in this business for 20 years. She used to be involved part-time because her husband also helped. However, since his death she has had to get by alone.

The business is doing well but she needs to buy more bread as sales are very good and she sells out rapidly. She wants to extend the business to other villages.

Maria has 5 children (2 are teenagers and the other 3 are younger). As a result, she had to devote herself to the business full-time. Since her husband occasionally took her out with him, she learned the sales routes. Now she has two delivery vans; she drives one herself and one of her teenage sons drives the other.

Her older children are not studying at the moment since they work full-time in the business. However, she wants them to study and obtain a university degree.She sells her products in various villages and towns in the El Paraiso department.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy white bread, pan de semita, cinnamon bread, and other breads

loans.name: Ayoola

texts.en: Ayoola is 47 years old and married with 4 children. He is a tailor. He has 3 sewing machines and 1 weaving machine. He is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sew more clothes for his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ema Victoria

texts.es:
EMA VICTORIA C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”, 
su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Walter S/N Mz. A Lt.6, cerca al “Aserradero Ezcurra”, en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Clara, en el distrito de Manantay, tiene 49 años de edad.  Ella tiene una bodega instalada en su propia casa; su esposo trabaja en la aserradero Ezcurra y tienen 7 hijos.

Ella tiene 3 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos de consumo básico para vender en su nueva bodega, ubicada en su propio domicilio. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, lo cual invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros. 

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya con créditos financieros, que permiten mantener y ampliar los productos que ofrece en su bodega, contribuyendo económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
EMA VICTORIA C. R. belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Productivas” (Productive Women). Her home is located at Jr. Walter S/N Mz. A Lt.6, close to the sawmill Ezcurra, in the Asentamiento Humano Santa Clara, in the district of Manantay. She is 49 years old. She has a shop installed in her own home; her husband works in the sawmill Ezcurra, and they have 7 children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 3 years, and the first loan that she received was for the amount of S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to buy basic grocery products to sell in her new store, located in her own home. With this loan of S/ 1,000 Nuevos Soles she would invest in the purchase of basic grocery products like rice, sugar, vermicelli noodles, among others. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because of the help with the financial loans, which permit her to maintain and increase the products that she offers in her store, contributing economically to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vermicelli, toilet paper, salt, milk, etc.

loans.name: Kely Betty

texts.es:
La señora Kely Betty R. C. tiene 37 años pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen y vive en el sector de Cochaya en el caserío de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta sexto ciclo de educación superior pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos.
Se casó de 25 años y aun no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña bodega.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas compró fertilizantes para agricultura.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará víveres para su bodega (arroz, azúcar, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas).
Kely desea comprarse una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Señora Kely Betty R. C., 37, belongs to Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen and lives in the Cochaya area, Salpo district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She studied up to her sixth year of secondary education, but was not able to finish because of lack of economic resources. She married at 25 and has no children yet. Her principal business is selling groceries in a small shop. Her first loan of $105, repaid in 4 installments, was for agricultural fertilizer. With this loan of $275, which will also be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy supplies for her shop (rice, sugar, candy, and soft drinks). Kely would like to buy herself a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her shop (rice, sugar, candy, and soft drinks)

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es: Javier es soltero, de 25 años de edad, trabajador del Super San Antonio como vendedor, con 3 años de servicio, habita solo en su casa, esta solicitando el credito para utilizarlo en la construccion de una tapia de un costado de la casa, pues ya estan construidas las de los otros lados, su interes es darle mayor seguridad y privacidad a su vivienda, pues esta proximo a casarse y desea darle mayor comodidad a su futura esposa.  Javier cuenta con ingresos adicionales, pues tiene un taxi trabajando que le genera ganancias.
texts.en:
Javier is single and 25 years old. He works at the San Antonio Supermarket and has three years of experience there. He lives alone in his house. He is requesting the loan for the construction of one side of a wall to protect his house house since he has already built the other sides. His goal is to make his house a more secure and private place. He is getting ready to married and wants to give his future wife a secure and private home so that she will be comfortable. Javier relies on the extra income that he receives from a taxi that he owns. (Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of a wall to protect his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth and other accessories for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is a 30 year old woman.  She is a single parent of one child who is currently in school.  Rebecca is a serious minded business woman who works hard to support her child.  She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. 

Rebecca deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use a loan to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.use: Buy supplies to sell.

loans.name: Vaidullo

texts.en:
S. Vaidullo is a 53-year-old. He is married and has a child. Vaidullo owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. His wife (pictured) and son help him with his business.

Vaidullo, being engaged to this business for more than 15 years, has enlarged his clientele and has many constant customers. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to increase his stock. Vaidullo is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  foodstuffs to expand his little store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar cosmeticos

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Erlinda es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Erlinda vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 3 veces por semana, y de las ferias compra quesos que vende a sus vecinos.
Erlinda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
El sueño de Erlinda es alquilar un local para tener una tienda de venta de ropa.

loans.use: Para la compra de pantalones.

loans.name: Jama Khan Group

texts.en: Jama Khan is the group leader of Jama Khan group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to expand the business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 56000 Afghani. Jama Khan wants to take a loan for his car parts shop. Amana wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Abdul Hamed and Fatama want to take a loan for their carpet weaving business. They are very thankful for Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is a widow and has five dependants. She has received senior high education.  Elizabeth sells palm oil, coconut oil and palm kernel oil at Elmina, which she has been doing since the year 2000. Elizabeth uses her income in payment of school fees and settlement of utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more of her oils for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more of her oils for sale.

loans.name: Okoro

texts.en: P. sells babythings; she has been in this business for years now. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more babythings to sell.

loans.name: Genevieve G.

texts.en: Genevieve G. C. is from the village of Taboc Norte. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Genevieve owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Genevieve joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina A. is from the village of  Tagoloan, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina ownsand operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sao Men Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 16 people who live in Kruos village in TaK. province.  Each person has a different purpose for their loan.  Sao M. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables.  His wife is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Sao M. decided to request for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and fertilizer to support his rice field.  He is 57 years old and the father of three children.  Two are enrolled in the local school while another is a silk weaver.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Wainah Group, Jinja

texts.en: Jesca M. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a married lady with 4 school age children.  She also takes care of other dependents. Jesca sells manufactured clothes from Jinja as well as making clients’ clothes to order. Jesca is also a farmer with a plantation and cows that give her milk for sale every day. She also has a fridge from which she hopes to start selling cold drinks.  Although this contribution may seem very small, it can help pay for some family needs. Jesca needs a loan to be able to stock more new clothes for the Christmas season.
