loans.use: Buying new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Leslie Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Leslie es cliente antigua anteriomente ya trabajo dentro de uno de los Bancos de Emprendimiento llamado Pagando en Fe y Amor luego por razones de tiempo dejo el grupo, pasado a ser parte de uno de nuestros clientes individuales, durante todo este tiempo se ha podido evidenciar no solo el crecimiento de la cliente a nivel personal, sino tambien el del mismo negocio.  
La señora se dedica a repartir prendas de vestir tales como pantalones, blusas, chompas, carteras,etc. en oficinas del centro de la ciudad donde ella ya cuenta con un numero determinado de clientes.   
La cliente vive en casa familiar en el que ocupa un departamento de manera conjunta con su mama y su pequeño hijo; entre ambas se encargan de la manutencion del hogar.  El Proposito del credito es el de comprar una cantidad mayor de prendas de vestir para poderlas comercializar en estas fiestas de Navidad y fin de año.
texts.en:
Doña Leslie is a long-time client who previously worked with one of the Communal Banks called “Pagando en Fe y Amor” (Paying in Faith and Love). She later left the group and became of our individual loan clients. Not only has she grown on a personal level, Leslie has also developed in her business during this time.

She is a clothing distributor, selling items such as pants, blouses, sweaters, handbags, and other items. Leslie visits several offices downtown where she already has several established customers. She lives in an apartment with her mother and her young son. Both she and her mother are responsible for maintaining the household. Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of clothing to sell during the Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Dalia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 01 hijo, ya independiente.

Dalia, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y regalos, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en local alquilado, muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y hoy que le esta yendo muy bien. Cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de regalos, para toda ocasión.

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Dalia, 38, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is single and the mother of one son, who is independent. Dalia is a persevering and capable woman. She sells clothing and gift items in a rented, well-equipped space where she tends to her customers; to date, she has done very well. She has regular customers that know her and her business. Her characteristic strength and perseverance helped her to grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of what she has accomplished. With this 1700 sol loan she will buy more clothing items like, pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, short-sleeve shirts and dresses for girls and adults to stock her store. Part of the funds will be used to buy gift items for all occasions. She feels that she is an established and hard-working woman and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the opportunity it has given her to develop both as a woman and as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and gift items to stock her store.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en: E. Azimjon is 34 years old and is married with two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like sweets (candies), meat products, preserved food, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Azimjon is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Azimjon admits that he has benefited a lot in the past three years from his relationship with IMON International. Financial assistance he has received has helped him to grow and expand his business. Currently Azimjon is requesting a loan of $2,800 USD to increase his stock. Azimjon is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen D. tiene el negocio de venta de ropa en el departamento de Masaya ofreciéndolo todos los días a las personas y de esta manera busca la manera de obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.

El crédito lo ocupará para invertirlo en el negocio y así comprar la ropa para ofrecerla. Es importante que ella  antes de tener el negocio estudiaba y luego empezó el negocio con un pequeño capital y después lo incrementó y así poco a poco ha ido trabajando, ella es soltera y vive con sus padres que les ayuda en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Carmen has a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest into her business and be able to procure more products to offer her customers. Carmen used to study but had to stop to help out her parents with the business. She started the business with few funds, but, with a previous small loan, she has been able to expand the business. Carmen is single and lives with her parents. Carmen runs the business with her parents. Together they want to ensure success for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trousers for men and women, shirts, paintings, makeup and other products.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime K. is 19 and married with 1 child (1 year-old).  She is starting a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Menime needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Menime joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Menime's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Menime K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.7 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mr. Meas S. and his wife are local village cultivators. His wife is shown in the photo. Meas S. earns a living growing different kinds of crops on his own farmland, located away from his house. He has eight children: five are married and the others are single. Four of the children are employed at a variety of jobs. Meas S. needs a loan to buy more farming supplies for his business. He is hopeful that he will benefit from higher income following the loan request.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies for his business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine P. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis oriental. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, For more than two years, Geraldine has owned and operated a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The business's income comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community, and helps Geraldine earn approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Geraldine's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nasreen Naz's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Naz is 40-year-old married lady. She lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is a hard-working lady. She operates her embroidered shawls (garment for head and shoulders) selling business. She purchases the shawls from different cities (Faisalabad and Lahore) and sells them in the community. Her business gives her income of Pak Rs. 8,000 in every month. Her income gives her confidence to lead her family into betterment. 

Her husband's name is M. I. and he has a fruit-selling business. He sells fruit in different areas on his four-wheeled cart. He purchases the fruit from fruit markets. He has been doing this work for over 6 years. 
 
Nasreen is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully completed three loans with Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time for a loan to purchase seasonal fruit to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Sabali  est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou quatrième  (région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Sabali vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 46 ans et au moins 7 enfants. Elles ont une expérience solide dans le commerce  d’articles divers  avec la vente de condiments,  de tissus et  de bijoux. 
Ces femmes sont à leurs 7ème  prêt de groupe avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Quant à l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, Kadia T. compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, à Bamako 1 balle de pagnes wax contenant 50 pièces  pour les revendre à San, en détail en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Tandis que Madame Kadia T. espère sur un bénéfice de 23.500FCFA par mois les autres membres du groupe eux comptent sur un bénéfice de 21 000FCFA par mois.
Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, venir en aide aux familles et réinvestir dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed of married women of the city of Tènè, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members live in large traditional families, and they average 46 years of age and have at least seven children.  They have solid experience in commerce selling a variety of goods: condiments, cloth, and jewelry.  These women are on their seventh group loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Each of their preceding loans have been repaid with any difficulties at all.  As for the use of this new loan, Kadia T. plans on using hers for buying, in Bamako:  a bale of wax pagnes  (colorful West African cloth) containing 50 lengths to be sold retail in San.  She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men.  While Kadia hope for a profit of 23,500 francs CFA per month, the other group members are counting on a profit of 21,000 francs per month.  This profit will be used for repaying the loan, helping out their families, and reinvesting in the enterprise. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Yung

texts.en: Yung S., 25, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 5 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable materials for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting recyclable materials

loans.name: Tonkolili Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tonkolili” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu S..  Isatu is about 38 years of age and she was born in Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer and her children are attending school – two in secondary school and two in primary school.  For many years now, Isatu has been selling market food – rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onion, fish, pepper, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, Maggi cubes, onion, fish, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel runs Tavsi General Shop where he earns his income.  He has been in business for five years and is happy because of his improved living standards.  Emmanuel joined a group called Minds Together and as the name suggests, the group members share business ideas.  They also guarantee each other's loans, therefore he can easily get a loan from Faulu Kenya.  He previously serviced two loans through the group. This has helped him invest in his business, hence raising his living standards.  He has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add stocks of sugar, cooking fat, soaps and sweets.  He hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, cooking fat,detergents and sweets

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg R. is 42, married, and the mother of a one son. She lives with her mother in a house, which her mother owns, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, Enkhmend, 26 years old, lives in another town in Ulaanbaatar. Altantsetseg started a shoe trading business by purchasing products in Ereen, a Chinese border city, in 2006. Since Altantsetseg started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her children's education fees.

Now she operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. After years of successful operation, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs. She is an open and very hardworking person. She is requesting a 1,780,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to purchase cement to build a foundation for her own house.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and to purchase cement to build a foundation for her own house.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive el lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica al tejido, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa con ayuda de su hija, las chompas que realiza son de muy buena calidad por lo que tiene clientes fijos y estables y cada cierto tiempo le solicitan este trabajo bien elaborado. Sabina no se queda  solamente con realizar tejidos, pues siempre esta al pendiente de nuevas oportunidades  de negocio como por ejemplo la venta de desayunos frente a una universidad, con ello tiene un aporte adicional a su economía. Esta tan entusiasmada con el trabajo, su mayor anhelo en este negocio es producir mas cantidad de prendas de vestir a base de lana tejida, para ello desea comprarse una maquina de tejer. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de lanas de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Sabina is 46-years-old. She's a widow and she lives with her 3 daughters in her own house. For more than 10 years she's been a weaver, an activity which she does in her home with the help of her daughter. The sweaters that she makes are very high quality, which is why she has loyal and stable customers who solicit her elaborate work on a regular basis. Sabina doesn't stop at weaving. She's always on the lookout for new business opportunities like, for example, selling breakfast foods in front of a university, which supplements her income. She's so enthusiastic about her work that her greatest desire in this business is to produce a greater quantity of woven wool garments. For this purpose she wants to buy a loom. This is her third loan with MFP and she's very happy to know that she has financial support because she's always been responsible with her payments, and, furthermore, it gives her pleasure to be a part of her local communal bank because all of its partners are responsible, supportive people. She's thankful to those who will participate in this loan that she's asking for, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of wool of various qualities and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of wool of various qualities and colors

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a dedicated and hard-working farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been operating her mixed farm for over 30 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, and beans which she sells locally. She depends on the income from her farm to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Rosemary is 52 years old and married. She has seven children between the ages of 13 and 29 five of whom are still in school. She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take care of her family's basic needs. She however faces the challenge of fluctuation in market prices and changes in climate conditions that affect the cost of poultry feed. She hopes to increase her milk productivity and enjoy more income. She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chhoen's Group

texts.en: Thirteen members make up this village bank loan group. Mr. Chhoen Y., who was born in 1956, was selected as the village bank president. They are from Boeng Krum Leu village, Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion for different purposes. Mr. Chhoen Y. and his wife, Mrs. Phany Ol, raise pigs at home. In order to support this business, Chhoen Y. will use the loan to buy piglets to raise and pig food. Aside from being a farmer, Chhoen Y. is also carpenter. With both occupations, they are able to earn a small profit to support their family. The couple has four children who are all seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and for pig food.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en: Davaanyam H. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and seven year old child in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter, Nuutshanhusel, attends a local elementary school while his wife is currently unemployed. Davaanyam operates a taxi service. He started driving a taxi in 2004 and has found success. He usually makes 6 round trips a month between Hentiy and Ulaanbaatar with 5 passengers, and earns a revenue of 12,000 MNT from each passenger. His transportation expense is 20,000 MNT for each trip. He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and also to operate his business sustainably. Davaanyam hopes to trade in his car for a larger vehicle that can increase his business profits. He is a helpful, honest and hardworking man. He needs funds to pay for his new truck as well as to winterize his house; therefore, he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To buy a new truck and to winterize his house

loans.name: Abishyizhamwe No 10 Group

texts.fr:
Florien Harindintwali, naquit à Ruhuha  l’Est du Rwanda, elle a 45 ans, il est marié et il a 7 enfants, son ainé a 22 ans et son cadet a 6 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha-Bugesera. 5 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABISHYIZEHAMWE NO 10,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Florien et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un deuxième prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les felitilisants de leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Florien Harindintwali, 45 years old, was born in Ruhuha, East province of Rwanda. He is married with seven children; his eldest son is 22 and his youngest is 5. He finished primary school. He lives with is family in Ruhuha-Bugesera. Five of his children go to school.

He belongs to a solidarity group named Abishyizehamwe No.10; the group members are rice farmers and guarantee each other’s loan. Florien and his group work in order to support their families, improving their life conditions and paying school fees for their children. The group has taken out a second loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to purchase fertilizers for their field. After harvesting, one part of the produce is sold and the other used by the families.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María Angela tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el sector Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, situado en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la preparación y venta de comida en un bar – picanteria situado en la zona donde vive. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos y al buen trato que ofrece a sus comensales. Su esposo trabaja fuera de la región y constantemente le envía dinero para garantizarles el sustento. Aun así ella continúa trabajando en esta actividad para ayudar a mantener la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos e ingredientes, los cuales le permitirán preparar más platos de comida y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer emprededora que día a día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y verlos progresar. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer emprendedora y de confianza.
texts.en:
María Angela, 33, is married and lives with her two children in Pacanguilla, Pacanga district, Chepén province, La Libertad region, located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

For the last three years she has prepared food for sale at a pub-snack bar located in her area.  The business is well received because her dishes are very tasty and her customer service is kind.  Her husband works outside of the region and send her money to insure her support.  Even so, she continues working to help sustain the family.

María wants to expand the business buying more ingredients and supplies that will make it possible for her to prepare more dishes and increase sales.  To reach this goal she needed to request her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is an enterprising woman who daily struggles to support her family and see them succeed.  In the area where she resides people who know her hold her in high esteem and consider her to be an enterprising, trustworthy woman.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Jacquelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jacquelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jacquelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacquelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan that Jacquelyn has taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
PIMA  est un regroupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles ont   une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et de 3 enfants et résident à Massabla-coura, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt AWA K., compte acheter des colis d’habits pour femmes, hommes et enfants auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
PIMA is a group of four women, all married and living conjugally in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  They are 25 years old on average, have an average of 3 children, and live in Massable-coura, a prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the  Republic of Mali).  They know one another through commercial ties.  With the intention of buying more products, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  They are on their second group loan, having paid back the last in full.  With this loan Awa K. expects to buy packets of clothing for women, men and children as well as maternity wear.  She will sell for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.
With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, a part of which she will use for her business and the rest for the educational costs of her children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Verónica Leidi

texts.es: Verónica Leidi M. O. de  37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, con quien reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad. La señora Verónica posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Verónica no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Verónica espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en: Verónica Leidi M. O. is 37 years old.  She lives with her husband in Colón, in La Libertad department.  Verónica has a store in which she sells perishables and convenience store goods.  Her store is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business as she currently doesn't have enough money to do so.  It is very important both for herself and her husband since it is her business which covers their family expenses.  Verónica would like to stock her store with products such as detergents, canned food, bread, candies, drinks and other products which are basic essentials in the home and most requested in a store.  Verónica hopes to improve her profits and thereby be able to lead a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items to stock her store

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude B. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children. All of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother's son ).     Gertrude has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for less than one year.  She works 7 days of every week.  Gertrude has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.  She will use it to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income by renting rooms.
The main business challenges for Gertrude include defaulters and seasonality challenges.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and build more rental rooms .   Gertrude lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication .

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar,cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita de 29 años de edad, vive con su mamá y sus hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender tortillas, ha construido un rancho cerca de su casa para elaborar las tortillas junto a su madre, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Ella quiere comprar una plancha nueva y para realizar la compra solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con ahorros suficientes para alcanzar a adquirir esta plancha. Esto le permitirá hacer más tortillas y continuar trabajando por su hogar.
Su sueño es crecer a sus hijos sanos con lo necesario para que puedan estudiar y prepararse además de crecer en el negocio y contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Margarita is 29 years old, she lives with her mother and with her children, aged 5 and 3, in the the city and region of San Miguel. She sells tortillas. She has set up a place near their home where she makes tortillas with her mother. 

She wants to purchase a new press and to make the purchase she needs a loan as she doesn't have enough savings to be able to make the purchase. This will help her make more tortillas and to keep working to support the household.

Her dream is to raise healthy kids with everything that they need to go to school. She also dreams of making her business grow and to have a larger client base.

loans.use: To purchase a new tortilla press.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Horm R. has been planting rice for a long time and she is a low-income person who presently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She and her husband have spent most of their life time farming on their own farmland which they inherited from their grandparent. This couple has only one child  who works as a construction worker, and he shares his income with them to use for whole family’s needs. Currently, her son goes to his work place by riding his old motorbike. But now his motorbike has broken down. To solve this problem, Horm R. will use her loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La Sra.  Elvira  esta casada, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 2 años dedicándose a la venta de material escolar en el mismo lugar donde se encuentra su domicilio, vive en casa de sus suegros desde hace 5 años. La Sra.  Elvira también tiene en su local un teléfono público que atiende todos los días al igual que su fotocopiadora que le falta algunos repuestos para ponerla a funcionar nuevamente. Doña Elvira se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta mayormente en estas épocas del año ya que pronto empezaran las labores escolares, con el dinero del crédito comprara  Material Escolar(Cuadernos, hojas bon, bolígrafos, lápices, carpicolas, tajadores, mercadería para surtir su negocio) y arreglo de fotocopiadora, es cliente nueva de la institución y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elvira is married and has two children.  For two years, she has been in business selling school supplies from her home.  She has lived in her in-laws' home for 5 years.

Elvira has a public telephone on her premises that she provides service with every day, as well as a photocopier that needs some repairs as it is not working right now.  Elvira had to request a loan from our institution because she has a lot of demand at this particular time of year as the school year is due to begin shortly.  Elvira will use her loan money to buy school supplies: exercise books, paper, pens, pencils, glue, pencil sharpeners and other merchandise for her business.  She will also use some of the loan money to have her photocopier repaired.

Elvira is a new client of our institution and she is grateful for the support that she has been offered.

loans.use: To buy school supplies: exercise books, paper, pens, pencils, glue, pencil sharpeners and other merchandise to stock her business.  To have her photocopier repaired

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama CAMINO AL ÉXITO. Esta ubicado en Temascalcingo, Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. L. señora María D. los Angeles R. es una D. las integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió L. primaria, es casada y aún mantiene 3 hijos, 2 niños y una niña. ElL. tiene viviendo en L. comunidad 11 años y se dedica a L. venta D. dulces y bordado D. servilletas, estas actividades las inicio hace 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para comprar telas e hilos para surtir su negocio. Sus clientes comentan que sus costuras son mejores en cuanto al diseño y creatividad, se sienten contentos y satisfechos D. poder contar con el tipo D. trabajo que ofrece L. señora. Al solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente agradecida y comprometida a seguir solicitando crédito para poder cumplir con sus metas y consolidar su negocio. María desea elaborar servilletas a gran escaL. para tener un ingreso más amplio que le permita brindarle a sus hijos una educacion D. calidad  y brindarles una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called "Camino al Exito" [Path to Success].  It is located in Temascalcingo, Mexico.  There are 11 members of the group.

María D. los Angeles R. is one of the members of the group.  She is 47 years old, went to primary school, is married, and has three children (two sons and a daughter).  She has lived in the community for 11 years and has worked selling sweets and embroidered napkins for one year.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase fabric and thread to supply her business.  Her customers say that her sewing is the best in terms of design and creativity and they are happy and satisfied to be able to count on the type of work that she offers.  She is grateful to be asking for this loan and she is committed to continuing to ask for loans to be able to meet her goals and build her business.  María wants to make napkins on a larger scale to earn more income in order to proviD. her children with a quality education so that they can have professional careers.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 55 years old, lives in the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Myrna also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She also manages their sari-sari store, where they sell canned goods and other products.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase 3 piglets, feed, and farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase 3 piglets, feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Veronica Teresa

texts.es:
Verónica de 42 años, es una microempresaria que trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  Comenzó su negocio vendiendo sandalias, ropa poco a poco fue incrementando la mercadería. 

Ahora se dedica a vender helados y ropa en la casa de su mama  para tener más ingresos y ayudar a los gastos familiares. Vende cada helado a $ 0.25 y sandalias a $ 12.00. Su esposo le ayuda en los gastos de la casa trabajando como taxista. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio pero por ahora quiere adecuar su vivienda comprando con el préstamo cemento, bloques. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Verónica, age 42, is a micro-entrepreneur who works every day from 7am to 9pm. She started her business by selling sandals and clothes, but over time she increased her inventory of merchandise.

Now she sells ice cream and clothing from her mother’s house in order to earn more income and help with the family expenses. She sells ice cream for $0.25 and sandals for $12.00. Her husband helps with the household expenses by working as a taxi driver. Verónica has many aspirations for her business, but now she needs to remodel her home. She will use this loan to buy cement and blocks. In the future, she wants to build a better house.

loans.use: To purchase cement and blocks for home renovations.

loans.name: Altamirano Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama “Altamirano”, es D. la comunidad D. San Pedro, San Felipe del progreso, el grupo lo integran 13 mujeres trabajadoras, las trece son casadas tienen su familia y son amas D. casa, pero también se dedican a criar animales como puercos, borregos, pollos y guajolotes,  lo hacen con la intención D. obtener ganancias y ayudar cuando se pueda con los gastos ya sea con los hijos en la escuela o con la despensa en la casa, también porque no trabajan y desean invertir parte del tiempo en algo que sea productivo y puedan apoyar a su esposo para que juntos salgan adelante con todas las necesidades que actualmente se tienen. La comunidad D. San Pedro  es una D. las comunidades mas avanzadas del Municipio, se cuenta con todos los servicios públicos como agua y drenajes, hospital, escuelas, gasolinera en fin es muy completa, y también es una comunidad que tiene mucho profesionista y muchos niños estudiando. El grupo decidió “Altamirano” porque es un nombre que les pueD. traer mucha suerte a todo el grupo, ya que es el nombre D. una parte D. Chiapas y también D. un escritor importante por eso llevan ese nombre. Los nombres D. las trece integrantes son:
1.-Concepción M. Mejía, tiene 30 años
2.-Carolina Sánchez Ramírez, 29 años
3.-Valentina B. Q. 40 años
4.-Maria Jacinta D. Jesús V. 56 años
5.-Elvira Sánchez R. 42 años
6.-Gabriela Solís García
7.-Paula R. G. 32 años
8.- Patricia Cruz Gutiérrez 33 años
9.-Guadalupe Q. Solís 20 años
10.-Victoria R. G. 25 años
11.-Yolanda B. López 47 años
12.-Teresa B. Q. 31 años
13.-Ana Rosa Severa S. 24 años.
La representante del grupo se llama Carolina, tiene 3 hijos, sus tres niños estudian la primaria, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, acaba D. terminar su propia casa, con lo que ella podía ayudar con la venta D. sus animales y lo que su esposo gana hicieron su casa, aun hacen falta varias cosas pero es un gran paso el que dieron con su casa,  su esposo trabaja en un taxi, sale desD. muy temprano y regresa en la noche D. trabajar, doña Carolina se dedica a la cría D. borregos, nos platica que le va bien criando los animales porque le dejan ganancias los animales y no se le hace difícil cuidarlos y criarlos, todo lo contrario, el préstamo va beneficiar mucho porque va comprar borregos ya que en este momento no tiene, los que tenía ya los vendió y se quedo sin invertir, también es un bien para la familia ya que va tener ganancias para después ocuparlas en la casa para irla arreglando.  La meta que tiene es poder terminar bien su casa que no le haga falta nada y mejorar la calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group, called “Altamirano”, is from the community of San Pedro in San Felipe del Progreso. The group is comprised of 13 hardworking women. All 13 are married. They have their families and are housewives, but they are also involved in raising animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens, and turkeys. They do this to obtain income and to help when they can with expenses, whether for their children in school or the needs of the household. Also, because they don’t have full time jobs they want to invest part of their time in something that is productive and that supports their husbands so that together they can progress, getting all the necessities of life that they currently need.

The community of San Pedro is one of the most advanced communities in the municipality. It has all the public services, like water and drains, a hospital, schools, and a service station. In short, it is very complete and is also a community that has a lot of professionals and young students. The group decided on the name Altamirano because it is a name which can bring a lot of luck to all its members since it is the name of a part of Chiapas and also of an important writer. The thirteen members are:

1.-Concepción M. Mejía, age 30 2.-Carolina Sánchez Ramírez, age 29 3.-Valentina B. Q., age 404.-Maria Jacinta D. Jesús V., age 56 5.-Elvira Sánchez R., age 42 6.-Gabriela Solís García 7.-Paula R. G., age 32 8.- Patricia Cruz Gutiérrez, age 33 9.-Guadalupe Q. Solís, age 20 10.-Victoria R. G., age 25 11.-Yolanda B. López, age 47 12.-Teresa B. Q., age 31 13.-Ana Rosa Severa S., age 24

Carolina is a representative of this group. She has 3 children who study in primary school. She lives in a common law relationship with her husband. They have just built their own house, and she can help out by selling her animals. What her husband earns will pay for the house. Though they lack several things having the house is a big step. Her husband drives a taxi, leaving very early and returning late.

Doña Carolina raises lambs. She tells us that her business is doing well because it brings in income, and it is not difficult to care for the animals. The loan will bring great benefit because she is going to purchase lambs since, at the moment, she doesn’t have any. She sold what she had and the family needs income after building the house. Her goals are to be able to finish their house so that it lacks nothing and to improve her family’s quality of lif

loans.use: to buy lambs.

loans.name: Flores El Campo Group

texts.es:
Doña Dorotea Pricilia T. G. es casada, tiene 50 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 esta estudiando educación primaria, se dedica a la venta D. articulos D. consumo diario en una tienda, tiene 10 años D. experiencia con el negocio, inicio gracias al deseo que tiene D. superarse, como  también el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder  solicitar un préstamo, que le servirá para utilizarlo para ampliar su capital D. negocio para la comprar: gaseosas, golosinas, arina D. maiz, frijoles en lata, jugos en lata, galletas, jabón, azucar, pastas dentales, dulces, embutidos etc.

Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades que S.: Tienda en general, venta D. comida, bordado D. blusas, confección D. blusas, falda y playeras, y a la crianza D. animales. Esperan alcanzar su objetivo D. superación con el préstamo que estan solicitando a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Doña Dorotea Pricilia T. G. is married and 50 years old. She never had the chance to study. She has 6 children, 1 of whom is studying in elementary school. She works selling articles for daily consumption in her store. She has 10 years of experience in this business, and began thanks to her desire to rise above. She is supported by her husband, who works in agriculture. 

She decided to organize a group to be able to ask for a loan, which would serve to allow the members to invest in capital for the purchase of items for a store, such as soda, candy, corn, beans, juice, cookies, soap, sugar, toothpaste, sweets, sausages, etc. 

The other members of the group work in diverse fields such as a general store, food sales, embroidering blouses, sewing blouses, skirts and jerseys, and taking care of animals. They hope to reach their goals of rising above with this loan that they are requesting from ASDIR.

loans.use: to buy soda, candy, corn, beans, juice, sugar, cookies, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Dany Justina

texts.es:
Dany es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad.  Es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar.  Tiene estudios de  secundaria incompleto.
Es socia del Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos hace 3 años,  su primer préstamo  fue  de        S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizó para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, lo cual consiste en la venta de plantas medicinales  - productos naturistas.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará hierbas como acompuri, chanca piedra, uña de gato, achote, mano yupa, etc. Sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio. 
 Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio  y abrir otro local de venta de productos naturista.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, compartir ideas con las socias y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Dany is a member of the "Flor de Canela" community bank which is located in Puno district and department.  She is 43 years old, single, and has four school-age children.  She did not complete high school.

Dany has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to increase her business merchandise.  She sells medicinal plants - natural products.

Dany will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy plants such as acompuri, chanca piedra (stonebreaker), uña de gato (cat's claw), annatto, mano yupa, etc.  Her children help her in her business.

Dany's dream is to improve her business and open another sales location for selling her natural products.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings, sharing ideas with her fellow group members and earning money on her savings.

loans.use: to buy plants such as acompuri, chanca piedra (stonebreaker), uña de gato (cat's claw), annatto, mano yupa, etc.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Bomintzha Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LOS ANGELES DE BOMINTZHA  debido a que la mayoria de sus integrantes son muy apagados a  cuestiones religiosas, para ellos un “angel” es aquel que cuida, protege y guia por el camino del bien, es por esta razón que decidieron llamarse así, la finalidad de ellos es cuidarse y protegerse unos a otros en los momentos dificiles por los que puedan pasar. Estan ubicados en Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Juana G. H es integrante del grupo. Tiene 36 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 varones. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inicio desde hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia  con los distintos proveedores que actualmente la atienden y de esta forma hacer crece su negocio. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al credito recibido piensa ampliar el local en donde se ubica su tienda debido a que la demanda que comienza a tener es cada dia mayor, asi como la exigencia en la variedad de productos por peticion de sus clientes, ya que de esta forma ella piensa obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Ángeles de Bomintzha" (The Angels of Bomintzha) because most of its members are very much devoted to religious matters.  For them, an 'angel' is someone who cares for people, protects them and guides them down the right path.  This is why they named their group as they did, as their goal is to care for and protect each other during difficult moments that they might experience.

The group is located in Hidalgo, in Mexico, and has 10 members.  Juana Gerrero H. is a member of the group.  She is 36 years old, studied up to senior high school, is a saleswoman, and has three children: 1 daughter and 2 sons.  She owns a grocery store which she set up three years ago.  Juana is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise from the different suppliers that she currently uses.  In this way, she will grow her business.

At the moment of requesting this loan, Juana feels excited because, on the basis of this loan, she is planning to expand her store premises.  She will do this because her customer demand is growing every day and her customers are requesting a greater variety of products.  In this way, Juana plans to make more profits which will enable herself and her whole family to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 69 años, vive en unión libre vive con la compañera y con el hijo que en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura tiene dos cuadras de terreno en donde siembra papas trigo, cebada, arveja y zanahoria tiene 4 ovejas y dos cerdos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la comunidad.

Le gusta salir a pasear y festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Juan is 69 years old and lives with his partner and son.  They live in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

Juan is a farmer.  He has just over three acres of land where he sows potatoes, wheat, barley, peas and carrots.  He also has four sheep and two pigs.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda market and his sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for his animals.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working in his community.

Juan enjoys going out for walks and celebrating Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for his animals

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El sr. Fernando oriundo de la localidad de el Torno, su actividad es la explotación de áridos en el rio Pirai desde hace mucho tiempo, trabaja con su padre, a quien ayuda y de ahí aprendió el oficio, es un joven con ganas de superación el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una moto para poder transportarse hasta su fuente de trabajo, el Sr. Fernando esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder obtener una moto y tener otra fuente de ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fernando is from El Torno.  He has worked extracting river rock from the Pirai River for a long time.  He works helping his father and that’s how he learned the occupation.  He is a young man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle to use to get to work with.

Fernando is grateful to our firm for having trusted them and provided support to get a motorcycle to have another source of income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fanny compró materiales como suelas, pegantes y capelladas, elaboró sandalias y respondiò a sus encargos con su anterior credikiva. Ahora como va a hacer una bodega para almacenar sus productos y necesita espacio para ampliar su taller, acuD. a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprarà materiales para la adecuaciòn locativa y  materias primas, para fabricar sandalias eso si en un  espacio mas còmodo, porque tiene nuevos pedidos D. sus clientes. Fanny manifiesta que "se encuentra D. maravilla y agradecida con Dios por contar con esta entidad y espera seguir contando con ella para que su negocio siga creciendo.". Si usted quiere conocer la historia D. Fanny ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/211193
texts.en: Fanny used her last Kiva loan to buy soles, glue, etc. so that she could meet the demand from her customers for the sandals that she makes.  Now she wants to improve her workshop.  She is applying to Kiva for a second loan that she will use to buy construction materials for the workshop plus the supplies she needs for making sandals.  The improved space will allow her to more easiily fill new orders.  Fanny says that "it's marvellous and I'm very grateful [for Kiva].  I hope to continue working with them to grow my business.".  If you want to know more about Fanny's story, go to: http://kiva.org/lend/211193.

loans.use: to buy materials for improving her workshop and supplies for making sandals, both for her sandal-making business.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 35 years old and is married with two children aged 7 and 11 years of age. She has a store selling foodstuffs and items such as body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans and cassava flour. Her business is well organized and she employs two people to help her. She has three years of experience and her business is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more foodstuffs and items such as body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans, cassava flour, etc. for sale.  With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans, cassava flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel se dedica  a la carpintería, ella  empezó  desde  muy chica, su papá también es carpintero y su carpintería se llama "Antonio", que es el nombre de su hijo el mas chico de tres años de edad.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar más material  para no atrasarse en sus pedidos por falta de materiales.
Raquel  va todos los sábados y domingos  donde vive su hermana para que le cuide a su hijo, ya que, esos días los necesita para sacar los pedidos que  tiene para no perder a sus clientes ya que a ellos les gusta su trabajo.
Además de la carpintería Raquel siembra maíz en su terreno alrededor de la casas de sus papás.
Recibió préstamo de otro  banco  para  invertirlo en su milpa  y vender en las localidades  vecinas.
Raquel es madre  soltera  de treinta cuatro años de edad .  Ella solamente  estudio  segundo año de secundaria. Quiere  que su hijo tenga mas oportunidades cuando este mas grande  para   cumplir sus sueños.
Su sueño más  grande es  incrementar más su negocio  para  tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por apoyo que les ha dado para realizar  sus sueños.
texts.en:
Raquel is a dedicated carpenter. She began when she was very young – her father was also a carpenter -- and her carpentry shop is called “Antonio,” the name of her young son, who is 3 years old. Raquel is requesting a loan to buy more materials to avoid falling behind in fulfilling customer orders for lack of materials.

Raquel goes every Saturday and Sunday to her sister's house so she can care for her son, since these days, Raquel needs to work every day to fulfill the customer orders she has, and avoid losing clients who like her work.

In addition to carpentry, Raquel sows corn on the land surrounding her parents' houses. She received a loan from another bank to invest in her corn field and she sells the harvest in neighborhood localities. 

Raquel is a 34-year-old single mother. She only studied to the 2nd year of secondary school. Raquel wants her son to have more opportunities to fulfill his dreams when he grows up.

Raquel's biggest dream is to increase her business in order to have a better quality of life. She thanks Fundacion Realidad for its help in realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy material to fulfill orders at her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with two children. She is 57 years old and lives in Ozamis City.

Thelma runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Thelma joined PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio, a 46-year-old married father of six school-aged children, has been a farmer for 21 years, primarily growing rice crops to sell. He earns about 10000 PHP per month from his business and is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs to help improve his business.

Herminio hopes for his children to finish their studies and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 41 años, es un hombre ejemplar. Hace poco sufrió el abandono de su esposa y ahora vive junto a sus 2 queridos hijos: Guillermo Kevin y Víctor a los cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Alianza. A pesar de los problemas que afronta, Guillermo sale a trabajar con ahínco para sacar a sus hijos adelante. El arduo trabajo que realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de cacao, café, palta, naranja y demás cítricos han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad en esta última campaña de maduración. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar solo, pero eso lo contrarrestará con la contrata de peones que le ayuden. A pesar de contar con sus propios terrenos recultivo el desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción, y así obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además agradece al poyo brindado. Guillermo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y cítricos para comenzar a realizar viveros.
texts.en: Guillermo, 41, is a model father.  His wife abandoned the family recently and he's been left alone to raise their 2 children: Guillermo Kevin and Victor.  They live in the town of Alianza.  Despite the problems he faces, Guillermo is working hard to make a better life for his children and he's proof that hard work pays off.  He recently harvested a bumper crop of cacao, coffee, avocados, oranges and other citrus fruits, all of good quality.  Harvesting his crop is what he likes best about farming because he can collect on his hard work.  Guillermo has farmed for 21 years.  The hardest thing about it, he says, is having to do most of the work himself and, consequently, he hires temporary labor to help him.  He owns his farm, but he would like to buy more land so that he can increase his production and, in turn, his earnings.  Guillermo belongs to the "Alianza al progreso" community bank and this is his fourth MFP loan.  He relies on the bank and knows that he has to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.  He says, too, that he's grateful for the support that he's received from the bank.  Guillermo will use this loan to buy coffee and citrus plants for his next crop.

loans.use: to buy coffee and citrus plants for farming business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de cuartos, también la socia trabaja en venta de productos de belleza y también vende ropas interiores, la socia por medio de estos negocios independientes saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de alquiler de cuartos, el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también el negocio de venta de ropas interiores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pinturas y hacer pintar los cuartos, para comprar productos de belleza y ropas interiores al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORIMANCACHA”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Senora Felicia. She is single and has 3 children. The member divides her time between daily activities and her room renting business. She also sells beauty products and underwear. The member, by means of these  independent businesses, manages to raise her children. The member wants to expand and improve the room renting business, her beauty products business as well as her underwear selling business. The member is asking for a loan to buy paint to repaint the rooms, buy beauty products and underwear wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy paint to repaint the rooms she rents out and to buy beauty products and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Abdel Mottaleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children.

Abdel Mottaleb has had a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to expand his business and to add more foodstuffs. He aims to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To expand his business and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as beauty products and office supplies

loans.name: C18006 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Marie Golette is 45 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Abahuje". Marie Golette is the first person of this group. She has been in this business for about two years and employs two persons to help her. The business hours are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Marie Golette and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more clothes. If successful, Marie Golette and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyles.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dena

texts.en: Dena is a 27-year-old woman. Her husband is employed by a company that pays him a decent salary. Dena has a grocery store near her house. She wants to purchase some groceries to sell, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for what she needs. She is taking a loan of 2,000 USD from FATEN. When Dena gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have more variety of goods to sell. This will enable her to attract more customers and increase her sales in order to increase her income. Dena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed here instead of her.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a young father of 28 years old. He has two infant children. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he engages in maize farming and sells vegetables to generate income. Sometimes they experience financial difficulty, but through the support of their parents they can survive. He aims to improve the business to increase their income, to satisfy their needs and save for the future of their children. They want them to become professionals in the future so that they will not be like him, with no stable job.

Despite the hardships of farming, Henry aims to expand his maize plantation to have a plentiful harvest. He is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy maize seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and to pay the labour costs needed for planting maize. He mentioned that this loan will be a great help to him to improve his maize plantation. He is hoping that someday, he will become financially stable and support his own family.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay labor costs required in planting maize

loans.name: Savana Muungano Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Savana Muungano Group in Western Kenya! Melisa is the facilitator of the Savana Muungano group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Melisa takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Melisa had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Melisa was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Melisa and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Melisa will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Savana Muungano group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a farmer based in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is married and has four children, all adults save for the last child, who is still in school. 

She has been in farming for 17 years and produces wheat, milk, potatoes, and maize among other cereals (grains). Her produce goes to the local market. She also operates a cereals retail business in the local market. Her cereals are sourced from her farm as well as other farmers.

Anna has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her milk production and income, which she will also use to improve her cereals retail business and pay for the education of her last born child.

Anna laments the high costs of farm inputs and poor prices for the products.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат молодой женатый мужчина,кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 года. Он водитель пассажирского микроавтобуса на городской маршрутной линии и имеет очень ответственную профессию.После нашего информирования он узнал о нашей услуге и ему пришлась кстати это поддержка. Потому,что его микроавтобус часто требует ремонта и непредвиденных расходов,но под рукой нет постоянно наличных денег и он обратился к нам за поддержкой. С тех пор Фуркат непрерывно сотрудничает с нами и очень доволен нашими услугами. С его слов он намного улучшил свои жизненные условия, экономя свои ресурсы. Намерен в будущем на прерывать свой стаж кредитования и пользоваться нашими услугами. За период сотрудничества он также привлек несколько хороших клиентов в Арванд.
texts.en: Furkat is a young, married man, who has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009.  He is a driver of a passenger minivan on a set municipal route and has a very responsible profession.  After hearing our information, he learned about our service, and this support became very timely for him.  Because his minivan often needs repairs and unforeseen expenses, but Furkat does not always cash to cover these, he came to us for support.  Since then, Furkat has been regularly partnering with us and is happy with our service.  According to his own words, he significantly improved his living conditions by saving his resources.  Furkat intends to continue maintaining his credit history and using our services.  Throughout the period of working with us, he also referred several good clients to Arvand.

loans.use: to repair his minivan

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 20 years old and is single. He owns a boutique where he sells goods such as lotion, soap, and toothpaste.  He has had his business for five years and works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.  He currently employs one person to help him.

Etienne has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more inventory for his shop such as lotion, soap, and  toothpaste. If he makes any additonal profit as a result of this loan, Etienne plans to reinvest it in his business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as lotion, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely, 32-years-old is married with 3 children. She lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte: Philippines. 

Emely operates a service-based business providing motorcycle services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Emely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emely hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Sandy Diana

texts.es:
Sandy es una mujer de 26 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padre y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su padre, Sandy se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sandy trabaja como empleada del hogar, ella brinda servicios de limpieza, lavandería y cuidado del hogar, Sandy trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sandy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de inscripción y matricula en su centro de estudios, de esta manera Sandy podrá continuar cursando su carrera profesional, así pues Sandy seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Sandy is a 26 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago with her father and brothers. She is a friendly person, hard working and enthusiastic. She is very motivated to improve her life. Thanks to her own efforts and the support of her father, Sandy is studying a professional career in Business Administration. In her free times, she likes to watch television and at times she cooks a delicious meal, called Arroz on Pollo (rice with chicken) to share with her family. 

On her own initiative, and through a lot of hard work and dedication, Sandy works in domestic services; she cleans, does laundry and takes care of homes. Sandy works every day from the early hours of the morning and continues for around 6 hours. She believes that everything is going well for her because of her dedication and because she treats her clients well. 

Sandy is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva because thanks to their help, she will be able to cover tuition costs at her school and she will be able to continue working to get her degree. And so, Sandy will continue to work and pushing herself to achieve her dream as a professional.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her studies.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
My name is Adela, I am married and have three children ages 10, 8 and 7 years old. I work in a convenience store all week. I started and have been working in the store for the last 8 years, I sell mostly food and also sell prepared snacks such as chicharrones, frituras and candies.

My biggest accomplishment is that i build my house and my goal is to grow my business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for my convenience store, I can get better prices and increase sales.

loans.name: Mario Cesar

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mario has more than 29 years selling pewter stoneware and he was born in Monterrey. He knew this business when he fell in love with his wife years ago, because his wife’s parents were doing this activity. When he was young he worked and when his job ended, Mario sold his house to stock the pots and frying pans.
