Actually in Monterrey there is no production of this kind of pots, which is why he must travel to the Saltillo city located in Coahuila to purchase his merchandise. He needs a loan for $475 and he will repay in 6 months. A very good season is coming because in September his demand increases so he needs to be prepared with merchandise. He has a store in the farmers market in which he sets up every weekend and as a complement of his activity he also sells natural products with a little help from one of his daughters.

SPANISH

Mario tiene más de 29 años de dedicarse a la venta de loza de peltre, él es originario de Monterrey, N. L., y esta casado.Conoció el negocio de la loza de peltre cuando se hizo novio de su esposa, ya que los papas de ella se dedicaban a esta actividad, y siendo aun joven, trabajaba y al terminar su jornada salía a vender casa por casa las ollas y sartenes. Actualmente en Monterrey se dejo de producir este tipo de vasijas, por lo que tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Saltillo, Coahuila para abastecerse de mercancía. A la fecha ocupa un crédito por la cantidad de $5,000 a 6 meses, pues se avecina una buena temporada, ya que desde el mes de septiembre la demanda de ollas tamaleras se incrementa, por lo que necesita estar preparado con suficiente mercancía. Tiene un puesto en el Mercado campesino en donde vende los fines de semana y complementa su actividad con la venta de productos naturales, con el apoyo de una de sus hijas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is very energetic and is experienced in making brooms. She’s a single mother of three sons. Telesia lives in a small open Samoan house with her sons. All the three sons are attending district school, and they love their mother so dearly that they always rush home after school to help their mother put together brooms. On Saturdays, all her sons used to walk around the village to sell these brooms. Some days they wouldn’t be able to sell a single broom, so Telesia would send her eldest son to the market in the city of Apia to sell the brooms. One day Telesia was overwhelmed when she received a letter from a well-known business women in Samoa asking her to sign a 3-year supplier’s contract. Telesia is overjoyed that she has found herself a market, instead of her sons walking under the heat of the sun to sell her brooms.

loans.use: Buy a set of knifes and rubber for tying brooms

loans.name: Tuleiga

texts.en: Tuleiga’s husband is a good Engineer and can fix lawn mowers and other light machinery. Tuleiga and her husband have two lawnmowers, and they earn their living by mowing lawns. Tuleiga enjoys this business because it is good exercise, even though the sun can get very hot when she works. Tuleiga is requesting a loan so she can purchase another lawnmower and a second-hand car for transportation. This will enable her and her husband to do more business.

loans.use: To purchase a new lawnmower

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She is married and has five children, the youngest being 16 years old. Her husband is a carpenter. Nonetheless, his salary is very low and they are not able to cover their children's school expenses. Since she wanted her children to finish school so that they can have access to a better future, Ana started selling natural products. When she started she had very limited selection. Since she noticed there was plenty of demand for her products she decided to extend her business.

Ana Maria is requesting a loan of US $650 in order to increment her inventory to provide her clients a better service. She commits to repay this loan within six months. Be an important part of this business' growth and help Ana's children finish their studies, they will thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales el menor es de 16 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, sin embargo, el salario que recibe era muy bajo y no se cubrían los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, ella desea que ellos puedan culminar sus estudios para que tengan acceso a un mejor futuro, para esto Ana inició con la venta de productos naturales, cuando empezó tenia muy poca mercancía y al ver que la demanda por sus productos se incrementaba, decidió ampliar su negocio.

Para poder incrementar su surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Ana Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a que los hijos de Ana puedan terminar sus estudios, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.en:
My name is Maria Pastora and I have a small business selling used and new clothing from a stall located in the city center. I have been in business for several years and generate enough income to pay my suppliers and cover my living expenses. I am a single mother and senior citizen. Thanks to this business I am able to support myself, which makes me happy because I still feel strong and have a desire to move forward with my life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria pastora, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada y ropa nueva, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para mi sustento diario, lo que me satisface porque todavia me siento fuerte y con deseos de salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and their six children in his father in law's house in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. His main occupation is the manufacturing of shoes. He has received two previous loans, which he used to increase his sales and has paid off in full.

He has a workshop and employs a helper. He's requesting this loan to buy more raw materials, hire more employees, expand his workshop and as a result, increase his income. His credit history qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan tiene 38 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos en la casa de su suegro en la calle 12 de octubre de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de calzados. Los dos créditos que le fueron otorgados eran para incrementar sus ventas, actualmente están cancelados. El tiene un taller y trabaja con un empleado y el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas materia prima contratar mas empleados, agrandar el taller y mejorar sus ingresos. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima H.  is 55-year-old married woman who owns her small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. She an is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Fatima started her business in 1994. She purchased her first calf, raised it and sold for a higher price. Fatima used to have a milking cow also and she sold dairy products such as milk and yoghurt to the local people  But the cow become ill and passed away. Recently Fatima purchased one calf, which soon will grow up to be a milking cow. 
Fatima has large family, two sons and one daughter. The level of their life is hard to call even normal. They are close to misery. Fatima is trying to find ways to change the situation and one decision was apply for a loan and expand her business. She applied for 800 USD with repayment term of 15 months to purchase three calves; two baby calves each for 250 USD and one middle size calf for 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: “I am Amir M. and I moved to Vehari after I got married about three years ago. Now that my husband and I have a child, I have to help him generate income. I have the ability to sew clothes and can get work sewing for many small stores in town. I need a loan to purchase a sewing machine, thread, and some other materials so that I can establish my business. I used to sew before I got married but gave it up. Now I would like to pick it up again.”

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Mayra Carina

texts.es:
The selling of prepared meals is a business which is very important because there are many people who, for certain circumstances are unable to eat in their homes, so they have to buy food from establishments that have a good reputation and that they can trust. In Chichigalpa, Mrs. Mayra Carina A. P., runs such a business and has the reputation of of being an excellent cook who offers a variety of many different dishes to her clients.

She began her business 10 years ago because she needed to care for her elderly parents, and through the years has been improving her business by offering a variety of dishes. Her need now is to procure the ingredients to further develop the delicious dishes that only she knows how to prepare. It is for this reason that Mrs. Mayra has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with the loans because they have been provided in a timely manner. And have helped her meet the daily needs of her business and her customers. She has a record of 25 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy importante ya que son muchas las personas que por determinadas circunstancias no tienen la posibilidad de comer en sus hogares sino que compran sus alimentos en lugares de mucha confianza y reconocimiento. En Chichigalpa, la señora Mayra Carina A. P. se dedica al negocio de venta de alimentos y se ha caracterizado por ser un excelentísima cocinera brindando diversidad de platillos a todos sus chelines.

Inicio su negocio hace 10 años con la necesidad de atender a sus ancianos padres y a través de los años ha venido mejorando su negocio ofreciendo diversidad de platillos. Su necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de los ingredientes para seguir elaborando los deliciosos platillos que solo ella sabe preparar. Es por tal motivo que doña Mayra trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 25 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase top quality products for her business. (Compra de materia prima para el negocio.)

loans.name: Evenecer En Cristo Group

texts.en:
Dilia J. is a gracious 35 year old woman who lives in Pancho Mateo, a small community in Puerto Plata. Pancho Mateo is one of the poorest communities in Puerto Plata – it is typical to see cardboard nailed to thin metal sheets serving as houses and the use of thin cloth as doors. In midst of poverty, the people remain full of joy and truly love the people they live with. Dilia and her husband raise two children and life has been very hard for them.

Dilia has chronic stomach problems and experiences severe pain but she can’t afford to buy the proper medicine. She currently has her own business selling clothes, shoes, soap, and lotion. Her goals for the future are to have a proper house with a good roof and floor and to have a larger business that makes more money. She wants to continue sending her children to school and she would also like to buy medicine for herself.

loans.use: to purchase apparel and personal care products

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S. is a 45-year-old grocer living with her four children in Sthany Village, Pursat Province and earns around $4 per day. All of her children are still studying in primary school. Her husband, Mr. Nou Bunthoeun, is a 45-year-old policeman and earns up to $3 per day. In order to help her husband support their large family, she is now asking for a loan of $400 to increase her inventory of groceries and to decorate her grocery store. She appreciates Kiva for their support and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan. The photo is of Mr. Nou Bunthorun because S. was at market.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of groceries and to decorate her grocery store

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina E. sells foodstuffs. She is married and has 3 children. Her small shop is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more food supplies for resale.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a food market

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chhorn B. lives in the Rotaing Village of Kandal Province, where he works as a farmer. Mr. Chhorn B. is a 54-year-old married man with four children: two of his children are laborers, while the others are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Lon Von (pictured on the left), is a subsistence farmer. Last year, Mr. Chhorn B.’s children contracted typhoid and, as a result, he had to spend $75 to cure their diseases.

Usually, he cultivates his crops twice a year. In the dry season, Mr. Chhorn B. grows vegetables; unfortunately, however, he does not have sufficient funds in order to buy nets to protect his crops from animals that come to eat his vegetables. Thus, Mr. Chhorn B. is requesting a loan to purchase such nets, and any remaining funds would be used to buy fertilizer for his field.

loans.use: To purchase nets in order to protect his crops from animals, and to stock up on fertilizer for his field with any remaining loan proceeds

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đàm Thị Xuân (Ms 070028), 38 years old, would like to take out a loan to invest in her small grocery store. She is regarded as trustworthy woman by villagers. Her husband is a carpenter. The income is about 2,500,000 VND a month is used to household expense and loan payments. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount of 3,808,000 VND except Nguyễn Thị Hà for 3,360,000 VND.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hà (Ms 070028), 31 years old, applies for a loan to expand her factory.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mắn (Ms 070026), 54 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her small business.
  • Hoàng Thị Miên (Ms 070003), 38 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her refreshment stand.
  • Phạm Thị Thanh Thu (Ms 070024), 38 years old, applies for a loan to buy an industrial grade sewing machine.
  • Nguyễn Thị Vân (Ms 070031), 37 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her fish selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đàm Thị Xuân 38 tuổi(Ms 070028), mức vay 4.256.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Gia đình chị có một cửa hàng nhỏ phục vụ những người dân trong làng.Chị là người có uy tín và được mọi người yêu mến.Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, hai con chị còn nhỏ.Thu nhập từ bán hàng chị tiết kiệm trang trải cuộc sống, một phần trả vốn dần.Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđtháng. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Nguyễn Thị Hà 31 tuổi (Ms 070028),mức vay 3.360.000 vnđ.Chị vay vốn đầu tư mở rộng nhà xưởng Nguyễn Thị Mắn 54 tuổi (Ms 070026), mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ.Chị vay vốn đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Hoàng Thị Miên 38 tuổi (Ms 070003) , mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ.Chị vay vốn đầu tư bán hàng giải khát. Chị Phạm Thị Thanh Thu 38 tuổi (Ms 070024), mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ.Với khoản vốn vay này, chị mua máy khâu công nghiệp làm may tại nhà. Nguyễn Thị Vân 37 tuổi (Ms 070031), mức vay 3.808.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán cá.

loans.use: various small businesses

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura B. is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed so Manzura is the only bread-winner in her family. Manzura sells dried apricots in the local central market. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself. She has been in this business for 8 years already. Dried fruit, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides they are very useful for the health.

Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Manzura's business is quite successful and brings in stable income for the family. Today Manzura is requesting US$ 600 for a term of 7 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the quantity of goods for sale. Manzura expresses her gratitude to everyone who supports her.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots to dry for sale

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty H. has been selling groceries like canned products, vegetable oil, rice, sugar, milk, and others at Siwdo since 2000. Gifty has received a junior high education. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Ram Devi

texts.en: Ram Devi Tamarkar is 42 years old and lives in the Tangal region of Nepal.  She is married and lives with her husband and their two sons.  Rami works alongside her husband in their small hotel, which they opened together ten years ago.  Because the number of customers frequenting her hotel has increased in recent years, Ram is seeking a loan of $425 to purchase materials for improving the quality of the hotel.  She hopes to use the profits to improve the quality of their house and also to provide a better education for their children.

loans.use: To buy materials for a hotel.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme Akouvi A. une femme cultivatrice d’une quarantaine d’année avec deux (02) enfants à charge. Son activité est la culture de mais et de manioc. Cette activité lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face aux dépenses familiales et à la scolarisation de leurs enfants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des engrais en vue d’accroître ses rendements.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi A., a farmer of about 40 who is raising 2 children, grows maize and manioc. This business permits her to help her husband meet the family living expenses and pay the school fees for their children. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer in order to expand her harvests.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Julia vende zapatillas al por mayor y menor, sus ventas son en gran parte a crédito y los realiza ambulatoriamente, reparte a los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados  y por las tardes se dedica a la cobranza, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una tienda estable para vender sus productos y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II (which means Heart of Gold in quechua). Julia is a 52-year-old married mother of 5 children. She sells adult's and children's shoes. Her sales are primarily credit-based. She distributes to merchants of different markets, and dedicates her afternoons to collecting from clients. Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the fairs. Julia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes. Her dreams are to have a permanent stand where she sells her products and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of shoes

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth H. is married to another Kiva borrower, Daniel Adanmitande. Elisabeth has been smoking fish since she helped her own mother with the business. Due to the lake’s pollution, some of the fish must be imported. She also sells palm oil and assorted foods. With this loan, she will buy palm oil in large quantities when the price is low from Dantokpa Market. Elisabeth has 4 children, all educated, ages 14, 11, 8, and 4 years old. She will be 50 years old in November, and this is her first Kiva loan.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of red palm oil

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 23 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo y sus dos hermanos. Se dedica a dar una buena atención diaria a las personas que recurren a su pequeña bodega, negocio que tiene desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo son las conversaciones que tiene con sus clientes y por ello conoce a mucha gente y hace nuevas amistades. Además, le es rentable debido a que es ella sola quien vende estos productos de primera necesidad dentro de su zona y le va excelente. Es su primera experiencia en un banco comunal y con un crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que ha solicitado mandará a ampliar su bodega y comprará más productos para surtirlo mejor.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 23-year-old single mother who lives with her son and her two brothers. She provides excellent customer service to the people who frequent her small general store, which she has had for a year. What she likes about her job are the conversations she has with her customers, which is why she knows a lot of people and forges new friendships. Furthermore, her business is lucrative because she is the only one who sells basic need items in the area, so her business is prospering. This is her first time dealing with a microfinance institute and with a loan from MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she will have her shop expanded and purchase more products to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand general store and increase inventory

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 45 años, vive con su hija de 14 años ya que se separó de su esposo, tiene su casa propia, la cual le costó mucho adquirir. Levantándose a las 5 de la mañana, con los primeros rayos del sol, Antonia comienza su día elaborando ladrillos, este es el negocio de la familia y ya lleva 15 años en este trabajo, que requiere de mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo físico. Ella sabe que su trabajo paga los estudios de su hijo, es por eso que le pone todas sus ganas y lo hace tan bien que sus ladrillos son los más vendidos de la zona y aunque tiene dificultades con la adquisición de los materiales, se las ingenia para tenerlos siempre a la mano y no le falte nada. Este octavo préstamo consecutivo, demuestra la confianza que Antonia tiene en Microfinanzas PRISMA, y sabe que cumplirá con sus pagos como lo hace siempre. Planea invertir el dinero solicitado en la elaboración de sus ladrillos, para de esta manera hacer crecer su producción y brindarle a su hijo una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her 14-year-old son because she is estranged from her husband. She has her own house, which was difficult for her to obtain. Waking up with the first sun rays at 5 am, Antonia starts her day making bricks. This is her family business in which she has participated for 15 years. Her job requires a lot of sacrifice and physical strain. However, she knows that it pays for her son’s education, which is why she gives it her all. She does her job so well that hers are the best-selling bricks in the area. Even though she has difficulty obtaining raw materials, she figures out ways to obtain them and not lack anything. This is her eighth consecutive loan, which demonstrates Antonia’s trust in Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows that she will repay her loan as she has always done. She plans to invest the loan in making bricks so that she can increase production and provide her son with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make bricks

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is currently in the business of selling smoked fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Rose is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has one child, and her child does not go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house for rent

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza lleva 10 años trabajando junto a su esposo la chacra que heredaron de los padres de él. Los productos de la chacra, principalmente palta pero a veces también manzanas y alfalfa, los llevan a Chosica y los venden de ambulantes.
Esperanza recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace 3 años, y eso le ha permitido poder utilizar lo que le sobra de las ganancias que utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de su dos hijas de 11 y 4 años como ahorros para ir construyendo su casa.
A sus 34 años Esperanza planea seguir trabajando su chacra, por que esta es la tradición en su pueblo y hasta ahora le va bien para el cuidado de su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza and her husband have been working the small farm they inherited from his parents for 10 years. They take their produce, mainly avocado but sometimes apples and alfalfa as well, to Chosica and sell it on the street. Esperanza has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for 3 years, which has enabled her to save whatever's left over from her income after covering domestic expenses and the care of her two daughters, 11 and 4 years old, in order to build a house. Esperanza, 34 years old, plans to keep working her farm, since that's the tradition in her village and so far it's maintained her family well.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in insecticides to protect her avocado crop

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Мукимова Ханифа проживает в районе Варзоб. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Возрат 32 года. Муж нигде не работает. Семью обеспечивает сама без чьей - либо помощи. Уже шесть лет занимается торговлей хлебных изделий.Покупает хлеб на заводе и продает на Варзобском рынке. Торговая точка арендуется , но теперь она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить торговую точку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hanifa M. lives in the Varzob region. She is married and has one child. She is 32 years old. Her husband does not work. Hanifa supports the family by herself without any help. She has been selling bread products for six years. She buys the bread at the factory and sells it at the Varzob market. She rents her sales location but plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a sales spot.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sales spot

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
KATIA DOLORES M. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio Nº 441, tiene 36 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como transportista y tienen 4 hijos, todos estudiantes, con excepción del último que tiene 2 años.
Ella trabaja arduamente como vendedora de verduras regionales, se levanta muy temprano (4:30am) . Su actividad la realiza en forma ambulatoria.

Ella tiene 1 año y 8 meses trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar verduras regionales por millar y venderlo al por mayor en Pucallpa (Jr Maya de Brito, cuadra 1) y en puestos afines del Mercado de YarinaCocha.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará verduras regionales al por mayor, manteniéndose así en la actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 8 años.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque siente que puede desenvolverse económicamente dado que puede obtener crédito sin tanto trámite y mantener su negocio, logrando educar así a sus hijos, lo cual la motiva a ser puntual en sus pagos
texts.en:
Katia Dolores M. D. is 36 years-old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are students except the youngest who is 2-years old. She is a member of Banco Comunal "Madres Coraje", and she lives with her husband (a taxi driver) in their home at Jr. 7 de Junio # 441. She works diligently (she wakes up at 4:30am) selling regional vegetables. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year and 8 months, and she used the first loan she received (300 Nuevos Soles) to purchase regional vegetables so she could sell them in Pucallpa (in the first block of Jr. Maya de Brito) as well as in the YarinaCocha market. With this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase more regional vegetables (in wholesale), thereby continuing to run the business she has developed and grown over the last 8 years. She thanks Manuela Ramos because she can obtain credit to maintain and grow her business (so she can educate her children) without unnecessary paperwork and bureaucracy, which motivates her to be punctual in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in wholesale

loans.name: Ela Irma

texts.es:
La señora Ela Irma tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú. Ella estudio Secundaria Completa.
Tiene una bodega en donD. venD. bebidas gaseosas, galletas, golosinas y detergente; el crédito D. Manuela Ramos le ha permitido surtir su bodega, su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
La empresaria recién ha iniciado con Manuela Ramos.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, recibido D. su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invertirá en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Ela tiene como sueño... continuar surtiendo su bodega, así como continuar con la construcción D. los dormitorios D. su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ela Irma is 52 years old and lives in the Florencia D. Mora province of Trujillo, located in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her Secondary School studies. She has a general store where she sells soft drinks, cookies, snacks and detergent. The loan from Manuela Ramos has allowed her to supply her store, and she carries out her business activities from her home. This entrepreneur has recently started to work with Manuela Ramos. With the loan of 300 soles she received from her cooperative bank “United for a Better Future II”, due to be canceled in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Her dream….to continue supplying her store, as well as to complete construction of the rooms in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es: el Sr. Santos R. se dedica  a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera tiene mas de 11 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, su hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan la primaria, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio le permite suplir algunos gastos familiares y compromisos financieros. El credito que esta solicitando es para compra de madera que es la materia principàl para la elaboracion de muebles ya que se aproxima la temporada lluviosa y esto les difulta ya que no cuenta con madera seca, esto hace que no atienda a su clientela, esto le ocasiona perdida de tiempo y de ingresos, tambien cuenta con un molino donde ofrece los servicios de molienda de maiz nixtamalizado , café , maiz para harina , nacatamales , rosquillas ,El es muy conocido en su colonia por ser el un un hombre muy servicial y con deseos de superacion, nos comento que estara muy agradecido con el credito que se le va a otorgar y que va a poder sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Santos R. dedicates himself to making and selling wood furniture; he has been doing this for over 11 years. Santos is married, and is the father of 4 children; his eldest daughter is in secondary school, and three youngest are in primary school. With the income that his business generates he is able to take care of some household expenses and financial commitments. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase wood, which is the principal material used the in production of furniture. Because it is rainy season, it is difficult to acquire dry wood, this causes Santos to be unable to attend to his clientele, and consequently leads to a loss of time and income. He also counts on a mill where he offers milling services for nixtamalized corn, coffee, corn for flour, Nicaraguan tamales known as Nacatamales, and donut rings. Santos is well known in his neighborhood for being a helpful man with dreams of getting ahead of life. He mentioned to us that he will be very grateful for the loan that will be granted, and that he will in this way be able to get his household ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cedar, mahogany, laurel, and pine wood.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Esther M. from Mwanza. She is married with a child 1 year old. Esther has been running a shop since 2008, selling water, soda, eggs, soap, and biscuits. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week,and is assisted by one employee.

Esther currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more eggs, some drinks such as sodas, sugar, and rice. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Esther thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs, some drinks, sugar, and rice for resale

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera A., a 39-year-old food vendor, is married with two children who are currently in school. She trades in beverages, fried eggs and bread on top of a table in the local market. She requests a loan to enable her to buy more tea bags, milo, coffee, crates of eggs and bread to grow her business.  She hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education to give them a future and hope. She sells on the street in the evenings. Vera has been in business for some time now.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Байматова Манзура проживает в районе Кабадияна. Возраст 44 года. Муж развелся, из-за бесплодия Манзуры. Манзура имеет 2 детей. Она более 10 лет проработала учительницей. В данный момент она занимается торговлей национальных материалов. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит просит для расширения бизнеса, она хочет купить сеззоный товар и еще одну точку на вещевом рынке. Клиентка после развода с мужем взяла двоих детей из детского дома. Она хочет, чтобы у детей было хорошее будущее.
texts.en:
44-year-old Manzura B. lives in the Kabadiyana district. Her husband left because Manzura is unable to bear children. After the client divorced from her husband, she adopted two children from an orphanage. For more than ten years, she has worked as a schoolteacher. At the moment, she is engaged она in the sale of national materials, an activity she has similarly been involved in for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business. She wants to buy seasonal goods and yet another booth in the merchandise market. She hopes that her children will have a better future.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Casta Alicia

texts.es: La señora Casta Alicia R. Hernández, tiene la edad de 39 años habita en el barrio Dennis Larios, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos no tiene hijos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Casta desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas por falta de insumos, ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su hermano , los planes hacia un futuro es diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder aplicar al cultivo para lograr una buena producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado lo cual lograra sastifacer sus necesidades con las ganancias, da las gracia ala institución por el préstamo ya que ha logrado mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Casta Alicia R. Hernández is 39 years old and lives in the Dennis Larios neighborhood with her husband, who helps pay for household expenses. They do not have any children. Their future plans for the family are to improve their standard of living. Casta has been working in agriculture for 20 years. The greatest difficulty she experiences is the plagues due to the lack of proper treatments. She began this work with support from her brother and their plans for the future are to diversify the crop. With this loan she is going to purchase fertilizer and inputs to apply to the crops to achieve a better production and sell at a better price in the market. This will allow her to satisfy her financial needs with her earnings. She thanks the institution for the loan since it has already helped improve the crop.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Elmer Lelis

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus tres hermanas menores en el caserío El progreso, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 8 años que llegó a vivir al lugar junto a su familia y, poco a poco, ha salido adelante dedicándose a la ganadería, el cría vacas lecheras, y durante este tiempo su ganado ha ido aumentando gracias a su esfuerzo.

La leche producida por sus vacas la vende a una empresa acopiadora del producto, el es el encargado de sostener a su familia y la ganadería es la única actividad que les provee el sustento diario, por lo que debe trabajar intensamente en mantener a su ganado saludable.

Elmer desea darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sus hermanas ya terminan la educación secundaria y el desea brindarles la oportunidad de seguir algún tipo de estudio superior, para lograr este objetivo el cree necesario ampliar su negocio con la compra de una nueva vaca, es por eso que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan terminar de realizar esta inversión y así poder seguir ayudando a su familia.

Elmer ya tiene 4 años trabajando con nosotros, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable, trabajador y muy emprendedor; es considerado un cliente excelente ya que ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old, single, and lives with his mother and three younger sisters in the village of El Progreso in the district of Lagunas, which is located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Eight years ago, he returned home to live with his family and started breeding livestock. Elmer raises dairy cows, and during this time, his herds have been increasing thanks to his efforts.

The milk produced by his cows is sold to a dairy processing company. Elmer is responsible for supporting his family and raising livestock is the only activity that provides for their daily needs. Therefore, he must work hard to keep his cows healthy.

Elmer wants to give his family a better quality of life. He encourages his sisters to complete their high school education so that they can have the opportunity to pursue higher learning. In order to do this, he wants to broaden his business by purchasing another cow. He is requesting a loan from our Institution in the amount of 1000 soles to that he can continue to support his family.

Elmer has been our client for the past 4 years. During that time, he has proven himself to be responsible, hardworking, and resourceful. He is considered to be an excellent client who has demonstrated punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia A. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Antonia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling smoked coco pulp. This is used for making edible oil; the local process is termed as 'copras'. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Antonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Grupo Chi "perez " Group

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente,  4 años se formaron grupos en chivarreto, con el fin de ampliar sus 						
producción de agropecuario, y  comercio, venta de pañuelos,  o tapetes, todas las personas 						
se conocen perfectamente,  tienen como visión, ampliar sus producciónes y como también ampliar						
sus capital de negocio, las personas,   lo hacen con el fin de poder ayudar a sus esposos, de esa

podrán ayudar a sus espoosos a mejorar los ingresos economicos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida 

y de la misma manera podrán ayudar al desarrollo de sus comunidades y de sus propias de familias.

loans.use: capital de comercio

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née vers 1968 à Bougouni (région de Sikasso), Mariam Diakité est une femme mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle réside dans une famille monogame avec ses  enfants et son époux à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle  s’est  très initiée aux activités de petit commerce avec l’achat-vente de pagnes wax, fanci, de bazins,  de tissus brodés, de chaussures, etc il y a maintenant plus de vingt ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée et appréciée de sa clientèle surtout pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de cinq ans. Elle a bénéficié de Soro Yiriwaso, plusieurs prêts solidaires avec l’association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI Sanoubougou I) et elle est maintenant à son sixième prêt individuel.Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte utiliser ce  nouveau pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 10 pièces de pagnes  fanci et 20 paires de chaussures à  Sikasso auprès des grossistes et à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Elle dispose d’une place à la gare routière de Sikasso où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes mais surtout des voyageurs et transporteurs.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam Diakité, born around 1968 in Bougouni in the region of Sikasso, is married and the mother of eight children. She lives in a monogamous family with her children and her husband in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Since social reasons prevented her from attending school, she became initiated at a very young age to the activity of a merchant of fanci-style pagnes (a colorful West African wax cloth), basins, embroidered cloths, shoes, etc. That was more than twenty years ago. Her customers particularly appreciate the high quality of her products.

Faced with the wish to better satisfy her ever increasing clientele, Mariam decided five years ago to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She got several solidarity loans with the association of women in her neighborhood (Benkadi Sanoubougou I Group). This is her sixth individual loan and all her previous loans have been repaid on schedule.

Mariam will use her new loan to buy 15 wax pagnes, 15 embroidered suits, 10 fanci pagnes and 20 pairs of shoes from wholesalers in Sikasso and in Bobo-Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She has a stall at the bus station in Sikasso where she sells her goods, cash and credit, to a clientele made up mostly of women and particularly to travelers and carriers.

Thanks to this loan Mariam expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs (US$227) which she will mostly use to buy new inventory, provide for her family, pay the interest of her loan and reinvest the remains in her business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes, embroidered cloths and shoes

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion B. is from the village of Senote. She is 48 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Asuncion owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Asuncion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 31-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Chadi has been working as a furniture painter since 1989. He repairs old furniture and even manufactures new furniture. He does bedrooms, living rooms, any rooms that need furniture.

Chadi requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new wood machine for his work. Chadi has been a micro-credit client for ten years now and has always paid on time.

Chadi is unique in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and always does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and referrals. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking with clients and had some financial issues. Chadi originally decided to start this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business, and he also wants to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a new wood machine for his work.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella, 52, owns a pig farm in Surallah, South Cotabato, which she started in 2004. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to borrow a loan which has allowed her to finance her business with a low interest. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy feed for her pigs. She has three children and hopes to give them a brighter future by sustaining her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed.

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo “16 D. Julio”  esta representado por Dolly dentro D. las cuales todas ellas son madres D. familias dedicadas a sus familias y a su trabajo, la gran mayoría D. las socas se dedican la venta D. comida, promotoras, pan y el resto se dedica a a actividades como la sastrería, A.ñilería, música, transporte publico y al servicio D. peluquería.  La competencia en su rubro es alta pero los socios trabajan duro para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias, El crédito será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería insumos y herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar mas aun la calidad D. vida D. sus familia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias conocen la modalidad D.  créditos solidarios debido a experiencias en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital con la a la que están muy agradecido por el apoyo y la confianza D. brindada.
texts.en:
The group “16 D. Julio” is represented by Dolly. All of the members are mothers and are dedicated to both their families and their jobs. The majority of the members sell food and bread while others are involved in tailoring, masonry, music, public transport, and hairdressing. There is a lot of competition but the members work hard to improve their small business since the livelihoods of their families depend on it.

The loan will be used to purchase goods and tools to better their business and the quality of life for their families. The members of the group have experience with this type of loan in institutions similar to Agrocapital and they are very grateful for the support and trust given.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por Damarys de los Ángeles H. quien comenzó hace dos años vender zapatos y ropa en pequeñas cantidades actualmente comercializa mayor cantidad de productos. 

Las otras integrantes son Alma Nidia C. M. vende perfumes y Carmen Isabel Gonzáles distribuye bisutería.
texts.en:
The Esther group was formed by Damarys de los Ángeles H., who started out two years ago selling shoes and clothing in small quantities. Now she sells larger quantities of products. The other members are Alma Nidia C. M., who sells perfumes, and Carmen Isabel Gonzáles, who distributes costume jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam, son of J. K., is an educated man with a great deal of experience. He has a retail shop where he works, and he has been in the business for a long time and has many regular customers. 

When he got his first cycle loan to complete his stock, Rustam's business was small.  He continued his business with more success, and he is still working. 

Now Rustam has requested a second-cycle loan of 40,000 AFN to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in this business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, especially for the son who works with him. He is sure that he can further his business with even greater success.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal Nueva Asunción esta integrado por 8 socias, con diferentes tipos de negocios, como ser: taller de costura, confección de chamarras, tejidos de chompas.  Como es el caso de la señora Martha B., señora de 35 años de edad, casada, la misma que está dedicada desde hace 6 años al tejido de chompas en su domicilio, al mismo tiempo que desarrolla las tareas del hogar.  La venta de su producción es realizada en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, de lunes a domingo.  La solicitud de crédito que ahora realiza está destinada a la compra de lana, para mantener su producción de chompas.
texts.en:
The Community Association Nueva Asunción is made up of 8 members with various businesses and skills, including running a sewing workshop, tailoring jackets, and knitting sweaters. Martha B. is 35 years old and married, and has been knitting sweaters from her home for the past six years as well as taking care of the usual household responsibilities. Sales of her jumpers take place in the different fairs around the city of El Alto from Monday to Sunday. The loan is currently being sought to buy more wool to continue with her sweater knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more wool

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el Distrito D. Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bar, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, actualmente no cuenta con el apoyo D.  esposo porque se encuentra enfermo. María forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres solidarias”, desD. hace un año y medio, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. productos para su negocio, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 400 soles, que será invertido en la compra D. golosinas y otros productos para su negocio. La meta D. María es seguir trabajando para poner una bodega y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman who lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali Region. She manages a bar located in her home. At the moment, her husband does not proviD. financial support because of illness.

María has been a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (United Women) for 1½ years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy products for her business. She is now requesting a loan of 400 soles to invest in candy and other products to sell at her business. María’s goal is to continue working by opening a grocery store and expanding her existing business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy & other products to sell at her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E., 65, is a hard working single mom who is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs by managing her own variety store for nine years 

Norma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 26 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues and has used the money she borrowed as added capital for her business.   Her business enables her to earn a profit of 8,500 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 34,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying different food products for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can finance her children's  education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy a selection of different food products for her store

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo N. is from the city of Calingcuan, Tarlac. He is 39 years old. Edgardo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo owns & operates a business a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen in the community. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edgardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edgardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina tiene 46 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, pues las experiencias le han enseñado muy buenos resultados. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la mercadería en general es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta luchar y además tener su propia independencia,  siempre le ha gustado mostrar todos sus productos, por lo que sale todos los días a vender de forma ambulante. Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para pinturas de uñas, talcos, cremas, sabanas y calzado. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María Delfina is 46 years old. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan. Her experiences have taught her very well. María Delfina sells general merchandise. She is a hardworking woman who likes to fight to have her own independence.

María Delfina has always enjoyed demonstrating her merchandise, so she sells all of her products as a traveling merchant. Today she is requesting a loan to buy nail polishes, talcum powders, crèmes, bed sheets, and footwear. Her wish is to continue forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy nail polishes, talcum powders, crèmes, bed sheets, and footwear

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer M., 34 years old, is hoping to have continuous growth of her business, which is rice farming.  She started tilling a farm in June 2009. From then on, she learned the relevance and meaning of what she is doing because, according to her, it is what keeps and sustains her family. She would like to apply for a loan of 4,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy farm supplies that will help grow her harvest. She likes the CEVI program because it has only 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Fatoumata Yeya

texts.fr:
Madame   Fatoumata Yeya Traoré    est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari avec ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire  au  quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Matrone de formation et de carrière, elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière depuis son bas âge (en marge de ses études et de sa  profession), elle est nantie d’une forte expérience. Alors elle  a décidé d’évoluer en solo en menant   des activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente d’habits, de chaussures et de glace alimentaire depuis 2 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est la masse de sa glace qui est grande et grosse.  
 Dans le dessein de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est  à son 1er  prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 1  congélateur   sur place à Ségou. Madame Fatoumata Yeya Traoré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  essentiellement d’hommes qui sont des boulangers.  
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 40 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (habillement, savons et médicaments). 
Son ambition est  de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Yeya Traoré is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children as a nuclear family in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). She is educated as a traditional birth attendant, and started her business activity with her mother who used to sell condiments. After several years of learning this business from an early age (parallel to her studies and her regular work), she has amassed solid experience. This is when she decided to launch a solo business selling clothing, shoes and food-grade ice, which she has been doing for two years. Her business is popular and she has a large customer base. Her strength is a large stock of ice. In order to better satisfy customer demand and increase net profits, she has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. This would be her first individual loan which she plans to use for purchasing a freezer for her home in Ségou. Mrs. Fatoumata Yeya Traoré sells for cash and on credit to a customer based composed mainly of men who are bakers. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to take care of some of her needs (clothing, toiletries and medications). Her goal is to be able to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a freezer

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer A. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer provides internet services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $44 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more internet equipment

loans.name: Kikubo Traders And Poultry-Keeping Association, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
This 37-year-old operates her five-year-old secondhand garment sales business along Karegyesa Road in Rukungiri town. Before she obtained a footing in her current business, she was operating a stationery shop.

All along, however, U. Doreen, a married mother of four, had been nursing a dream to start a clothes boutique. A business like this, she knew, requires good customer relationship skills and Doreen has strived to achieve success in that regard, in the course of time. Experienced decision making has also been her other success attribute.

Profits have been steadily accruing to Doreen’s business and, at present, her weekly profits stand at 200,000 shillings. Her hardworking nature is always a factor that she says is going to help her expand her business. She says she wants to expand her operating area and operations eventually. She sees this coming to pass on the back of acquiring this loan.

Given the high demand for cheap secondhand clothing in rural areas across the country, Doreen's chances of achieving prosperity are at least ten to one. It’s only time that she says is the limit.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont un âge moyen de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le chef lieu de commune rurale: Cinzana Gare dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des foulards, des boissons locales (le Dolo à base de mil), des condiments alimentaires (piments, ail et échalotes) et des ustensiles en plastiques (seaux et tasses). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 douzaines de seaux et 3 douzaines de tasses en plastiques. 
Elle se ravitaille en ustensiles en plastiques à Koutiala en gros et effectue sa vente au comptant ou à crédit à la foire du village et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Mariam K.  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et acheter petit à petit des petits ruminants pour des fins d’élevage.
texts.en:
The four members of the Badenya group are married women who mostly live in monogamous households. They are all around 33 years old with three children. They all live in the main area of their rural living place: in Cinzana Gare in the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali), and met through neighbours, family and friends in the village. The members of the group buy and sell foulards, local drinks (Dolo, a millet-based drink), condiments (spices, garlic and shallots) and plastic utensils (buckets and cups). In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to seek help from the Soro Yiriwaso credit association and are on their third loan. Madame Mariam K. aims to use her loan to buy 5 dozen buckets and 3 dozen plastic cups; she sources her plastic utensils in bulk at Koutiala and takes cash or credit sales in local markets and at home; her customer base is made up of women and men. She hopes to generate an average monthly profit of 27 000 FCFA which will be reinvested into her business, and also used to buy animals to rear.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic utensils (buckets and cups)

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son S. is a 52-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Cham Province. (Her husband appears in the photo.) She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbages, rice, potatoes and morning glories. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured.

Her husband helps her with the farm work. Son S. has two school-aged children, while another one is now married and a vegetable seller. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Son S. does not have enough farm supplies to use on her field. Son S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for growing and some groceries to resell to generate more profit.

loans.use: To use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for growing and some groceries to resell to generate more profit

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año ofrece el servicio de llamadas, por lo que cuenta con un locutorio instalado en su misma casa, aprovechando además que tiene una tienda.  Es así que de manera diaria atiende su establecimiento con la ayuda de sus 2 hijas la apoyan en esta tarea. Por otro lado se dedican también bordar bellas prendas típicas. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le gusta ser independiente y también porque le permite  tener una vida tranquila ya que le permite tener las rentas necesarias para su familia, afirma además que  aunque su trabajo suele ser tranquilo  requiere de muy buena administración y control de las ventas diarias, es por eso que Jesusa esta planificando crecer más en su negocio. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de línea  telefónica para llamadas en su locutorio y materiales para realizar bordados así como la compra de un saco de arroz para su tienda.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old and lives with her two children in their own home. For a year she has been offering phone service from her house, where she also runs a small store. Every day she runs the business with help from her two daughters. Jesusa also has another line of work, embroidering beautiful traditional clothing. She enjoys this second job because she can work independently and it allows her to have a less stressful life because it helps to cover the household expenses. Jesusa says that while her work is not stressful, it does require careful planning and sales management. For this reason, she is planning to expand her business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy another telephone line for her business, to buy materials for embroidery work, and also to buy a sack of rice for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a telephone line and embroidery materials

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is an active member and treasurer of the Bubayi Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practicing mixed farming for 14 years and has employed one farmhand. She sells her milk and millet to the local market. She is also in the business of buying and selling cows.

Rosemary is 39 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children who are now between the ages of 6 and 20. All the children attend school.

Rosemary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her buy a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to school.

In five years time, she plans to have five dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market and Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucina L. is from the Barangay of Guingona, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married, and is blessed with 12 children, all of whom are now already adults with their own families. To make a living, she is presently engaged in fruit and vegetable vending in the Agora  and Osrox area here in the city. She also receives regular support from her husband, who is a farmer, and also from her children in terms of her basic needs. She has been engaged in this kind of fruit and vegetable vending activity for 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Lucina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out rural communities, and has already successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP as her second loan, to be used as additional capital for her fruit and vegetable vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially to meet their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, insurances and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fruit and vegetable vending business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe J., from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental, is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture providing motor or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. Fe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik M.’s wife and 3 children live together with Gagik’s mother in Goris, Armenia. While Gagik’s wife takes care of chickens and pigs, Gagik takes the cattle for summer to the mountains. The family has been involved in agriculture for 7 years. To increase the income and take better care of his family and children Gagik is planning to purchase 3 cows.

loans.use: Towards purchasing cows.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy C. (in the photo) is 52 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nun Bou, is 65 years old. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have five children--two sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, and the other two attend school.

Mrs. Sophy C. has been selling fruit (mango and sapodilla) for ten years. She buys it under contract from fellow villagers before harvest season, for resale in the local market. Her husband assists her in the business.

Sophy is asking for her first loan of $300 to provide capital to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Li

texts.en: Li M. is 53 years old and has been selling shampoo in her house for more than nine years. She sells her products to a wholesaler and other villagers in her community. She is married to Mr. Him, 55, who is a fresh fish seller in the a local market. Her husband always travels to the market to sell his fish by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn't have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Li M. has requested a loan in the amount of $1000 to be used to buy a new motorcycle so they don't need to hire a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation for selling fish at the market.

loans.name: Janet Nana Ama

texts.en:
Janet Nana Ama A. is married and has eight dependents. She has junior high educational background. Janet is a palm oil extractor at Abura. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Janet will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to buy a piece of land.

In this photo, Janet has two big barrels full of pounded palmfruits, ready to be processed into oil.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
