Rose K. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  She has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for nine years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal to resell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, she hopes to own a house.  

Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her a job skill.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old and married to George, 40, who is also a farmer. They  have three children. She has been in the farming business for eight years and earns Ksh 5,000 monthly.

Esther has no history with any other micro-finance institution, and she has applied for a loan of Kshs.10,000 from KADET,planning to buy farm inputs, that is, seeds and fertilizer.

Kiambu town is an area with high agricultural potential, serving a large population. With combined efforts from her husband, she is more likely to thrive than most. She plans to use the anticipated profits to lease another plot of land to increase  their income. Her dreams and hopes are to buy her own land.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs: seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est née en 1958 à Missérété dans le département de l'Ouémé. Cécile est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Justin, et a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Depuis une trentaine d'année, Cécile vit avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Cécile n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Cécile prépare de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Cécile se ravitaille en maïs à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile a bien remboursé le crédit précédent obtenu auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle et son chiffre d'affaire, Cécile demande une fois encore l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cécile was born in 1958 in Missérété in the Ouémé district. She is married to a driver called Justin with whom she has six children who all attend school; three of the children are in her care.  She has lived with her family in Ekpè, the Sèmè-Podji region, and the couple see to the family's needs together.  Cécile did not attend school. 
She makes 'akassa' (a local drink based on corn starch) which she sells from her home.  Cécile sources her corn from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Cécile successfully repaid a previous loan received from ALIDé. She is seeking another loan from them in order to boost her business and grow her customer base and revenue.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 68-year old widow who supports her family by operating two business: a sari-sari store and a farm. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental and joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 to build a better life for her family. With the help of 16 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000. This time, for her seventeenth loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to invest in both businesses. Salvacion is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and join our team.

loans.use: To expand a farm and a small general store

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe Martinez Marcelo tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio hasta el sexo año de primaria y esta casada con el señor Miguel Espinoza con el cual tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos son hombres a los cuales llama Juan Miguel de 23 años de edad y  Alfredo de 19 años los cuales trabajan y dos mujeres de nombres selene y Xochil de 16 y 17 años de edad que asisten a la preparatoria de la comunidad de la reforma que se encuentra a 20 minutos de su comunidad. Doña Lupe(como la llaman en su comunidad) y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de Tierra Blanca en el Veracruz, para poder llegar a la comunidad de vista hermosa se toma un autobus que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar como 25 minutos  para llegar a la comunidad.
 Doña Lupe nos platica que hace mas de ocho años vende zapatos y cosmeticos por catalogo,  ella vende casa por casa en su comunidad, lleva los catalogos con sus clientes, leventa pedidos y los encarga a sus proveedores cuando le llega el pedido lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe su pago.  Ella decidio iniciar con su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas, en algunas veces su hija selene la ayuda a vender y cobrarle a sus clientes, doña Lupe necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cosmeticos, perfumes, catalogos y zapatos, ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que ella espera terminar de construir su casa y darle una profesion a sus hijas. Doña Lupe se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le esta brindando al otorgarle este credito el cual la ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe Martínez Marcelo, 42, studied up to the sixth year of primary school and is married to Mr. Miguel Espinoza with whom she has four children: two boys, Juan Miguel, 23 and Alfredo, 19, who work and two girls, Selene and Xochil, 16 and 17, who are in high school in the community of La Reforma which is located 20 minutes away from their community.  Doña Lupe (as she is known in her community) and her family live in the community of Vista Hermosa located 40 minutes from Tierra Blanca in Veracruz.  To get to the community of Vista Hermosa one takes a bus that drops you off on the highway and then you must walk about 25 minutes to reach the community.

Doña Lupe tells us that she has been selling catalogue cosmetics and shoes for the last 8 years.  She sells from house to house in her community taking the catalogues to her customers.  She takes orders that she delivers to her supplier.  When the orders arrive she delivers them to her customers and collects payment.

She decided to start her own business to help her husband meet household expenses and for her daughters’ education.  Sometimes her daughter Selene helps her sell and collect from her customers.  Doña Lupe needs this loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, catalogues and shoes.  She hopes her business will prosper with this loan and leave good profits because she hopes to finish building her house and give a profession to her daughters.  Doña Lupe is grateful to the foundation for the trust it’s conveying by granting this loan which will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: For costmetics and footwear sales.

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the support of several woman neighbors of Villa Elisa. Ms. Matilde M. was an intermediary who came to the foundation to learn about our programs.
Today, this group is in excellent condition. Its members are responsible and keep their payments punctual to avoid troubles with the foundation. They all have their own business.  They work jointly and together and they look forward to continue doing so.

Mrs. Matilde is a seamstress. She makes costumes and uniforms. Now that we approach the start of classes in schools across the country, she is requesting a loan to buy all the materials needed to make them. 

All of the members are people who wish to succeed in all aspects (life, family and business).  They appreciate very much the help given to them by the foundation and thank the opportunity offered by the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" committee.

loans.use: Clothing sales, clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy T., 53, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. T. uses her bicycle to sell firewood, earning an income of about $2 per day. Two of her children are employed at different workplaces to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her child to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by having a fishing business. She lives in Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Rose is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing supplies.  This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rose aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén dedicado al servicio de transporte, el cuenta con su vehículo propio tras años de trabajo para poderlo comprar, después de dos años con este vehículo este necesita algunas reparaciones en general es por esta razón que el crédito será destinado para la reparación del mismo. Esto para poder mejorar sus ingresos y así poder mantener a su familia por la que tiene fuerzas para seguir trabajando y mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén provides transportation services. After years of working, he was able to buy his own vehicle. Now that he has owned this vehicle for two years, it is in need of a few general repairs.

For this reason, Rubén is requesting a loan in order to pay for these repairs. This will enable him to improve his income and support his family. He has the strength to continue working and improve his quality of life. Rubén is a responsible and hardworking person. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria Nelly de 41 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajo que por medio de una amiga ingreso en la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catálogos.

Ella labora de lunes a domingos y hace pedidos a quienes promociona sus productos. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar más productos como perfumes ropa y cosméticos para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro ella quiere tener un negocio de papelería y que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en:
Maria Nelly is 41 years old, she is an inspiring woman in her work, and began selling makeup and clothing by catalogue through a friend.
Maria Nelly Monday through Sunday and takes orders from people she offers her items to. With the loan she wants to buy more products like perfumes, clothing, and makeup to increase her earnings. In the future, she wants to have a stationary store and that her children graduate.

loans.use: buy clothing, perfumes, and makeup.

loans.name: Neli

texts.es: Neli, de 43 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Martín de la misma edad y sus hijas Emily de 21 y Marilyn de 17 años de edad, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le gusta mucho realizar, ya que la hace sentir muy independiente y además le permite organizar su tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar, es así  que le dedica todo su tiempo libre a la captación de posibles clientes para ofrecerles sus productos cosméticos, que van desde cremas, perfumes, maquillaje y de todo lo que la empresa con la que trabaja puede ofrecer, en los catálogos que mes a mes le mandan. Las ventas son muy buenas y ella ha llegado a ser directora de un grupo de señoras a las cuales debe supervisar en su trabajo de venta de cosméticos y también entregarlas los pedidos que le llegan ya que es su responsabilidad. Neli se encuentra muy contenta y espera progresar en su negocio, queriendo hacerlo más grande y poner en su tienda una vitrina donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con los pagos al igual que su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neli, 43 years old, is a very kind and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Martín, who is her same age, and their daughters Emily, 21, and Marilyn, 17, to whom she wishes to bring a better quality of life. For two years she has been making a living selling beauty products, an activity that she likes doing very much, and which makes her feel very independent and allows her to organize her time to dedicate herself to taking care of the home. She dedicates her free time to gaining possible clients to offer them beauty products ranging from creams, perfumes, foundation, and everything that the business she works with can offer in the catalogs that they send her monthly. 

She is doing very well in sales, and she has achieved a position as director of a group of women who she supervises in the sale of cosmetic products. It is also her responsibility to turn in to them the requests that are given to her. Neli is very content and hopes to make progress in her business. She wants to make it bigger and put in her store a display cabinet where she can showcase her products. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her payments as well as with her communal bank. With the thousand soles she is asking for, she will buy more beauty products to have more merchandise to offer her clients.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to meet the needs of her clientele.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Balbina  está casada con el Sr. Luis, ellos tienen un hijo que ya está casado.
La señora tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación ya que es la única despensa en los alrededores.
Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería, que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien variada y buenos precios, con una clientela formada.
Además, su marido es una persona muy trabajadora y con su trabajo ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su profesión es ser guardia de seguridad. 
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en sus compromisos, ha demostrado con sus historiales de pagos de créditos anteriores.
Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le están brindando para salir adelante, espera contar con el apoyo de estos nuevamente.
texts.en:
Balbina is married to Luis and they have a son who is already married.  Balbina has a well-stocked store in a good location, since it is the only store in the area.

She started several years ago with very little merchandise, which gradually increased with every passing year. Today she has a store with a great variety of items at good prices with an established customer base.  In addition, her husband is a very hard worker and his work helps with household expenses.  His profession is being a security guard.

Balbina is very hardworking and responsible in her commitments. This has been shown with her history of  previous loan payments.  She thanks La Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity you are offering her to move forward, and she hopes to have your support again.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cereals, pasta, cleaning supplies, toiletries, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Margaritas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel esta casada, tiene 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos 3 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, inició este oficio criando gallinas y ahora ya cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio. 

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de cerdos para criarlos y luego venderlos cuando hayan crecido, las otra dos integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la confección de prendas, esperan ver en el futuro su negocio convertido en una granja de animales varios.
texts.en:
Isabel is 53 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has seven children, three of whom are in school.  Isabel's business is raising pigs.  She started out raising hens and now she has ten years experience raising animals.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.

Isabel formed a group so that she could request a loan with which to buy pigs to raise and then sell when they have grown.  The other two members of her group raise animals and make clothes.  In the future, Isabel hopes to see her business become a farm for different kinds of animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene la edad D. 48 años, solo estudio la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Rogelio que tiene la ocupacion D. mecanico, actualmente solo vive con su esposo ya que sus hijos ya se encuentran casados.Ella vive en el estado D. Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.

DOña Margarita nos platica que hace un poco mas D. dos años en el parque D. su comunidad impartieron unos cursos para aprender a bordar con listones y a pintar bolsas, como ella aprendio a realizar muy bonitos trabajos decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ganar un poco D. dinero extra y asi ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella realiza bolsas, blusas, faldas, servilletas, vestidos, cinturones y chalecos bordados, los cuales despues D. elaborarlos va a venderlos en su comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra D. listones, pinturas, hilos y telas para la elaboracion  D. sus manualidades y venderlos proteriormente con sus clientes.

Doña Margarita espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea en un futuro tener un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos y dar clases a las señoras que desen aprender.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is 48 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Rogelio, who is a mechanic by traD.. Margarita and her husband currently live by themselves since their children are already married. She lives in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Margarita says that more than two years ago, she took classes at the community park where she learned how to make embroidered ribbons and painted bags. When she learned how to produce these beautiful crafts, she decided to start her own business. With the little bit of extra money that she earns, Margarita is able to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes bags, blouses, skirts, napkins, dresses, belts, and embroidered waistcoats. Margarita sells these products in her community to her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, paints, thread, and fabrics for making her crafts so that she can sell them to her customers. Doña Margarita hopes that this loan will help her business prosper. In the future, she wants to have a small shop where she can sell her products and teach classes to women who want to learn.

loans.use: to purchase ribbons, paints, thread, and fabrics.

loans.name: Kuntura

texts.en:
Kuntura is 27 years old . He is married and is the father of three children.  He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years.  His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.  This will be his third loan which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build a rental property.  He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her three children. She is dedicated to raising cattle and sheep. Her husband is unemployed and cattle breeding is the only one source of income for her family. 

Natavan has 5 years of experience in the cattle breeding business. She usually purchases calves and lambs, then fattens them and resells them in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is about 150 USD. Natavan's hope is to purchase more animals to expand her business. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and 6 sheep.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred, 41, is from Kisumu city and is a widow. She has five children who are all in school.

Winfred has a grocery business that she has been running for many years. She is currently applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is also a client there. She wants to use the money to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock. She plans to buy land and build her own residential house in the future.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 45 years old and married with three children.

Clemencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Clemencia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 17 years and also earns income from food sales.

Clemencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Edgar, su esposo desde hace 27 años; ambos tienen 3 hijos a los cuales cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad Santa Ana. Esta zona se caracteriza por ser comercial, ya que da paso a la ciudad de Pichanaki; ahí Nelly tiene una casa ubicada en la zona céntrica de la ciudad donde abrió una pequeña tienda surtida de diferentes artículos dependiendo la temporada del año. En época de verano vende artículos para mujeres, diferentes bebidas y una zona de recreación con juegos de mesa, pues su tienda es muy grande y acogedora. Asimismo en época de invierno vende diferentes anticuchos y picarones que tiene mucha demanda en esa época del año. Le va muy bien en su tienda, tanto así que ahora esta planeando surtir su tienda con mayores productos y convertirlo en una de las más visitadas de la localidad con productos de primera necesidad para las señoras. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Banquito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además le gusta el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal, por ello promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Nelly de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda; para ello comprará útiles de escritorio y bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Nelly, 47, is a working woman. She lives with Edgar, her husband of 27 years. They have 3 children, whom she cares for in their own home, located in the town of Santa Ana. It's a commercial area on the way to the city of Pichanaki. 

Nelly has a centrally located house where she opened a small store selling different items, depending on the season of the year. In the summer she sells items aimed at women and different drinks, and she also has an entertainment area with board games since the store is very large and welcoming. In the winter she sells kebabs and snacks that are in high demand around that time of the year. The store is going very well, so she is now thinking of stocking it up with more products and turning it into one of the most visited shops catering for basic products for women in town.

She is a member of the "Mi Banquito" ("My Little Bank") communal bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She hopes to obtain your support to pursue her goals. She also enjoys her work as a member of the communal bank and is committed to repaying the loan on time. If she gets your support, Nelly will invest the money requested in the purchase of products to stock up her store, and she will buy stationery goods and soda.

loans.use: to buy goods to stock up her store.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar y su esposa la señora Trinidad son padres de familia y tiene a dos hijos que actual mente estudian la primaria. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares (cuaderno, libros, carpetas, lápices, colores y mochilas) ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir la necesidad escolar de sus hijos. 
Don Oscar es empleado de una distribuidora de lácteos como encargado del almacén, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que Doña Trinidad se encarga de atender y cuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar and his wife Trinidad are parents.  They have two children who are currently attending elementary school.

Oscar and his wife are requesting a loan to buy school uniforms and supplies (composition books, text books, folders, pencils, colored pencils and backpacks) as they currently do not have the money they need to cover their children's school needs.

Oscar works for a dairy distributor as a warehouse manager.  He plans to use part of his income to repay this loan as Trinidad will take charge of looking after and caring for the children.

loans.use: to cover school expenses (buying supplies and uniforms)

loans.name: Alexa

texts.en:
Alexa is 63 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is single and has no children. 
To earn a living, Alexa has a business selling bananas. She earns about 3,600 PHP each month doing this type of work. Alexa has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 200 kilos of bananas to sell.
Alexa has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children who attend school.  Jennifer and her family live in a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills. 

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis and works seven days a week.  Jennifer has been in business for 7 years. 

Jennifer requests a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspiration are to build rental houses and educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 59 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamoboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Daylinda has a business selling roasted pig (lechon baboy)and vending meat. She earns about PHP 14,000 each month doing this type of work. Daylinda has  requested a loan of P5,000 to purchase pigs and ingredients for her roasted pig (leachon baboy) and meat vending business.

Daylinda has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Daylinda would like to improve this business so that she can cater to other places and people.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and ingredients for her roasted pig (leachon baboy) and meat vending.

loans.name: Akouègnon Antoine

texts.fr: Akouègnon Antoine est âgé de 33 ans et est marié à Béatrice. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Akouègnon Antoine a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure ; activité qu’il exerce depuis seize ans et qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Akouègnon Antoine vend de l’huile de palme,des lubrifiants et de la glace dans sa région. Akouègnon Antoine s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Akouègnon Antoine désire  augmenter le stock de ses produits afin d’accroître sa clientèle et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Pour ce faire, Akouègnon Antoine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Akouègnon Antoine is 33 years old and is married to Beatrice. They have two children who are attending school. In addition to their own, they have two other children under their care. The various family expenses are borne by the couple.

Akouègnon Antoine has had very little schooling, but learned the hairdressing trade, a business activity he has practiced for sixteen years. This allows him to meet his customers requirements and to deal with various family expenses. Alongside this activity, Akouègnon Antoine also sells palm oil, lubricants and ice throughout the area. He gets his supplies from Nigeria, Benin's neighboring state.

Akouègnon Antoine wants to increase his stock supply to expand his customer base and increase his turnover. To do this, Antoine Akouègnon is requesting a third credit loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have been fully reimbursed..

loans.use: Buy lubricants, a freezer, palm oil and "Pure Water".

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 26 years old, married, and has one child. For the last two years, he has been selling clothes to support his family. His potential customers are passersby and local residents. 

Benard is requesting a loan for 20,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to add stock of skirts and blouses to sell. In the next five years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. He dreams of becoming more financially stable in future.

loans.use: to add stock of skirts and blouses.

loans.name: 16096 Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 33 years old. She is a very efficient lady and performs her routine tasks very well.
She is also a very talented sewing expert and sews beautiful looking clothes for her community clients.
She is a mother of 2 daughters and a son. Her son is only 2 months old while her daughters are studying by attending a local school.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation services to his passengers.
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because her husband’s rickshaw has grown old and its body needs to be changed.
With the loan he will buy a new body for the rickshaw that will allow him to save his business asset and also enable him to drive it more smoothly and earn more profits by providing better quality transport services to his passengers.
He has been operating his business for many years and Rukhsana is confident about his success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a new auto-rickshaw body

loans.name: Esequiel Isaac

texts.es:
Esequiel, es un hombre casado de  30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad ellos están cursando el nivel primaria,  el  eligio este oficio ya que su Tío se lo enseño desde joven.
Esequiel es un hombre responsable, luchador y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, Esequiel empezó en el negocio desde el año 2004, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/450 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para la compra de herramientas de trabajo ( la drillos, cemento, etc). Uno de sus desafíos es en el mes de febrero y marzo ya que en esos meses no hay muchas obras,  El  sueño de Esequiel es que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y tener lo necesario para que en un futuro no les pueda faltar nada, es por eso que el se sacrifica diariamente para poderle dar lo mejor a su familia, el señor Esequiel esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando, para que el pueda seguir surgiendo. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Esequiel vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
texts.en:
Esequiel is a married man of 30. He has two young children who are in primary school. He chose his work because his uncle taught it to him in his youth.

Esequiel is a responsible and hard-working man with much will to advance his family. Esequiel began this business in 2004 and earns an average of 450 PEN weekly. With the loan of 1500 PEN that he will receive thanks to Kiva, he will invest in the purchase of working tools (bricks, cement, etc.) One of his challenges is that there is not much work in the months of February and March. Esequiel's dream is that his children can have the opportunity to continue studying and to have what is necessary so that in the future they will not lack for anything. It is for this that he sacrifices daily to be able to give the best to his family. Señor Esequiel is very grateful for the opportunity that is offered to him, so that he can continue advancing. His adviser believes that he is a good client and that he will make his payments punctually.

Esequiel lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú; however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and destroyed many jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

loans.use: )to purchase working tools (bricks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 42 years old man, he is married with three sons and two daughters, he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, also he has a project of raising sheep and sell its products to improve his income and live in better conditions. Maher wants to purchase food to feed the sheep he is raising, but he hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,500 from FATEN. When Maher gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the food that it is necessary for the sheep to live and provide better products that Maher sell to get better income, this will enable Maher to maximize his profit and create to his family better living conditions. Maher is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase food for the sheep.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rosie has a shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mingué

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de deux enfants. Elle vend des fruits et légumes au marché central de sa localité. Elle se lève très tôt le matin et passe la journée assise devant sa table faiblement protégée des rayons du soleil.Elle s'approvisionne auprès de grossistes venant de la grande cote et écoule son stock sur une période d'une ou de deux semaines environ.Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez importants; ce qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins propres et de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille , en appui à son mari.Pour renforcer son stock et améliorer ainsi ses revenus, elle sollicite un prêt de 250000f qui servira à l'achat de pastèques, de melon, d'orange et de diverses légumes.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine à l'intérieur du marché.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, mother of two children.  She sells fruits and vegetables at the central market of her town.  She gets up very early in the morning and spends the day sitting at her table, only poorly protected from the sun.  She buys her merchandise from wholesalers located along the "grande côte"  (the stretch of coast north of Dakar, between the Cap-Vert peninsula and the Senegal river).   It takes her one to two weeks to clear her stock.  Her business brings good income, which allows her to provide for herself and to help her husband support the family.  In order to bolster her stock and increase her income, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000 CFA francs (XOF) which will be used to buy watermelons, melons, oranges and various vegetables.  Her long-term goal is to buy a stall at the market.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, melons, oranges and various vegetables.

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is 35 years old. She is happily married. She has two infant-age children. They live in the simple village of San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Sur. She also shares that her family is doing well; despite the hardships the family is able to cope with things.

She is in the retail business, locally known as a sari-sari store. She has been in this business for three years and the revenue generated is quite good. She earns about 2,350 PHP a month doing this type of business.

She joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in business activities and wants her business to become bigger. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 PHP to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell. She is hoping that through her income, she can support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 5 years she has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food like fresh cassava, rice, and beans to be cooked and sold. It will also help her to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her children by meeting their basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a good business like a wholesale shop. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more food like fresh cassava, rice, and beans to be cooked and sold.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny sells cosmetics from Avon and Yandal. She began selling to her family members when her husband was left unemployed. She thought it was necessary for her to do something that would not be too time consuming. She goes out with her merchandise and takes the products to familiar clients. She lives northeast of the city, in one of the worst neighborhood of Guayaquil. She also sells merchandise from her home, which her husband attained several years ago during land invasions in Guayaquil. Jenny S. was born in Guayaquil, she is 40 years old and is married to Don Arcángel who works in a factory in which the monthly income is $240.00. They have three children who are all currently in school.

loans.use: Purchase diverse set of cosmetic products like hair care and makeup

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz H. has sold clothing out of her home in Agsu city for the past ten years. She is a 59-year-old widow with two children. She hopes with this loan to purchase a place in the bazaar to sell clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a business location

loans.name: Mia

texts.en: Mia is 38. Her husband is a mason. They have two daughters who stopped going to school to work as laborers. This family must take care of their old mother, who has cardiovascular problems. All of them live in a leaf hut. They have a fishpond, which is about 300 square meters. Their income is about $10 per person/month. They want to get a loan of $75  to raise fish. They promise to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To raise fish

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa L., 43 yeas old mother of 3 children, lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works on her farm growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetable such as tomatoes, lettuce, chili and cabbage and she then sells them to a nearby market. This kind of business activity contributes her in average about $3 each day, while her husband works as a village chef and typicalL. earns up to $7/day, which is a big help in financing the famiL.’s savings. CurrentL., Soa L. is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase more seeds and some parts of money is to repair her house, which normalL. gets leaking during a rainy season. In the future, Soa L. is thinking about the possibility of expanding her crops by purchasing a plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to grow and needs to repair a house from the leaking during a rainy season.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in a tire repair shop, but his salary is meagre and does not manage to cover the basic necessities of his family. This is the reason why Dora began her own business in the sale of cosmetics. She started by selling door to door, and thanks to her talent for communicating and good service that she offers, she won over many clients. Now she counts on the help of her older son for the delivery and collection of money for her products.

To continue expanding, Dora needs a loan of $550 to cover some orders that she has and to offer good service. She has agreed to repay the loan in 6 months. You can help improve the livlihood of this family by contributing to the expansion of the business. Dora sincerely thanks you for your confidence and the help which you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Dora es una mujer entusiasta y muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora pero su salario es muy bajo y no alcanzaba a cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia razón por la que Dora comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, empezó vendiendo casa por casa, gracias a su facilidad para relacionarse con los demás y al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró tener muchos clientes, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo mayor para la entrega y el cobro de los productos.

Para continuar creciendo Dora necesita un crédito de $ 550 dólares para cubrir unos pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, Dora agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Cesilia Antigua

texts.en: The pride of this 57 year old single mother resides in having done her best to provide a good education to her children.  Her five children are now grown up, earning their own livings, and are  professionals who support their mother.  Although her economic situation is relatively stable, Cesilia wants to continue working.  She thinks that getting old is not an excuse for sluggishness.  Two years ago, she started a small business, selling hair-slides, hair clips, earrings, and underwear to women.  She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase men’s underwear to introduce in the business.  That way, she will increase her income and feel independent.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of men's underwear to introduce in her business so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Crimilda Alberto

texts.pt:
Crimilda is single and mother of 3. She lives with her children. Crimilda joined the credit program this year, and this is the first loan she requested. She has a small stand in the local market. Crimilda is working to ensure her children are able to go to school when they reach the appropriate age. Crimilda dreams of building a home and is working hard to achieve that. She also wants to make her children proud.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Crimilda e solteira e mae de dois filhos. Ela vive apenas com os seus filhos. Ela nao tem marido. Ela entou para ao programa de credito este ano. este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar. Ela faz as suas vendas no mercado. Os filhos de Crimilda ainda nao vao a escola porque ainda nao tem idade. mas garante que logo que tiverem idade ela os matriculara. Um dos sonhos que Crimilda tem e a de construir uma casinha com material convencional. Assim ela promete trabalhar muito para conseguir isso. Ela quer que os seus filhos tenham orgulho dela.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchenware for sale

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en: Nazli is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in Bala Bakhmanli village. She was born in 1962. She is married and has three children. Ten years ago she started her clothing sales business. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy clothes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio is 60 years of age and is a single father with five children, of which four are now independent and have families of their own. That leaves him in the company of his youngest child, who is thirteen years old and in school, and is his reason for living and progressing. Julio works arduously to give him everything necessary for his development. Julio sells fruits and beverages, and his principal clientele are employees of a renowned corporation (Electro Ucayali), which makes him feel satisfied about being a resourceful asset to society. It is important to him that he continues growing his business, and with time, set up a kiosk for the sale of fruits. Julio awaits the disinterested support of your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Julio de 60 años de edad es padre soltero y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro ya se independizaron y han compuesto sus respectivas familias, quedándose sólo en compañía del más pequeño de trece años quien estudia y es la razón de su vida y progreso, el señor Julio trabaja arduamente para darle lo necesario para su completo desarrollo.El señor julio se dedica a la venta de frutas y refrescos, teniendo como principales clientes a los funcionarios de una empresa muy reconocida (Electro Ucayali), por lo que él se siente satisfecho de ser un hombre útil a la sociedad, lo más importante es seguir surgiendo incrementando su negocio y con el tiempo poner un kiosco para la venta de frutas. El señor Julio espera el apoyo desinteresado de tu amable corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand his fruit and beverage business.

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen Maribel E. Rodríguez is 24 years old and studied only through elementary school. She has two children who still depend on her. She lives in the small population center of Campo Bello in the Mache district of Otuzco Province in the city of La Libertad, Peru.

She began her business very young selling bread and “turrones” (nougat candies) to the different residents who came through her area. She set up shop on a corner and sold her goods from a basket. With her earnings she was eventually able to purchase a candy case in order to exhibit her sweets. Over time she had the good idea of creating a small store in her house, and she began to purchase soft drinks and snacks.

Through a family member she was able to join the Communal Bank “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a future). From this group she obtained her first loan of S/.300.00 (approximately $100 U.S.) with which she purchased several boxes of soft drinks.

The loan she is seeking is also for S/. 300.00 ($100 U.S.) to be paid back in four months. With this loan Carmen will purchase two boxes of beer, some snacks, and some candies.

Carmen’s dream is to have a larger business. There is demand in her area since it is a place that many people have to pass through on their way to Julcán and Mache.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Maribel E. Rodríguez tiene 24 años de edad, estudió solo primaria completa. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el centro poblado menor Campo Bello distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco en el Departamento La Libertad - Perú Desde que era joven inicio su negocio vendiendo pan y turrones a los diferentes pobladores que llegaban por la zona, se ubicaba en una esquina para ofrecer sus productos en una canasta, poco a poco con sus ganancias compró un mostrador para exhibir mejor sus dulces. Con el tiempo tuvo la buena idea de acondicionar una pequeña bodega en su casa, compró un poco de gaseosas y abarrotes. Por medio de un familiar pudo integrar el Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró varias cajas de gaseosas. Con el último préstamo que también es de S/. 300.00 y que cancelará en 4 meses comprará dos cajas de cerveza, un poco de abarrotes y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio más grande debido a que en la zona existe demanda porque es un lugar por donde tienen que pasar obligatoriamente los pasajeros que van a Julcán y a Mache.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of beer and various goods for her store

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Islom A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 37 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. He has secondary education. Since he lives alone, he needs to maintain his own household. For this reason, he works a lot. He is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. He earns little income because he has a small amount of money circulating in the business. To increase his income, he is asking for a loan so he could increase the amount invested in the inventory. This will permit him to receive income that is so needed for his household. He plans to pay off the credit within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Ислом Хасанович житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 37 лет , разведен и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Так как он живет один , все хозяйство лежит на его плечах . Клиенту приходится много работать ,чтобы прокормить семью.Клиет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Получает небольшой доход , потому что у него маленькая оборотная сумма. Для того чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит , тем самым увеличив оборотную сумму.Это принесет ему доход . который так необходим его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the turnover

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. owns a small general store. She is married and has 3 children. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan of $525 to restock her store.

loans.use: To restock a small store.

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru:
Sharifgul D. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 50 years old, is married and has 7 children. High School education. Sharifgul works as a kindergarten teacher. Her sallary is very small and is insufficient to take care of her large family. This is why Sharifgul and her husband raise cattle. They buy small calves on the market, raise them and sell them to local meat vendors. This business allows them to take care of their children. Currently Sharifgul would like to purchase two more calves. In order to do that she would like to obtain a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Джалилова Шарифгул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет, замужем , имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Шарифгул работает воспитательницей в детском садике. Заработная плата очень маленькая и ей не хватает на содержании большой семьи. Поэтому Шарифгуль с мужем занимается животноводством. Они покупают на рынке молодых телят ,откармливают их и сдают на мясо в мясные ларьки. Этот бизнес позволяет им покупать все необходимое для своих детей. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить двух бычков .Для чего она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say H., 43, is a mother of six children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and also a vendor selling a variety of vegetables in a busy market. She can make $5 US each day. Her husband, Tim An, 42, has two different businesses to support the family. In the rainy season, he is a fisherman and sometimes he works as a motor taxi driver to earn extra money. His combined income from these two businesses is about $1.50 US each day.

Mrs. Say wants a loan to help her add more foodstuffs to sell, such as fermented fish. She hopes that this will make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her inventory.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
Salima M. works in the trade business. She brings replacement parts in from the city of Dushanbe for automobiles and sells them in the local market. This is the only source of income for her family, which is why it is essential for her to grow the business. In order to do that, she wants to take out a loan and increase the assortment of goods she can sell. This way, she will be able to increase her profits. She will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Мирсаидова Салима занимается торговлей . Привозит из города Душанбе запчасти для легковых автомобилей и продает их на рынке района. Это единственный источник доходов его семьи, поэтому ей необходимо развивать бизнес. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом она сможет увеличить прибыльность дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Née le 30/08/1981 au Burkina Faso, D. Rafiatou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Son mari est comptable. Pour développer son commerce, elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire l’achat des produits divers qui doivent servir à alimenter son commerce afin d’agrandir son étalage. Son expérience est un atout pour rentabiliser ses activités et dégager des revenus
texts.en:
Born on August 30th, 1981 in Burkina Faso, D. Rafiatou is married and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is an accountant. To build her business, she is requesting this loan so that she can purchase various products that should serve to supply her business in order to grow her display. Her experience is an asset that can make her activities profitable and generate income.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Amita

texts.en: Amita P., 24, lives in Kirtipur, Kathmandu. She is very energetic. She lives with her husband Prem P. and one-year-old daughter. For two years, she and her husband have grown vegetables. She grows lots of pumpkins, potatoes, corn, and a variety of beans. Now she seeks a loan of Rs.15000 ($250 USD) to buy vegetable seeds and tools for her farming. She takes her vegetables to the local markets every day. She wants to maintain her standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To  buy vegetables seeds and tools for her farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of garments to add to her inventory

loans.name: G.s Pan Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
La señora Sabina Simona Narváez T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es acompañada, ella tiene tres hijos una mujer  de 28 años de edad quien es costurera, un varón de 23 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y un varón de 15 años quien recientemente cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora en un  camión de acarreo, el deseo de Doña Sabina es superar su negocio y montar un local adecuado y que preste las condiciones adecuadas porque su vivienda es muy pequeña y debido a las circunstancias ha convertido su casa en un taller de costura y así no podrá desenvolverse muy bien en su trabajo,  por lo que su amiga Doña Cándida le ha brindado el apoyo para que esta siga adelante con su negocio, otros de sus deseos es mantener una mano amiga dispuesta como Fundación León 2000 que siga financiando sus necesidades comerciales para así sobrellevar la difícil situación progresar en lo que es su trabajo. 

Su actividad económica es costurera como lo es: la realización de uniformes, vestidos y pantalones  para damas y caballeros , el tiempo de estar en el  negocio son de 10 años, ella inicia su negocio trabajando con otra persona, pero mas tarde decide vender  en el mercado de Chinandega, luego con sus ganancias decide comprar una  maquina en la que empieza la realización de los pedidos de uniforme por lo que es necesario el  financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo la compra de  materia prima como lo es la tela, hilo, zipper  para la fabricación de los distintos pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, ella dice estar agradecida con fundación y las diferentes organizaciones por facilitar este tipo de ayuda en crédito.

Doña Cándida Eufemia M. T.  tiene la edad de 51 años su estado civil es acompañada, tiene seis hijos de los cuales las mujeres tienen las edades de 32,30 y 17 los varones tienen edades de 22,28 y 25, su compañero de vida no labora, en sus propósitos tiene establecer una  pulpería  en su vivienda y establecer un negocio mas fuerte y productivo  y así mantener su crédito disponible con Fundación León 2000 para capitalizar la actividad económica, otros de sus propósitos es proporcionar mejores ingresos a su familia ya que no  a cumplido sus propósitos  por la situación económica que el país  pasa actualmente, por lo que sus deseos son de darle un futuro a su hija para que mas adelante ella pueda defenderse con sus estudios y así coronar su carrera.
Doña Cándida tiene la actividad comercial hace 20 años vendiendo productos que estuvieran en flota como lo es: maíz, semilla de jícaro y maní, ella inicia su negocio por el interés de incursionar en este tipo de negocio ya que buscaba la forma de poder sustentar a su familia es   como ella llega a la conclusión de que este negocio proporciona ingresos y  mas tarde logra adquirir experiencia en este parte del negocio  lo  que la hace sentirse  a ella  mas afianzada obteniendo el apoyo de su amiga Sabina y de sus  hijas, el financiamiento lo necesita para capital de trabajo ya que desea invertir en una venta  para tener otro medio de ingreso que le genere ingresos  para pagar sus compromisos contraídos.
texts.en:
Sabina Simona Narvaez T. is 47 years old. She has a domestic partner and three children: one 28 year old daughter who is a seamstress, one 23 year old son who is self-employed and one 15 year old son who recently finished his third year of high school. Her life partner works in trucking. Sabina's wish is to advance her business and start a shop and provide the right conditions because their house is very small. Due to circumstances, she has converted her house into a seamstress shop and, as a result, she is not able to unwind from her work. Her friend, Candida, has offered support so that she can get ahead with her business. Her other wishes are to maintain an open hand of friendship like Fundacion Leon 2000 that continues to finance her commercial needs so that she can overcome the difficult situation of progressing in her work.

Her economic activity is seamstress work such as making uniforms, dresses, and women's and men's trousers. She has had this business for ten years. She started it working with another person, but later, she decided to sell in the Chinandega market. Then with her earnings, she decided to buy a machine with which she could fulfill orders for uniforms. This loan will be used as working capital to buy raw materials like fabric, thread and zippers for different orders that her customers make. She says that she is thankful for the funding and the different organizations that facilitate this type of loan assistance.

Candida Eufemia M. T. is 51 years old. She has a domestic partner and six children. Her daughters are 32, 30 and 17 years old and her sons are 22, 28 and 25 years old. Her life partner does not work. Among her goals are to establish a store in her home and to start a stronger and more productive business. In this manner she can maintain the credit available with Fundacion Leon 2000 and capitalize on economic activity. Her other goals are to provide better earnings for her family since she has not achieved her goals due to the current economic state of the country. Her desires are to give her daughter a future so that later she can pursue her studies and have a successful career.

Candida has worked for twenty years selling products that were shipped like maize, jicama seed and peanuts. She began her business through the interest in entering this type of business since she was searching for a way to support her family. She came to the conclusion that this business would provide income. Later, when she had experience, what made her feel more confident was obtaining the support of her friend Sabina and her two daughters. She needs a loan for working capital since she wishes to invest in a sale so that she can have another means of income that generates earnings so she can pay her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ninfa Rosibel

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Ninfa Rosibel M. P. me dedico al comarcio, cuento con una pulperia operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia PATRICIA, actividad a la cual me dedico desde hace 5 años, soy viuda, los ingresos que me genera mi negocio he podido sacar adelante mis hijos cubriendo con todos los gastos familiares.
por lo antes mencionado solicito un credito el cual lo invertire en mi negocio para que me genere mayor volumen de venta de mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ninfa Rosibel M. P.. I work in commence and have a convenience store which is called Pulperia Patricia. This is an activity which I have been doing for the past 5 years. I am a widow and the income which my business generates has allowed me to take care of my children and cover all the family expenses. Because of this, I am asking for a loan to invest in my business so that I can sell more and improve my earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Walter Guillermo

texts.es:
Walter es socio del Bancomunal Pelas de la Sabiduría
Walter es conviviente tiene 42 años  tres hijos de 22,18, y 8 años este ultimo esta en el colegio 
Empezó hace ocho años trabajando  con su moto-car, así fue creciendo aparte trabaja con su esposa en la panadería y  actualmente trabaja de día en la moto, tiene tres motos-car. 

Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, los va invertir en la compra de Soat  para su moto, y repuesto para la moto y cambio de tarjeta de propiedad
El sueño de Walter es tener su panadería, esta construyendo el primer piso de su casa para panadería y el segundo piso lo va hacer vivienda
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. He is 42 years old, lives with his common-law wife and has three children, ages 22, 28 and 8, the youngest of whom is still in school. He started worked with his motor-coach eight years ago and grew the business as well as working with his wife at a bakery. Currently he focuses his efforts on his transportation business and has three motor-coaches in his fleet. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $325), which he plans to invest in the purchase of safety devices and spare parts for his motor-coaches as well as change the registration. Walter's dream is to have his own bakery. He is building the first floor of his home for a bakery and the second floor will be the living area.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase safety devicies and spare parts for his motor-coaches

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty years old, a divorced wife and mother of one child. Mavis lives with her child in Madina, a suburb in Ghana, in a family house. She loves fashion very much and as a result, she trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces and other fashionable accessories including beads. She has been selling jewelry for the last eight years.

Mavis buys her stock of jewelry from Togo and Benin because jewelry in these countries is very affordable. She hawks her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. Mavis wants to use the loan to buy jewelry in bulk so she can trek to other markets. Mavis is in a group called “Yayra’ (Blessing) Trust Bank in her community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Sabaly de l’association Faida ont une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales nucléaires dans la ville de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
Leur union est basée essentiellement sur l’amitié et elles exercent le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de légumes. 
Elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 300kg d’aubergines, 500kg d’oignon, 90 kg de carottes et une grande quantité de laitue. Ces produits sont achetés auprès des jardiniers de Dioila et revendus dans le marché de la même ville en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent avoir avec ce prêt, 45 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui sera utilisé pour étoffer leur activité génératrice de revenu.
texts.en:
Mostly married women, the members of the Sabaly group of the Faida association average 22 years of age and 1 child. They live in nuclear families in the city of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. The group is essentially based on friendship, and its members deal in selling food condiments and vegetables. They joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are now seeking their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to buy 300 kg of eggplants, 500 kg of onions, 90 kg of carrots, and a large amount of lettuces. These products are purchased from gardeners in Dioïla, and retailed at the market of this same city, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising men and women. They intend to make a profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90) each, to be used to expand their money-making businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria Auxiliadora es soltera, de 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, ninguno esta bajo su cargo, pero uno habita en su casa, esta solicitando su 3er credito el cual utilizará para su cocina, ya que los vientos de Febrero se la destruyeron, cabe señalar que no estaba con muchas condiciones , pero sí le servia para realizar la preparacion de sus alimentos.  Doña Maria Auxiliadora trabaja como conserje en el Centro Social S.O.S. con 17 años de servicio, se ha destacado como una excelente trabajadora y recibe el cariño de todos sus compañeros de trabajo, asi mismo se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente clienta con el pago de sus creditos en tiempo y forma, haciendose merecedora del calificativo de clienta "A".
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 50 years old and single. She has 3 children who are grown and out of her care, but one lives at home with her. She is asking for her 3rd loan, which she will use towards her kitchen that was destroyed by wind in February. Even though her kitchen was not in the best condition, she was able to prepare her food there. Maria Auxiliadora works as a concierge in the S.O.S. Social Center. With 17 years of service, she stands out as an excellent worker and is liked by all her co-workers. She is also an excellent client because she pays her loans on time. She deserves the rank of "top" client.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: kitchen construction

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima P. is a micro-entrepreneur and a Tanzanian woman. She is a poultry keeper. She keeps broilers. She keeps them in three different poultry cages with a variation of two weeks from one cage to another. It takes only three months to sale, thus because of the alternation, she can have sales every four weeks. She also plans to keep layers but capital limits her possibilities. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Mario Aurelio

texts.es: Mario Aurelio P. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casado. Aurelio tiene 2 hijas. La actividad económica de Aurelio es una pulpería, hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, Mario es un joven muy luchador y la manera como inicio este negocio fue con muy pocos productos. Es por eso que los propósitos de Mario son de salir adelante con su negocio y así desarrollarlo cada día como medio de supervivencia. El financiamiento solicitado por Mario es para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y frutas. El deseo de Mario es de convertir su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora por lo que es lo único que le deja a sus hijas para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Mario Aurelio P. is 34 years old, has two daughters, and is married. He has been operating a grocery store for over two years. Mario is young and ambitious; he started his business with very few products. Mario's goal is to grow his business and he works hard every day. The loan will be used as working capital to purchase basic cereals, sweets, detergents, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and fruit. Mario's wish is to transform his small grocery store into a distributor so he can leave the business to his daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used as working capital.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Mrs. Chona B., 40 years old, is married and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. The family's primary source of income comes from “sundang” making ("sundang" is the Visayan term for a kind of knife). She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since December 2005. With the efforts of her husband combining with the help of the cooperative, Chona has found that it is much easier for her business to flourish. The finished products are sold at public markets and other sales are made through orders. Because of her good credit record, she has taken on five loans already.

Chona says she is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to her family. Today, she is applying for PHP 20,000 to buy additional materials for her “sundang” making business.

She hopes for a bountiful life ahead.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for "sundang" making.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es: Agustín tiene 34 años, vive en una casa arrendada. Hace 5 años decidió invertir sus ahorros en la compra de lentes de sol y otros accesorios personales, los cuales vende en un puesto del mercado de su localidad todos los días. Agustín le pone mucho empeño a su negocio, ya que la responsabilidad y la perseverancia son actitudes que practica desde muy joven. Para el futuro, Agustín quiere alquilar otro puesto de ventas para incrementar la cantidad de artículos que vende, y con ello aumentar sus ganancias. Este e su primer préstamo con MFP, y también es una experiencia nueva ser parte de un banco comunal, donde está seguro que aprenderá mucho y mejorará sus relaciones interpersonales. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería para implementar su puesto.
texts.en:
Agustín is 34 years old and lives in a rented house. 5 years ago he decided to invest his savings in the purchase of sunglasses and other personal accessories, which he sell at a stand in his local market every day. Agustín puts a lot of hard work into his business, as responsibility and perseverance have been character traits that he has put into practice ever since he was very young. For the future, Agustín would like to rent another sales stand to increase the quantity of articles that he sells, and in that way increase his earnings. This is his first loan with MFP, and it is also a new experience to be a part of a communal bank where he is sure that he will learn a lot and improve his interpersonal relations. With the money that he is requesting he will purchase more merchandise to stock his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Gaudensia N. from Mwanza. She is married with five children, between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. Gaudensia has been running a shop since 2005, selling biscuits, sodas and water. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Gaudensia currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase beans, rice and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Gaudensia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos Antonio L. P.  de 35 años de edad reside en Ciudad Arce en el Departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. El posee dos negocios de elaboración y venta de ladrillos rojos, los cuales los elabora de barro cocido. Carlos Antonio es una persona la cual goza de muy buenas referencias, ya que es muy responsable  y trabajador. El solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de ladrillos, Carlos desea aumentar sus ventas ya que es un hombre muy comprometido con su familia el cual vela por ella día y noche y anhela poder brindarles siempre lo mejor.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio Lopez Perez is 35 years old and lives in Maple City, Department of Freedom, with his wife and three young children. He has two businesses of making and selling red bricks, which he makes from clay. Carlos Antonio is a person who enjoys very good references since he is very responsible and a good worker. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy more raw materials to make bricks. Carlos wishes to increase his sales since he is a man committed to his family who he looks out for day and night and he wishes to always be able to offer them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bricks

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en: K. Catherine is the leader of her subgroup of Balikyewunya in Gayaza. She is a hard working lady with a business selling used clothing from daily markets called Mubuulo for over five years now. She is grateful that when she joined her lending group, she could not afford to buy some of the necessities in her home but she is now able to do so. She is a mother of four children all going to school and she needs a loan to be able to buy more used clothing for her stock.

loans.use: Buying more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hildaura

texts.es:
Hildaura es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Hildaura es viuda, tiene 64 años y 2 hijos, Hildaura venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, además Hildaura venD. ropa a pedido, la gran parte D. sus ventas son al crédito.
Hildaura necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cosméticos.
Los sueños D. Hildaura son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Hildaura is a member of the Glorioso Community Bank. She is a 64 year old widow and has two children. Hildaura sells cosmetics from a catalog to friends and acquaintances. She also sells clothing.
