A large part of her sales are on credit. Hildaura needs a loan for 1050 soles, which she will use to purchase cosmetics. Hildaura's dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Beatrice is into the palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Beatrice has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth manages a general store in South Caronsi, a village in the municipality of Peńablanca, Cagayan Province. She is fifty years old and a widow. She has ten children: Jocelyn, Joey, Jeffrey, Jodelyn, Jonaly, Jovelyn, Jocelie, Joebert, Jose, and Jemuel. Even though nine of her children were not able to attend college due to financial difficulties, Elizabeth aspires to send her youngest child to college. She is thankful that her two eldest children are helping support the family in household expenses and in daily allowances for her youngest child.

Through Field Partner Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), Elizabeth is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP 8000 in order to maintain the growth of her general store. She would like to buy additional items that she could sell at retail to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Adela es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Adela tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende papa, producto que adquiere de los productores, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Adela son seguir adelante, llevar sus productos a la capital.

loans.use: Para la compra de papa.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de ocupación comerciante de calzados de varón, tiene un puesto de venta en el Desaguadero frontera con el Perú; su esposa trabaja como comerciante de calzados en un puesto en la Ciudad de Cochabamba, tienen 2 hijos y la casa donde viven es en alquiler y es de adobe ubicado en la zona San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería  (Zapatos), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en sus puestos de venta en Desaguadero y Cochabamba.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Juan.
texts.en:
Juan sells men’s shoes and has a booth in the Desaguadero frontier with Peru. His wife works as a shoe salesperson in a booth in the city of Cochabamba. They have 2 children and the house they live in is located in the San José de Yunguyo zone in the city of El Alto, it is rented and made of adobe.

The loan will be used to buy merchandize (shoes), this way he can satisfy the quantity demanded in his sales booths in Desaguadero and Cochabamba.

This is Juan’s first loan with IMPRO (Kiva’s field partner) his evaluation qualified him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and satisfy the quantity demanded in his sales booths in Desaguadero and Cochabamba.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. is 49 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Shanzu, Mombasa, where she is a tailor. Jane has been in the business of tailoring for 11 years and her business is a success. She also owns rental houses which supplement the family income.

Jane is accessing her first KADET loan and with it she plans to purchase tailoring materials and to perform some refurbishments to her shop. Her main customers are local residents -- mainly parents of school children. One day, Jane hopes to expand her tailoring business and to also offer employment to others.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and to perform some refurbishments to her shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southem Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ahmad has been working as a carpenter for five years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his work. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.
Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to have all the required tools. Ahmad decided to do this business because he wanted to have independent work, and it is in demand in his region. In future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his work.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia T. is a 48 year old mother of two children, one of whom studies in high school.  Her husband Jeremias, 51, is a carpenter.  They live in the poor neighborhood of Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Sophia owns a general store located in their house, and is also involved in the popular direct selling of cosmetic products and apparel offered by prominent brands (Personal Collection, Fuller Life, etc.).  With all these combined businesses, she earns a net income of P5,000 a month.
 
She is now on her sixth loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative which she joined in 2006.  She applied for a P12,000 loan with the cooperative to purchase more cosmetic products for her clients.  She will also use a portion of the money as additional capital for her store.  Sophia dreams that her general store will become a big grocery store someday. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for the general store and direct selling of cosmetics

loans.name: Cobol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cobol” esta representado por la señora Carolina Kati y conformada por 10 miembros dedicados a la prestación de servicios como la peluquería, servicio mecánico, contratista, transportista, constructor y a la venta de productos como comida, ropa para mujeres y camisas para varones. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe mucha competencia en especial en la venta de ropa ya que existe una amplia gama de productos para todos los gustos, las socias que se dedican a este rubro tienen puestos de venta al principio del pasillo por lo que se podría decir que tienen un ingreso aceptable para la recuperación de su capital y la ganancia para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento será la adquisición de mercadería nueva para la época navideña y año nuevo, también para la adquisición de herramientas de trabajo que colaboren en la generación de una mejor ganancia en la prestación de servicios. En cuanto a ala experiencia de las socias ellas conocen bien la modalidad de trabajo en grupos solidarios por créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital con la que están agradecidas por la confianza y el apoyo económico para que puedan salir adelante
texts.en:
The group "Cobol is represented by Carolina Kati and is made up of 10 members who are service providers. They are hairdressers, mechanics, contractors, drivers and builders. Some sell products such as food, clothes for women and shirts for men. Within the business field there is a lot of competition, especially in the sale of clothes, where there exists a wide range of products for all tastes. The members working in this line of business operate sales stands at the entrance to the market hall, and so one might say that they are "well-positioned" to generate enough income to recover their capital and earn profits to support their families. This loan will be used for the acquisition of new merchandise for the holiday season and new year as well as the acquisition of tools of the trade that contribute to the generation of better profit for the service providers. As for the experience of the members, they know well how it works in loan groups in institutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation, for whom they are thankful for the confidence and the economic help so they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation Capital

loans.name: Anabel Priscila

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por mujeres emprendedoras, visionarias micro empresarias cabeza de hogar que residen en  distintas localidades de la urbe cuencana,  ésta ciudad majestuosa y soberana se caracteriza por  la riqueza de su arquitectura y valor histórico  así como su  paisaje de inigualable belleza por lo que   ha sido declarada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.

Anabel J. es  una de las socias más jóvenes de éste banco  con apenas 18 años ya es madre de una niña de un año ocho meses que si la reconoció su padre, ella vive  en el sector Miraflores en el centro de la ciudad  con su hermana con la que comparte los gastos de arriendo y comida porque no tiene casa propia.
 
Anabel se dedica a la venta por catálogo de productos Yanbal desde hace un año y medio, la mayor parte de sus clientes son sus compañeras de  colegio porque a pesar de tener una bebe ella sigue estudiando para tener un mejor futuro para ella y su niña, ahora se encuentra en primer año de bachillerato.

Este es  su primer ciclo con su banco comunal y nos comenta que fue incentiva a formar de éste por una amiga que es socia antigua del mismo, el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cremas, sombras, labiales, bases y más cosméticos para damas y caballeros. 

Su meta es  ir creciendo  su negocio para sacar adelante a su niña.
texts.en:
“Fuerza del Mañana” (“Strength for Tomorrow”) Communal Bank is made of enterprising woman. They are visionary entrepreneurs who are the heads of their households and reside in various locations around the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a majestic city known for its architectural richness and historical importance and has been declared an important Cultural Heritage Site for its incomparable beauty.

Anabel J. is one of the youngest members of the bank. At barely 18 years old, she is already the mother of a 20 month old daughter, who is acknowledged by her father. She lives with her sister in the Miraflores neighborhood in the center of the city, and they share the cost of rent and food since they do not own their own home.

For the last year and a half, Anabel has sold Yanbal beauty products from catalogs. Most of her customers are her high school friends, as despite having a child, Anabel has continued her studies to have a better future for herself and her daughter. She is currently in her freshman year of secondary school.

This is her first loan and she tells us that she got the idea from a friend who has been a member of the communal bank for some time. She will invest the loan in the purchase of perfumes, creams, eye shadows, lipsticks, foundation, and other cosmetics for men and women.

Her goal is to continue developing her business so that her daughter can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, eye shadows, lipsticks, foundation, and other cosmetics for men and women

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Mr. Rotha O. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is the father of two children: one is enrolled in the local public school while the other is too young to go to school or to work.

Mr. Rotha O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Sreylak Chhen, is a worker in a garment factory. She is on the right in the photo.

However the couple tries to work hard they still earn less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Rotha O. decided to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike to commute to the garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to the garment factory

loans.name: Maria Biviana

texts.es: María Biviana A. G. es de 43 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales sostiene económicamente a 3 de ellos por estar en edad escolar.  Su esposo, el Sr. Jose Eulalio Xajil trabaja en albañilería.  María Biviana hace tortillas todos los días y alquila un local para vender su producto; las personas ya la conocen y le hacen pedidos de canastos llenos de tortilla; además, vende pollo por peso (libras).  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, leña y gas propano para tener en existencia y seguir haciendo tortillas; su sueño es tener un local propio para no seguir alquilando y agradece a FAPE por la ayuda que recibe, ya que es una institución diferente a las demás instituciones.
texts.en:
María Biviana A. G. is 43 and has six children. She supports three of them because they are school-age. Her husband, Jose Eulalio Xajil, works as a bricklayer. María Biviana makes tortillas everyday. She rents a place to sell her product. People know her and make orders for baskets full of tortillas. She also sells chicken by the pound. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, and propane gas to have on hand to keep making tortillas. Her dream is to have her own place and to stop renting. She is grateful to FAPE for the help she receives. It is an institution that is different from the other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, and propane gas

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley M. P., tiene 28 años vive en el barrio San Nicolás, con su cónyuge y su hijo de cuatro años de edad. Desde hace 4 años, tiene un negocio de vender mercancías mediante el sistema de crédito a clientes que le pagan por cuotas de acuerdo a un plan de pago acordado. Su esposo también desarrolla la misma actividad, pero ella además de tener este negocio también es una auxiliar de enfermería que trabaja parte del tiempo en una clínica y donde tiene muchos clientes. En la actualidad aplica un crédito por valor de 1.500.000 para comprar mercancía sobre pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, como calzado vestidos bolsos, cosméticos,.
Este es el 3º crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ellos le han servido para aumentar su capital de trabajo; ella quiere progresar para que a su familia no le falte nada. Sueña con que algún día su hijo se convierta en un profesional especializado y por eso no ahorra esfuerzos en trabajar persistentemente.
Su mayor reto fue lograr pagar sus estudios  mediante un negocio y así como también los es, la responsabilidad de ser negociante, empleada, esposa y sobre todo madre al mismo tiempo.
Vive en un barrio tranquilo todo lo tiene cerca: centros comerciales, rutas de buses y eso le favorece porque puede trasladarse en corto tiempo de un lugar a otro y hacer sus compras en lugares comerciales cercanos a su sitio de vivienda.
texts.en:
Shirley M. P. is 28 years old and lives in the San Nicolas neighborhood with her husband and her 4 year old son. For four years, she has had a business selling merchandise through a credit system in which her customers pay her in installments according to a payment plan. Her husband also does the same work. Besides this business Shirley is also a nurse's assistant and works part-time in a clinic where she has many customers. She is applying for a credit of 1.500.000 in order to buy merchandise to order like shoes, dresses, bags and cosmetics for her customers. This is the third loan for her with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and they have helped her increase her capital. Shirley would like to progress so that her family never lacks anything. She dreams about her son one day being a professional and that is why she spends all her energy on working hard. Her greatest challenge was to be able to pay for her studies with her business. The responsibility of being a businesswoman, employee, wife and above all else a mother at the same time is also a challenge. Shirley lives in a quiet neighborhood that has everything nearby: shopping centers, bus routes, etc. This helps her because she can travel to various places in a short amount of time to buy things at shopping centers near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to order for her customers like shoes, dresses, bags and cosmetics

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad E. is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Felicidad is married and has one child, an infant. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher folks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for the Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy additional products to sell such as "guso" or sea weed

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house, which they own. They have been living together in their current home for four years. 

Presently, Javzandulam operates a mobile meat-trading business. She purchases meat at wholesale prices from meat sellers and resells the meat for a profit in Uyanga soum (district). During the winter, Javzandulam sells meat, but for the summer she sells livestock for meat to her customers. 

Over the years, she has gained great experience and has steadily expanded her business. Javzandulam has a great business mind and her business is very important to her. She says, “I would like to expand my business and to create my own workplace.” 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat at wholesales prices to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal  Mujeres Divinas se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca,  metrópoli fundada por los españoles en 1557 como  Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca, en sus cercanías existen interesantes restos arqueológicos incaicos y la misma ciudad conserva notables edificaciones estilo  barroco de la época colonial, como el convento del Carmen, entre otros atractivos turísticos que posee la ciudad. En ésta ocasión podemos observar en la fotografia a nuestras socias con algunos de sus hijos que las acompañan a las reuniones del banco comunal.

 Gloria tiene 32 años, se casó hace varios años concibiendo cuatro hijos de los cuales el segundo de O. años murió atropellado, de sus tres hijos que le quedan el mayor tiene catorce años como no le gusta estudiar pasa en casa, el otro tiene 11 años y estudia en una escuela de la localidad y un pequeño de tres años que pasa con ella, aún no tiene casa propia por ello viven arrendando en el centro de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia mantiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del bankito, y se integró a él gracias a su hermana que ya pertenecía al banco, ahora  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, ella se dedica a la entrega de colas, papas fritas, chitos, yucas y todo lo que es la línea Frito Lay productos  Pepsi  junto a su esposo quien manejo un camión de su propiedad  llevan  diez años realizando esta  actividad. Con el nuevo préstamo que realiza va a  pagar los gastos de mantenimiento del vehiculo como cambio de aceite, llantas y otros, su sueño es el de llegar a tener su casa propia.

Flor Chávez tiene 19 años y es una de las socias más jóvenes de  éste banco,  vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca en  unión libre  con su pareja que trabaja en una concesionaria de autos,  ella se encuentra en su sexto mes de gestación, no tienen casa propia y viven rentando 

Flor se dedica al comercio de ropa y lo hace puerta a puerta   no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja todos los días sin descansar uno solo, nos comenta que  empezó con su negocio gracias al primer crédito que realizó en la fundación también nos informa que gracias a su suegra y cuñado ella es ahora socia de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras, ahora que está en el segundo ciclo realizó otro crédito y con él va adquirir   pantalones, blusas, camisas, sacos, interiores, calcetines, etc. para toda la familia,  su meta es de crecer en su negocio y algún momento tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Divinas" was formed in the city of Cuenca, a city founded by the Spanish in 1557 as Santa Ana de los Rios de Cuenca. In the vicinity there are interesting archaeological ruins and the city itself retains remarkable baroque buildings from the colonial era, such as the convent of Carmen, among other tourist attractions the city owns. On this occasion we can see in the photograph the members with some of their children who accompany them to the meetings of the communal bank. Gloria, 32, was married a number of years ago, and conceived 4 children, the second of whom died in an accident at the age of 11. Of the other children the oldest is 15 years old, and as he does not like to study he remains in the home. Another is 11 and studies in a local school, and the youngest, who is 3, stays with her. They do not yet have their own home, so they live in a rented home in the center of the city. This member has a good friendship with all the other members of the small bank, and she joined the group thanks to her sister who already belonged to the bank. Now the group is in its 2nd loan cycle. She delivers colas, potato chips, Cheetos, yucca chips, and everything from the Frito Lay and Pepsi brands along with her husband, who drives his own truck. They have been in this line of work for 10 years. With the new loan they will pay expenses related to the maintenance of the vehicle, such as expenses for oil changes, tires, and other maintenance. Her dream is to eventually come to own her own house. Flor Chávez, 19, is one of the youngest members of the bank. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca and she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner who works in a car dealership. She is in her 6th month of pregnancy, and they do not have their own home so they rent. Flor sells clothing door to door. She does not have a fixed schedule and she works each day without resting even one day. She tells us that she started with the business thanks to the first loan that she took from the Fundación ESPOIR. She also tells us that thanks to her mother-in-law and brother-in-law she is now a member of this beautiful group of enterprising and go-getting women. Now that the group is in its second cycle she will take a loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, bags, underwear, socks, etc. for the whole family. Her goal is to grow her business and at some point have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to vehicle maintenance such as oil change, tires; to acquire pants, shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, and socks

loans.name: Wifridah

texts.en:
Wifridah O. M. runs two kinds of businesses; poultry farming and seed sales. She started both businesses in the year 2006 after her ‘mandazi’ (half-cakes) business did not do so well and she had to close down. Wifridah is 38 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. Her main future plan is to expand the poultry business and venture into dairy farming.

She would like a loan to expand her business by increasing the number of chicks.

loans.use: Increase the number of chicks

loans.name: Tientigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tientigui est constitué de femmes mariées vivant dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et mariage.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce, de fourrage (aliment bétail), de tomate, d’habits pour enfants et de calebasses. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam Traoré  qui fait l’achat vente d’articles décoratifs compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 200 calebasses. Elle se ravitaille en calebasse à Tona et à Konodimini. 
Les calebasses sont épluchées et gravées de petites figures ou dessins avec des matériels conçus traditionnellement pour la circonstance. 
Elles sont revendues sur commande aux nouveaux mariés et en ambulant parfois dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame  Mariam Traoré à l’image des autres membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 500FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans leurs activités et épargner.
texts.en:
The Tientigui group is made up of married women who live in monogamous families. They average 39 years of age and have an average of five children each. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbours and marriage. This group of women trade in fodder (food for livestock), tomatoes, children's clothing and calabashes (vines which can be dried out to be used as bottles or utensils). With a view to increase their businesses, they decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan. Mrs. Mariam Traoré who buys and sells decorative articles is planning to use her loan to buy 200 calabashes. She gets her supply of calabashes in Tona and Konodimini. The calabashes are peeled and engraved with small figures or designs made out materials which have been traditionally designed for this purpose. They are resold to order to newly married couples, sometimes on a door-to-door basis in the various neighborhoods, and the customer base is made up of women and men. Mrs. Mariam Traoré hopes, along with the other members of the group, to make an average monthly profit of 27,500FCFA part of which will be invested in their businesses and part for their savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calabashes

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon B., 24 years old, is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living Sharon operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Sharon has been doing so for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Sharon joined HSPFI in 2010 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory. She is requesting her second loan, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto vive en casa propia  en la zona alto San Pedro; es viudo y vive con sus dos hijos.
 El señor Ernesto está jubilado de un periodico ( newspaper) de esta ciudad y sus ingresos los recibe a través de la seguridad social y son los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un techo para un solarium, para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr.Ernesto lives in a house of his own in the area of San Pedro. He is a widower and lives with his two children. Mr. Ernesto retired after working for a newspaper in the city. Social security provides him with an income to support his family. The loan he is asking for will be used to build a roof for a solarium, in order to improve his quality of life. This is the fourth time Mr. Ernesto has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis performed deems him qualified for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of roof

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. M. is thirty one years old, married and has two children, ages five years old and four months. 

He sells clothes, shoes and handbags to local people.  His eight year old business is profitable.  But James' major challenge is that there are so many people running the same kind of business: competition.  However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.  He will use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more skirt suits and men's suits to sell.  He hopes to open two boutiques in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking, polite and hardworking.

loans.use: Buy skirt suits, men suits to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is from the village of Regency, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 62 years old. Editha is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Editha's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yonny Capri

texts.es:
Yonny Capri P. R. tiene 44 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 niños de 20, 19, y 17 anos.

Yonny  es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Yonny se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoya, 2 veces al año para maíz y cada 2 semanas para el cacao. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para maíz, para ingresar pollos y chanchos. No se podía hacer sin el crédito. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su trabajo y terminar de dar estudios a los hijos.  

Le gusta jugar indoor futbol y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Yonny Capri P. R. is 44. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 3 children ages 20, 19 and 17. Yonny is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San Jose. Yonny is a farmer who grows corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao and in Babahoya, twice per year for corn and every two weeks for cocoa. He is requesting this loan to purchase inputs for corn, and to introduce chickens and pigs. He would not be able to do this without the loan. His dream is to succeed with his work and to finish his children's education. He likes to play indoor soccer and go for walks with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inputs for corn, and to raise chickens and pigs

loans.name: Nelson Douglas

texts.es:
El señor Nelson Douglas H. G. es acompañado tiene un hijo y labora para MATECSA como Mecánico Industrial el trabajo que el desempeña es dar mantenimiento a las maquinas de hacer adoquines, soldadura y todo tipo de mantenimiento.
El señor H. ha recibido de CEPRODEL  cuatro créditos los cuales le han servido para hacer ampliación de vivienda, sus mejoras han sido progresivas ya que con su salario, son montos pequeños los que puede optar y los materiales están demasiado caros por lo que agradece a CEPRODEL por el apoyo brindado en su progreso y seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson Douglas H. G. is married and has one son. He works as an industrial mechanic for [the company] MATECSA, welding and maintaining paver making machines. Mr. H. has received four previous loans through CEPRODEL, which he has used to progressively improve his home. His salary comes in small amounts, and building materials are expensive. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support offered him toward the progress and security of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife, Fatima, in Chtaura. Marwan has worked as a car repairer since 2000, specializing in bodywork. He is a expert in his field and anyone can see that the moment they see his work.

This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to buy an important steel welding machine which now comes in a new version: it’s known as a cold-welding machine, not like the regular one.

Marwan’s clients could be anyone: friends, neighbors, villagers, or friends of friends. His first obstacle was that people didn’t notice the location of his shop as it’s not on the main road: you have to search for it. However, this obstacle does not exist anymore as he’s kind of becoming famous.

Marwan states that he doesn’t have any other job, as he was raised to do this – his father is a car painter. His dream is to own his shop as it’s currently rented.

loans.use: To buy an important cold-welding machine

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a widow with one daughter. She runs a small business selling various cosmetic items: shampoos, hair-dyes, soaps, detergents, etc. She has been in this business for 19 years. When Vera's husband died, she had to continue the business that he initially started. She worked hard, learned a lot, and finally was able to sustain the business and even open several more locations to make this business a success. At the moment she’s got 5 locations that provide jobs for 15 employees.

Vera would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories. Her business goal is to open one more location in her town. She wants to save enough money to be able to help her daughter study at college.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Edwin Fernando

texts.es: En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio al sur de Barranquilla, vive un joven de 27 años como mucha madurez y capacidad de trabajo emprendedor,  que aprendió desde antes de terminar el bachillerato, cuando debía realizar sus estudios, a sus  12 años  mientras trabajaba en una tienda como empleado;  esta experiencia fue significativa en su vida y le dio la firmeza,  para iniciar su propia iniciativa de negocio que hoy lleva por nombre  llamada “Tienda MAFE” con la cual se independizó a los 20 años y que  ha logrado estabilizar, desde antes de cumplir sus actuales 27 años de edad. En su negocio ha tenido múltiples desafíos, como cuando muchos de sus clientes no le pagaron una vez llevaron a crédito sus mercancías, sin embargo esto no lo desanimó y siguió adelante, pero teniendo el cuidado de escoger bien a su clientela para los asuntos de créditos, ahora sus ventas a créditos son muy poca, vende casi la totalidad de su mercancía de contado.  Así mismo en algún momento fue víctima de atracos pero con la ayuda de sus padres siguió su meta de sostener su negocio, eso sí contando también con su hermana que es como su mano derecha. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  mercancía como víveres, ranchos, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar para reemplazar los créditos de sus proveedores y ganarse los descuentos por compras de contado. Su ideal es tener una casa propia pues actualmente vive  en arriendo, su mayor desafío es no tener historia crediticia y las organizaciones financieras no le aprueban los créditos, por eso ha acudido a la Fundación para hacer su primera experiencia financiera y crecer a su lado.
texts.en:
A 27-year-old, mature, enterprising, young man lives in Ciudadela 20 de Julio, a neighborhood in south Barranquilla. When he was just 12 years old, not even finishing high school yet, he started working as an employee in a store. This experience was significant in his life in that it made him determined to start his own business which today is called “Tienda MAFE” with which he became independent at the age of 20 and which he has managed to stabilize before his present age of 27. He has faced several challenges in his store like when many customers who had taken items on credit didn’t pay him. However, this did not discourage him and he continued forward just being more careful about choosing customers when credit was the issue. Now his sales on credit are very few; he sells almost his entire stock of merchandise for cash. At one time or another he was also a victim of holdups but with help from his parents he continued toward his goal of stabilizing the business always counting on help from his sister who is his right hand. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy merchandise like: foodstuffs, snacks, beverages and the usual items that go into a family’s daily needs. He will also use it to pay debts he has with his suppliers and gain the discounts offered for cash purchases. His ideal is to own his house because he currently rents. His greatest challenge is a lack of credit history that makes him ineligible for loans from financial institutions. This is why he’s called upon the Fundación to undergo his first experience with financing; he hopes to grow alongside it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 51 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children who are now all adults although her youngest son is currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kisii in Western Kenya. Norah has been farming for the past 30 years and she employs three farmhands to help her produce tea, maize, coffee and vegetables. Her produce is sold through the Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee Board, and the local market. Norah’s primary challenges are exploitation from middlemen who offer low prices for her products, diseases that affect her crop production, and fluctuating weather patterns.

Norah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a posho mill which is used to grind maize into flour. Acquiring a posho mill will greatly improve her asset base. She will use the extra income from this loan to help pay her son’s school fees. Over the next five years, Norah plans to have at least four good dairy cows and, if possible, to build a permanent business facility in her town.

loans.use: To purchase a posho mill

loans.name: Namsrai

texts.en:
Namsrai H. is 37 years old and lives with his family in a ger (Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Songinohairhan District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His three children attend school while his wife operates a taxi service in the city. 

Namsrai has been driving a taxi since 1995 and has built a successful operation. This enabled him to open a car repair center in his yard in 2008. Over the years, his businesses have been successful.  He now earns 10,000 MNT from his taxi service (per day) and 500,000 MNT from his car repair center (per month). Namsrai also raises dogs and sells those dogs at reasonable prices. 

Namsrai has proven himself a reliable borrower who always pays off his loans on time. He is a modest, honest man who says, "I am planning to save money for my son's future education." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Three relatives live with her family.

In 2006 she opened a small food market in the rural area where she lives. She received a loan previously to expand her shop. She has an excellent reputation. 

Now she is applying for a second loan of US$ 2900 to renovate her premises. She is going to repaint the store and put in new floor. She aims to improve her family's quality of life and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: renovating her premises

loans.name: Lulitte

texts.en: Lulitte L. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Lulitte is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lulitte raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Lulitte has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lulitte joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lulitte is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This will be the first loan taken out by Lulitte from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her livestock

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
El señor Octavio es casado, tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es técnico superior en electrónica, cuenta con un ambiente en su casa, el cual utiliza como taller eléctrico realizando armado de equipos de sonidos como parlantes y poderes entregando su trabajo en lugares comerciales de La Paz y El Alto, su esposa le ayuda realizando todo tipo de masitas(repostería) que vende en las tiendas de barrio. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de material eléctrico para su taller y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Octavio is married and has four school aged children.  He has lived in his parents’ house, located in La Paz’s Tacagua neighborhood, for a long time.

He is a Master Electrician and has a workshop in his house that he uses as an electrical workshop.  He builds sound equipment like speakers and amps and sells his items in commercial sites in La Paz and El Alto.  His wife helps him making all kinds of “masitas” (pastries) that are sold in neighborhood grocery stores.  This is how they earn income for the home.

The requested loan is to buy electrical supplies he needs for the shop so that he can increase income.

This is his first loan and the socioeconomic evaluation done qualifies him favorably and he may have access to a loan.

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su dos hijos, Patricia de 22 años, Roberto de 13 años de edad, además de su esposo José Valerio, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años, trabaja junto a su hermana y su hija desde las 5:00am a 12:00md, aprendió a preparar pupusas por su hermana mayor.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para adecuar el local y materia prima como chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, estos son los principales productos para preparar las pupusas, además de comprar mesas y sillas para ampliar la atención adecuada a los clientes.
La aspiración principal es generar ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar y pagar este préstamo, ayudar a sus hijos y en especial a su hija mayor en la búsqueda de empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and she lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the region of Morazan. She lives together with her two children, Patricia, 22, and Roberto, 13, and her husband Jose Valerio. She sells pupusas. It is a business she has had for the past 6 years. She works together with her sister and her daufther from 5 a.m. until midnight. She learned how to prepare pupusas from her eldest sister.

She requests a loan to purchase things that she needs to furnish her restaurant and to purchase ingredients, such as pork meat, cheese, and corn. These are the main ingredients used to prepare pupusas. She also wants to purchase tables and chairs in order to provide her clients with an adequate level of attention. 

Her goal is to generate enough income to cover the household expenses and to pay for this loan. She wants to help her children, especially her eldest daughter who is currently looking for work.

loans.use: To expand her store and to purchase atables and chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand and progress his business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 48 años, queda separada de su esposo, y vive en compañía de su hijo Jayro de 16 años que aun estudia la preparatoria. Por muchos años brinda sus servicios de enseñanza en un colegio particular, y por las tardes se dedica a realizar maquetas del cuerpo humano (elaborado con masilla, plastilina adheridas  en tecnopord ó maderas) que son utilizadas para exposiciones, tales el caso del aparato respiratorio, el sistema nervioso, así como trabajos didácticos de matemáticas. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya que durante estos dos años ha adquirido mucha habilidad y destreza en sus manos, del modo que  con mucha facilidad las termina a tiempo cada maqueta. Lo que más le motiva dedicarse a esta labor, son las buenas ganancias que adquiere de cada trabajo. Es por ello que desea instalar una librería, en la que también pueda vender este tipo de manualidad. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP,  y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues desea contar con posteriores ayudas que le permitan continuar progresando. De obtener  el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de pinturas acrílicas y tecnopord en cantidades numerosa, para continuar realizando sus maquetas.
texts.en:
Doris, 48, is separated from her husband and lives with her son, Jayro, 16, who is in high school.   She has been a private school teacher for many years and during afternoons manufactures scale models of the human body (made with putty and modeling clay attached to Tecnopor or wood) that are used for educational displays.  These might be the respiratory system or the nervous system as well as mathematical teaching aids.  She enjoys her work very much since during these two years she has acquired quite a bit of ability and manual dexterity so that she finishes her models on time with little effort.

What motivates her to dedicate herself to this work is the good profits she earns on each project.  Because of this she’d like to set up a bookstore where she can also sell this type of crafts.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she wants to count on having future help that will make it possible for her to continue progressing.

If she were to get the loan she’s requesting, she will invest it in purchasing acrylic paints and Tecnopor (a brand of polystyrene) in large amounts to continue making her scale models.

loans.use: To buy acrylic paints and Tecnopor.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.en:
The Women Entrepreneurs Committee of the City of Villa Hayes, Chaco Remancito. Currently in the fourth cycle and the credit line drive is 100,000 Gs. to 1,100,000 Gs.

Most of the members of the group, with much effort and responsibility, are the fruits that have put in many years of sacrifice, pantry, coal sales, and selling food.

For example, Ms. Josefina, who is entirely devoted to her family and tries to get more income through her small store, sells mainly water to her area because there is almost no fresh drinking water to drink.

And thanks to credit designed by the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva, Josefina has the desire to overcome, and move forward more.

loans.use: Buy raw materials such as meat, vegetables, fruits, bread and water

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella trabaja como empleada desde hace tres años  en una empresa agroindustrial ubicada en el distrito de Jayanca a 20 minutos del distrito de Motupe.  El tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su madre y solventar sus gastos económicos. María desea mejorar su vivienda y solventar sus gastos personales, de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
María, 43, is single living with her family in Motupe district; a farming zone belonging to Lambayeque province located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been employed for the last three years at an agro industrial firm located in Jayanca district, twenty minutes form Motupe district.  The time she’s been working has made it possible for her to help her mother and cover expenses.  

María would like to improve her dwelling and pay some personal expenses thus improving her quality of life.  Because of this she has thought it convenient to request an 1800 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternative that will help her reach her objective.

She is quite well known and liked by the residents of the area where she lives.  People who know her consider her to be level-headed and quite responsible.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is 47 years old and she is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Another one is a driver who gets a low salary, and the last one is studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice yield, and with the other part she supports her family. Besides farming, she is also a chicken breeder. 

Currently she wants to start a new business, but her savings is not enough to buy a cow. So to improve this condition, Choeun would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Aidé  Arévalo Sánchez, vive en  coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor  Jesús Estrada Torres, con quien procreo dos hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Cesar David de veintiún años, Cristian de Jesús de diesi siete años en quinto semestre de preparatoria.

   Ella se dedica a elaborar panes y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: harina, aceite, azúcar, huevo, leche, quesos, entre otros, para poder elaborar su actividad de panes  y con tener dinero para solventar sus gastos.

    Comenta que para este trabajo lo apoya su esposo para que juntos logren tener ingresos y así poder  sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están estudiando, aun así los dos muchachos trabajan en los fines de semana  para comprar algo que les haga falta para su escuela.

    Con las  ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de ingredientes, y con lo que le queda lo utiliza para sus hijos y así solventar los gastos que se debe en la compra de materiales en los trabajos 
que se realizan en la es cuela y así sigan con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

    Su más grande deseo es que Dios le siga prestando vida para poder trabajar y ver que sus hijos terminen una profesión de la que mas adelante puedan disfrutar y sostenerse.
texts.en:
Aide A. S. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married to Jesus Estrada Torres with whom she procreated two children that are still under her care, and they are: Cesar David who is 21 years old and Cristian de Jesus who is 17 years old and in his 5th semester of schooling.

She makes breads and solicited a loan to invest in the ingredients, such as: flour, oil, sugar, eggs, milk, and cheese amongst others to make the bread and have the funds to cover her expenses.

She comments that her husband supports her so that together they have the funds to help their children who are in school get ahead.  Still, the guys work on the weekends to purchase what else is needed for school.

She purchases ingredients with the earnings she makes and with what is left over she spends on her kids.  This way she covers the expenses of purchasing ingredients and those incurred at school so they continue with the desire to get ahead.

Her biggest wish is that God continues to grant her life in order to work and to see her kids obtain a career that in the future they can sustain themselves with  and enjoy.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 62 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez aprendió todo lo necesario para dedicarse a las tareas del campo, es así que siembra regularmente papa, maíz, habas, trigo entre otros productos, que luego son vendidos en el mercado mayorista. Esta actividad lo realiza en compañía D. familia, pero cuando se requiere D. mucho esfuerzo contrata la mano D. obra D. los jornaleros, así logra en menor tiempo sembrar o cosechar. Asimismo hace uso D. la yuntas o del tractor para optimizar mejor su trabajo. Sin embargo las bajas temperaturas hacen que perjudique sus plantas  y su producción. Pero ella sigue adelante en su trabajo por que sabe que cuando hay tiempo D. escasez hay también tiempos D. abundancia y eso la anima a continuar adelante. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. formar parte D. su banco comunal ya que ha escuchado que la forma D. trabajo es ventajosa y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. fertilizantes y en el pago D. jornaleros que prepararan su terreno D. cultivo para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elena is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her husband in their own home. Ever since childhood, she learned everything she needed to know about working the fields, so it is that she regularly grows potatoes, corn, beans, and wheat, among other crops, which are then sold at the wholesale market. She works the land with the help of her family, but when more help is needed, she hires day laborers so that she can plant or harvest in less time. She also makes use of oxen or a tractor in order to maximize her work. Nevertheless, the low temperatures harm her plants and production. Still, she presses on with her work because she knows that just like there are times of shortage, there are times of abundance, and this idea inspires her to keep moving forward.

This is the first time that she obtains a loan from MFP. She is very happy to be a part of her community bank because she has heard that working with it is advantageous, and she commits herself to be punctual with her repayments. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing fertilizer and paying the day laborers who prepare her crop fields for the next planting season.

loans.use: to hire day laborers who will prepare her field for the next planting season.

loans.name: Walter Pastor

texts.es:
Walter tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto familia en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Walter  tiene un taller de carpintería en su domicilio donde ofrece todo tipo de trabajos de carpintería con diseños innovadores de acuerdo al gusto del cliente, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro y debido a su buen trabajo lo recomiendan sus clientes han hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que cuente con una clientela fija.

Walter desea adquirir madera en cantidad para poder brindar trabajarla y elaborar los pedidos que le solicitan. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Walter is 24 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Pomape, a rural area where the main business activity is agriculture. This community is in the District of La Victoria and located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Walter has a carpentry workshop in his home where he produces all types of woodwork with innovative designs based on the preferences of the customer. He has been in this business for five years and is known for being a perfectionist in his trade. As a result of his good work, Walter has received recommendations from his customers that have helped him develop a good reputation and establish a steady clientele.

He wants to acquire wood in large quantities so that he can continue to work and fulfill the orders that have been submitted. For this reason, Walter is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ QORILAZO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Cachona - Santiago, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Crispin, el socio tiene 60 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 4 hijos todos ellos independientes, el socio es maestro de obras y trabaja con diferentes obras el tiene amigos que lo llaman cuando hay una obra en camino para que se presente y pueda trabajar, el socio requiere comprar herramientas para su trabajo, el socio trabaja como albañil que es su especialidad, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas nuevas.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “ QORILAZO”.  It is located in the town of Cachona - Santiago, in Cusco province and department.

Crispin is 60 years old, lives with his partner, and has four children who all live independently.  He is a master builder and works on different construction jobs.  He has friends who call him when there is a construction job coming up so that he can come and work on it.  Crispin needs to buy tools.  He works as a bricklayer which is his speciality.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying new tools.

Crispin is grateful for this loan and would like to make it known that he will make his loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying new tools

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Edda del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usa desde hace 18 años la cual distribuye en San Ramón, la Dalia…en el departamento de Matagalpa de donde es originaria. 
Además de este negocio en su casa de Managua los sábados vende nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo, y los domingos vende sopas.
texts.en: Señora Edda del Socorro is a hard-working and courageous enterprising woman. For 18 years she has been selling second-hand clothes in San Ramón and La Dalia, located in her native department of Matagalpa. In addition to this business, she has two other activities at her home in Managua. On Saturdays she sells nacatamales, a typical food consisting of dough made from corn and a filling consisting of pork meat. And on Sundays she sells soup.

loans.use: to buy clothes, corn, pork meat, vegetables, bones and chickens.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
La Sra. Verónica es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de una hija la que ha criado sola y tratado de dar una buena educación, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para el aprendizaje de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para compra medicamentos y pago de consultas médicas para mejorar su salud, ya que últimamente ha presentado problemas en su recuperación, por tal razón decidió solicitar su cuarto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad y recuperarse para seguir laborando y brindarle un buen nivel de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Verónica is from El Sauce.  She is a single mother of a daughter.  She has raised her alone and tried to give her a good education.  She works as an Elementary School Teacher in a local school where she’s been working for over 20 years teaching children.

She owns her house.  One of the needs she currently is having is to get a loan to buy medicine and to pay for doctor’s visits to improve her health because she’s recently had some problems with her recovery.  Because of this, she decided to ask for her fourth loan from Ceprodel to meet this need and to recover so that she can continue to work and provide her daughter with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to pay medical costs.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and their 11 children. For the last 15 years, she has made a living by running a shop where she sells a variety of items. Carolina is applying for a loan for PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, breads, biscuits and beverages to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008 and hopes to continue expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Omayma

texts.en:
Omayma is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Bani Kenanah, an impoverished community in Irbid, Jordan, and comes from a comparatively small family of four girls. Omayma and her sisters were raised by her mother and grandmother. Omayma and her mother and sisters were abandoned by their father when they were all young so they moved into their mother’s family home where they were raised by “a village” of extended family.  Even so, they could not escape the poverty that would not allow them to get an education. Realizing that not being educated would handicap her daughters, Omayma’s mother stepped in and taught her girls how to sew and embroider women’s clothing. Omayma found her passion – she loves to sew.

After her first year of marriage, Omayma gave birth to a beautiful baby girl. Sine then, her family has grown to include two more daughters – all loved and cherished by their doting mother. Omayma has never lost her love for creating women’s fashion and has established a small business from her home to enable her to work and raise her daughters at the same time.  

Omayma envisions her creations long before each item takes its finA. form. She starts creating a new piece of clothing by first imagining how it will look, then drawing a picture of the dress and asking one of her friends to model while she drapes and pins the materiA. to bring her design to life. From there, Omayma sews the pieces together and finishes it with ornate embroidery. Omayma has gradually built a clientele from the members of her immediate community and she is developing a reputation for her beautiful designs that extends beyond Irbid. 

Omayma is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase a modern sewing machine, storage boxes to organize her supplies, and hanging display racks to best display her creations.

As Omayma can imagine a new design, she can also dream big – she dreams of expanding her project throughout the Kingdom and making a name for herself. She hopes to increase her clientele and her income. Someday, Omayma would like to be able to give her daughters an opportunity to carry on the family business or feel the freedom to pursue their own dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine, storage boxes, and hanging display racks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant grass for a pasture.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a hardworking father engaged in farming in the Philippines. He is 56 years old and is married with one child. He has been into rice farming for eight years now. He brings out the best of him to uplift his family out from poverty through farming. 

To strengthen his farming, Reynaldo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to ensure good production of rice that he maintains so he can generate sufficient income for his family needs. He further said that this loan will help him grow his farming through the years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to ensure good production of the rice he maintains

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn the income to support a family to be as rich as others. But Mrs. Chay and her husband try against the odds to feed all their children every day so that none die and they have a good standard of living. 

Both of them have been farmers since 2005. They can earn about $5 per day. They have two children to support. To raise their family, Mrs. Chay and her husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn en una joven mujer, tiene 24 años, es muy trabajadora y sobre todo la conocen por ser muy responsable. Hace varios años que vive con su pareja y sus dos menores hijos en la casa de sus suegros.El trabajo de Evelyn consiste en la venta de comida. Cuando empieza a caer la noche ella sale con su mesa y sillas a la vereda de su casa para empezar su jornada de trabajo diario, ella vende comida con productos regionales, lleva ya más de un año en este trabajo que hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que tiene a disposición por el día para poder cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, siempre vende regular. Espera más adelante poder agrandar su negocio y poder tener un terreno propio ya que no le gusta estar aún viviendo en casa de sus suegros.Este es el préstamo numero dos entre Evelyn t la institución MFP, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos pues se siente bien tanto con la institución así como con sus compañeras de grupo. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, ella comprará ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de su comida, además necesita algunos implementos necesarios para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a young woman, 24 years of age. She is very hardworking and above all is known for being very responsible. She has lived with her partner and their two minor children in the home of her in-laws for several years. Evelyn's work consists of selling food. When night begins to fall she goes outside with her table and chairs to the sidewalk in front of her house to begin her daily work shift. She sells foods using regional products and has been doing this work, alone, for more than one year. What she likes about her work is the time she has available during the day to be able to care for her young children, and her sales are always pretty good. 

In the future she hopes to be able to expand her business and have her own plot of land since she doesn't care to be living still in the home of her in-laws. This is the second loan between Evelyn and the institution MFP. She hopes to be able to continue working together since she feels good about the institution and the other members of the group. With the 800 soles she has requested, she will purchase ingredients and supplies for the preparation of her food. She also needs some implements for doing her work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her food, and also some implements she needs to do her work.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria  de 29 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 10 años respectivamente. Desde allí se dedica a confeccionar ropa  en todas las líneas, negocio que inició aprovechando la infraestructura y la experiencia de su madre y cuando ésta dejó de producir en el año 2006, tomó la decisión de emprender su propia aventura de negocio, para apoyar el ingreso familiar. Hoy cuenta con 3 maquinas de confeccionar, 1 fileteadora y una máquina collarín. Victoria en su negocio despliega gran entusiasmo,  que le ha permitido crecer y quiere aun continuar con su crecimiento, pero su principal desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta,  para responder a una creciente clientela, que la reconoce cada día mas y así mismo aumenta su nivel de exigencias en el tema de ser oportuna. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como telas, hilos, adornos, para confeccionar vestidos de novia, primeras comuniones y grados, pues se acercan épocas de gran despliegue comercial, por efecto de las fiestas del segundo semestre que se acercan y debe estar preparada para ello.
texts.en:
Victoria, 29, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and three children whose ages range from 5 to 10 years.  From there she works making clothing in all styles, a business she started taking advantage of the infrastructure and experience that her mother had left behind when she stopped working in 2006.  She decided to start her own adventure in business to contribute to family income.  Today, she has three sewing machines, an overlock machine and a special machine used to attach collars.  

Victoria is very enthusiastic about her business that has allowed her to grow and she wants to continue to grow but her main challenge is the insufficient working capital she has to respond to growing clientele which hears about her daily and thus increases the level of need to be responsive to demand.

This is the reason why she’s calling upon a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy raw materials like fabric, thread and decorations to manufacture gowns for weddings, first communions, and graduation because the season of increased commercial activity is approaching due to the impending second semester festivities and she has to be prepared for it.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread and decorations to make gowns for weddings, first communions and graduation.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 41 years old and lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband Jesus is a mechanic and they have two children. She earns a living by selling household merchandise and cell phone credits. Most of her customers are neighbors, and she generates revenues of at least PHP 5,500 a week. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her dream is to provide her children with a high-quality education. One way she does that is by meeting with other borrowers who learn from each other, and by studying the Word of God. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 40 years old. She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, a 46-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom attend school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a food stall selling frozen foods in the Philippines for the past two years, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Grupo De María Group

texts.es:
Pozos group está conformado por tres personas (mujeres). En este grupo la presidenta es María.

María tiene 56 años es soltera y vive con un hijo de dos que tiene. Vive en San Gabriel en la provincia de el Carchi en el Norte de Ecuador. María se describe como una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y le gusta salir adelante diariamente.

María trabaja sola en la compra venta de carbón, empezó su negocio hace 20 años ya que necesitaba dinero para mantener a sus hijos. Es el tercer crédito que solicitan a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de carbón para su reventa ya que se viene una buena temporada lo cual le generará buenos ingresos que cambiarán su estilo de vida.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en lo que domino o sea el comercio de las papas y carbón, gradece a FODEMI por haberle ayudado con los créditos.
texts.en:
Pozos Group is composed of three women.  María is the president of this group.

María, 56, is single and lives with one of her two children.  She lives in San Gabriel in the province of El Carchi in northern Ecuador.  María describes herself as a hardworking worker, an entrepreneur who likes to get ahead every day.

María works alone buying and selling charcoal.  She began her business twenty years ago since she needed money to support her children.  This is the third loan she is requesting from FODEMI, and it will be used to buy charcoal for resale.   A good season is coming, which will generate good income that will change her lifestyle.

Her dream is to continue working in what she knows, which is the business of potatoes and charcoal.  She is grateful to FODEMI for having helped her with the loans.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and three siblings, works with his siblings in order to improve the family’s standard of living. He began to work as a freelance painter in 2005 and is very loyal to his customers. Now requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase painting equipment to start a new project, in the future Mohamad plans to open his own paint shop.

loans.use: to purchase painting equipment to start a new painting project.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité “San Cayetano” se encuentra en el décimo tercer ciclo del programa "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" de la fundación, tiene 17 integrantes. Todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de crear mayores beneficios para todas ellas por medio del trabajo en equipo. Son mujeres muy activas que regularmente realizan actividades para recaudar dinero para casos de emergencia. 
Una de las miembros es la señora Gladis, quien se dedica a la venta de alimentos de todo tipo. Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, puesto que a sus clientes les encanta los platillos que ella prepara. Ya que desea seguir con el negocio solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, condimentos y demás, los cuales son indispensables para la elaboración de los alimentos. 
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues la ayuda es muy importante.
texts.en:
