The “San Cayetano” committee is in its 13th cycle in the Fundación’s Enterprising Women’s Committee; it has 17 members.  They all joined together with the goal of creating major benefits for themselves through their team work.  They are very active women who regularly carry out fundraising activities for emergencies.

One of the group members of Gladis who sells all kinds of food.  She comments that she does well in the business because her customers love the dishes she prepares.  Because she wants to stay in business she’s asking for a loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and others which are indispensable for her meal preparation.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her because the help is very important.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and more.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negoicio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La solicita el credito para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our associate continues to work in her small grocery store where she sells basic need products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies, our associate works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM, through this business she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand the business and requests a loan to buy wholesale products for the store such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  

Our associate is happy about the loan and commits to make the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products for her store such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto es jubilado y recibe una renta mensual. El crédito que requiere es para la construcción de muro frontal de su domicilio e instalación de gas domiciliario. Ernesto es viudo y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de San Pedro  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto is retired and receives a monthly pension. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a wall at the front of his house and to install a gas line. Ernesto is a widower and has one child. He lives in his own home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to build a wall and to install a gas line in his home.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Hermenia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Hermenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hermenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sanzu B Group

texts.fr:
Laurette est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite à Ruyigi.Elle vendeuse de la bière de banane comme son mari Alexis. Elle a étudié jusqu’en 4e année année primaire. Elle fait le commerce depuis 2 ans. Avant de se lancer dans le commerce, elle était cultivatrice. Le couple a 4 enfants dont 2 étudient. Elle a déjà bénéficié 3 crédits de Turame.
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient , lui permet d’augmenter son capital et l’achat d’une ou deux chèvres pour avoir du fumier.
Elle membre du groupe communautaire « Sanzu B ».
texts.en:
Laurette is a 32-year-old shopkeeper living in Ruyigi. Along with her husband, she sells banana beer. She studied up to the fourth year of primary school and has been involved in business for two years. Before starting this business, she was a farmer. The couple have four children, two of whom are in school. She has already benefited from three loans through Turame.
The Kiva loan that she obtains will allow her to increase her capital and buy one or two goats to have manure.
She is a member of the community group "Sanzu B".

loans.use: To increase her capital and to buy one or two goats for manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 3 y el menor de un año y 8 meses, la mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de electrónica.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de Avon y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos  días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, aunque se le hace difícil a ella le gusta realizar sus recorridos y en la actualidad tiene que llevar a sus dos hijos más pequeños ya que no tiene donde dejarlos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.

En la fotografía está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the village bank La Union Hace la Fuerza meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place known for delicious sweets made by the locals and recognized throughout the country.

Here we meet Elizabeth, 28, who is married and has 3 children, ages 10, 3 and almost 2. Her oldest is in school. Her husband has an electronics workshop.

She is a housewife who is also a saleswoman. She sells products from Avon and Sayson catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works two or three hours every day, although it's hard for her to make door-to-door sales because she has to take her two youngest with her since she doesn't have anywhere to leave them. She sells items on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She has been doing this for 8 years and it's going very well. Her most popular products are perfumes and cosmetics because they're very good.

She will use this loan for perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry. This is her third cycle with the village bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a boutique. 

She is pictured here with her son.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Teetee

texts.en:
Teetee has a business of selling cooked eggs to make a living for her and her family of 8. She delivers to local schools and the hospital. With 4 children to put through school things were getting expensive and she needed more money to increase her stock. She has 2 children out of school and they could help her with the business.

Tetee is capable of supplying Avele College 5 days a week which gives her a profit of $40 a week. Her expenses range from $50 - $60 a week. She has succeeded in offering the local schools with her food services and satisfying their community. She plans to use her next loan to increase her supply of sandwiches and expanding the menu.

loans.use: Ingredients and school fees

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail O. lives in Agsu city where he owns a butcher shop at the local bazaar. He is 45 years old and is married with five children. With this loan he wants to purchase more animals and provide his customers with a wider choice as well.

loans.use: to purchase animals

loans.name: Leata

texts.en: Leata runs a fishing business from Faleula and earns 300 a week. She is expanding her business and needs to buy more nets to cater to the demand of the fishing industry in the country.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Kelin

texts.en:
Kelin is a 25-year-old who makes huipiles for her livelihood. Huipiles are wonderful handmade blouses worn by the Mayan women in the highlands of Guatemala. She will buy the hand-woven material from other women in her village and then hand embroider flowers and through out the blouse. Her technique of embroidering these fabrics is highly specialized and different from that of her neighbors – she actually apprenticed to another master embroiderer to learn the technique.

The current piece she is creating incorporates 33 different Mayan symbols which are called hieroglyphs. The Maya hieroglyphics were the writing system of the pre-Columbian civilization. It will take her 15 days to create the exquisite finished blouse and she will sell it for about US$85. She also makes a less expensive blouse that has embroidered flowers throughout the top part of the blouse and sells for about $35.

Kelin is married and has a 3-year-old. Her husband works in the fields. Her biggest goal, which she is passionate about, is to ensure that her child must receive an education to become a professional, escaping the limited opportunities her husband endures.

Her health is not good and like so many other women and children in her village, she suffers from many ailments during the six-month rainy season. Malnutrition is a factor in this community. The women all breast feed and most of the children under two years old are underweight and therefore get hit the hardest with illness. Many of the women are looking for resources to obtain vitamins for their babies.

Here is a video of the women of Kelin's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase embroidery thread

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: This 36 year old woman dedicates herself to preparing and selling ´chimi churri.´  Frequently abbreviated to ‘chimi,’ it’s a hot sandwich – either a pork burger or roast pork – adorned with fresh salad and a variety of sauces squeezed from plastic bottles.  Her husband works as a watchman in a hotel at Bávaro, a touristy zone located in the east of the country.  She has three boys and a girl.  They attend the public school of the suburb; the elder is finishing the last grade of secondary school.  Esther operates the business from 4 pm to 12 am.  Besides the ´chimi,´ she also sells beer and natural juices.  With her loan, she wants to purchase raw materials such as ´salami,´ cabbage, lettuce, onion, and meat, in order to prepare her ´chimis.´  With the profits from business, she will help her husband financially support  their children and continue improving the family’s life condition.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to continue preparing and selling her 'chimis,' a typical hot sandwich of the Dominican Republic.

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou in the county of Vo, Mrs. Houndjénouko K. is 45 years old, married and the mother of five (05) children. Her principal occupation is agriculture, she is one of the big farmers in her town. This activity is very profitable and provides just the minimum to sustain her family needs. But to do better, that is to increase her yield, she would like to buy fertilizers. Because she lacks the financial means, she is requesting a loan of $250. Once her goal is reached, the profit she will gain will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family, a source of blossoming for her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Tékponou dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame K. Houndjénouko âgée de 45 ans est mariée et est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Ayant comme activité principale l’agriculture, elle est l’une des grandes agricultrices de sa localité. Cette activité très rentable lui procure le minimum possible pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais pour mieux faire c'est-à-dire améliorer son rendement, elle voudrait acheter des engrais. Par manque de moyens financiers, elle vient solliciter un crédit $250. Ce but atteint lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille par le profit qu’elle en tirera, source d’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Doãn Thị Tuyết, 54, joined TYM fund in 2001. Her first loan was 60 USD which was invested in poultry raising. She was also selling basic goods like eggs, garlic, onion ...etc. Her daily income was about 2-3 USD, combined with her husband salary she was able to cover the family expenses and put away some savings. In her 3rd year with TYM, she used the loan and her savings to expand her poultry business. She now has a flock of 30 egg laying chickens, this brings in 100 USD a month. She is applying for a loan of 625 USD to buy some pigs and chicken feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001, chị Doãn Thị Tuyết, 54 tuổi, vay mức vay đầu tiên là 60USD. Với số tiền này chị đã đầu tư vào nuôi gà đẻ và buôn bán các mặt hàng như trứng gà, hành, tỏi v.v... Số tiền lãi thu được hàng ngày khoảng từ 2-3USD đủ để chị bớt đi những lo toan về kinh tế. Cộng với số lương hưu của chồng, ngoài các khoản chi tiêu hàng tháng, chị cũng tích lũy được thêm ít nhiều. Cộng với đồng vốn vay từ năm thứ 3 chị đã đầu tư vào mở rộng chăn nuôi. Đàn gà hiện nay của chị Tuyết khoảng 30 con mang lại cho chị thu nhập 100USD/tháng. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 625USD để mua thêm vài con lợn cùng thức ăn cho đàn gà của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs, mash and chicken feed

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Susana del Carmen P. is a married woman with three school-aged children. She has a business selling soft drinks, natural juices, and bread. She has gained experience in this line of work since she was a young girl, so she has spent a lot of time dedicated to this work. She started her business when she noticed that the lack of money in her nuclear family was notable. She was helping another lady sell these same products, so she wasn't afraid to start this kind of business.

Susana has worked with CEPRODEL for one year, having received four credits, which she has used wisely in the purchase of her beverages. They have also helped her prepare tacos and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Susana del Carmen P. es una dama casada y con tres hijos que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, ella desde jovencita tiene experiencia en este negocio por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a esta labor. El negocio lo comienza cuando ella se da cuenta que la falte de dinero en el núcleo familiar era notable, en un momento de su vida ella ayudaba a otra señora a vender estos mismos productos y por esta razón no tuvo temor para emprender esta labor.

Susana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año habiendo recibido 4 créditos que los ha utilizado sabiamente en la compra de sus refrescos, además le ha alcanzado para elaborar tacos y comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and fruit to make her drinks

loans.name: Ni Putu Wirati

texts.id:
Even though her husband has a regular income, Ni Putu Wirati cannot only depend on her husband's income. At home, Ni Putu Wirati opens a small kiosk that sells various kind of staples for the neighbourhood. She sells staples such as rice, eggs, various kind of snacks, soaps, etc. She has run this business since she was married to I Nengah Suarba. Through the non-profit organization in her village, Ni Putu Wirarti got a loan from DINARI. She used the loan to buy more merchandise so that the kiosk has more varieties of merchandise. The kiosk opens in the morning at 6am until 7pm. After finishing the work in the kiosk, Ni Putu Wirati continues her housework at home, such as cooking, cleaning and preparing for her 2 children who studies in elementary school. Her net profit is about Rp. 20,000 to Rp. 30,000 per day. Thanks to the profit, Ni Putu can learn to become more independent and to not always depend on her husband's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun suaminya mempuinyai penghasilan tetap, namun Ni Putu Wirati tetap tidak hanya mengandalkan pekerjaan suaminya. Dirumahnya, Ni Putu Wirati membuka warung kecil yang menjual berbagai macam keperluan sehari-hari yang sangat diperlukan bagi masyarakat disekitarnya. Barang barang yang dijual adalah kebutuhan pokok seperti, beras, telor, aneka makanan ringan, sabun mandi, sabun mandi dan lain-lain . Usaha ini sudah dijalani sejak menikah dengan I Nengah Suarba, suaminya. Melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Ni Putu Wirati mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan dana pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk menambah dan melengkapi segala keperluan yang belum ada sehinga warung semakin lengkap dan lebih bervariasi barang dagangannya. Warungnya dibuka pagi hari mulai pada puku 6.00 wita dan tutup pada sore hari pukul 7.00 wita Setelah selesai membuka warung, Ni Putu Wirati kembali meneruskan pekerjaan untuk keluarganya yaitu, memasak, mencuci dan mempersipakan keperluan kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah tingkat dasar. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat mencapai Rp.20.000,- s/d Rp.30.000,- dalam sehari. Dari keuntungan inilah Ni Putu Wirati dapat belajar mandiri dan tidak selalu mengandalkan pendapatan dari pekerjaan suaminya.

loans.use: To add more capital to buy more varieties of merchandise for the kiosk

loans.name: Dustmatova

texts.ru:
B. Dustmatova is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children. B. has a high school education. Her husband helps her in her business. She has 11 years of experience in her area of business. B. turned to MicroInvest because of the high interest rates that illegal lenders charge. When she started as a client her assets were worth $300, today they are worth $1,275. She has her own sales location and a higher product assortment. In the future she plans to acquire an additional sales location for wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустматова Бахри – 48 лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле. Имеет опыт в этой сфере 11 лет. Причиной кредитования в МЗФ «Микроинвест» стало большие проценты нелегальных кредиторов. Начала кредитоваться с активами на 300 долларов, а сейчас они достигают 1275$. У нее уже отдельная точка торговли и увеличенный ассортимент товара. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну точку для оптовой реализации.

loans.use: Acquire an additional sales location

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen A., age 50, is a mother of three children and has two plots of farmland. This is her business that supports the household. One child is married and works selling fish in a busy market, making approximately about $200 a month in revenue; her other child is a farmer helping her parents and the last child is a student. Everyday, Mrs. Ngen A. and her husband always go to the farmland to take care of their crops. They not only grow rice but also plant a variety of beans. They normally earn about $2 per day of profit.

Even though Cambodia used to be the number one rice exporter, right now most of the people are disappointed with the weather, especially in the rainy season. Sometimes in the rainy season there is no rain so farmers do not have enough water for their crops. To help this family have no difficulties, they would like to take out a loA. from Kiva to purchase good rice seeds, beA. seeds, fertilizers and a water pump to water the crops in the dry season, in case there is a lack of water.

In the future, they also plA. to build a stable house and purchase a motorbike to transfer their output to sell in the market. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase rice, bean seeds, fertilizers and a water pump

loans.name: Etiennette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Etiennette K. was born April 17, 1972 in Cotonou, in the Atlantique du Sud department in Benin. She is married to Mr. Julien Houinsou, a freight agent at the Autonomous Port of Cotonou, and has two children who still live at home. For five years, she has been selling firewood and coal used by most households in Cotonou who often do not have enough money to buy household gas. For firewood, she often buys tree trunks that are then chopped. With an excellent record in this line of business, she is requesting this loan to purchase wood. She holds the monopoly on firewood in her neighborhood, where households often use firewood for cooking.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame K. Etiennette est né le 17 avril 1972 à COTONOU dans le département de l’Atlantique au sud du BENIN. Mariée à monsieur HOUINSOU Julien, transitaire au Port Autonome de COTONOU, elle a deux enfants à sa charge. Depuis 5 ans, elle commercialise du bois de chauffage et du charbon utilisés par la grande majorité des ménages de Cotonou ne disposant pas très souvent de moyens financiers pour se procurer le gaz domestique. Pour le bois de chauffage, elle achète très souvent des troncs d’arbres qui sont par la suite fendus. Ayant fait ses preuves dans ce secteur d’activité, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s’approvisionner en bois. Elle se trouve dans une situation de monopole dans son quartier où les ménages utilisent le bois de chauffage pour faire la cuisine.

loans.use: Purchase of one truckload of firewood

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena K. is a divorced woman with 3 children who are currently in school. She is a 45-year-old trader who trades in charcoal. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has supported her first born to complete senior high school. Abena obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called King of Kings Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Mrs. Path S. is a farmer in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Pheara Hon, helps his wife business when he has free time from selling pigs. Since his pig-selling business activity is going well, Mr. Pheara Hon would like to buy a new motorbike to transport his piglets to sell from door-to-door. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy it so Mrs. Path S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Path S. had already obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to transport his piglets to sell from door-to-door.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 30 years old. She is single and she takes care of 1 person who is 56 years old. She has been selling shoes and bedsheets since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4:30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes and bedsheets for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank has eight members and is located in Preak Ta Ten Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Li L., the Village Bank president, was selected by the members to be the group leader. She is a farmer who cultivates both vegetables and rice. Since her vegetable field now is infertile, Mrs. Li L. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field. With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy more seeds to grow more vegetables.

Her husband, Mr. Phuong Vantha, is a fisherman, who gathers very few fish. Mrs. Li L. is 34 years old, and the mother of three children: two attend the local school, and the youngest one is 5 years old, and too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the field to produce more crops

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina has been selling groceries for 11 years. Her husband works as an accountant but the salary he makes is not enough to feed the family. Zarina began selling groceries to help support her family. She would like a loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia Jovhanna

texts.es:
La Sra. Inocencia vive en el barrio Miraflores del Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus  tres hijos todos, se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
Su actividad principal es el comercio D. ropa, labor que realiza desD. hace 6 años, actualmente mantiene a sus hijos junto a su esposo, quien tiene un automovil que trabaja como taxi, en la localidad. Tiene como objetivo abrir su propia tienda D. ropa, es decir tener un puesto fijo ya que con el que actualmente cuenta es ambulante.
texts.en:
Inocencia lives in the Miraflores del Torno neighborhood, in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives in her own home with her husband and three children who are students. Her main activitity is the sale of clothing, which she has done for the past 6 years. She supports her children together with her husband, who has his own car which he uses as a taxi. Her goal is to open her own clothing store; that is, to have a fixed stand rather than the mobile stand she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.en: Toshpulot S. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008, but he already has a good reputation and has not had any delays in the previous loan payments. Mr.S. is engaged in the family business of livestock. He is married and has 4 children. He is skilled in livestock with 40 years experience. He stared the livestock business when he was a young boy and helped his father to take care of animals. In addition, his wife sells milk and the milk products such as curd, sour cream and kefir. Mr.S. has one milk cow and 3 rams. Now he applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 6 months to purchase a bull, as the price for bulls are lower now than in any other season.

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 28 años, vive de manera independiente, ya que aun no se ha casado ni tiene hijos. Es una joven llena de vida, tras haber terminado sus estudios secundarios y no pudiendo lograr estudios superiores se ha dedicado a trabajar para poder salir adelante. Es así que incursionó, hace ya 4 años, en la venta de golosinas, actividad a la que le dedica la mayor parte del día, comienza a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche. A Silvia le gusta su trabajo, ya que la venta siempre le ha gustado, aunque algunas veces las inclemencias del clima le causen algunos inconvenientes, pero son mínimos, su trabajo le trae muchas gratificaciones. Silvia se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas y así mejorar sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old and lives independently since she has not yet married or had children. She is a young woman that is full of life and, having finished secondary school but been unable to continue on to more advanced studies, has dedicated herself to working so she can get ahead. It’s in this manner that, four years ago, she embarked on a business selling sweets/snacks. She carries out her activities for the major part of the day, starting at 8 am and continuing until 6 or 7 pm. Silvia enjoys her work since she has always taken pleasure in sales, although sometimes inclement weather poses some obstacles. These, however, are minimal and she finds her work to be very gratifying. Silvia finds herself in her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and has been very punctual with her payments. With the funds requested, she will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise so she can improve her daily earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Trece años atrás Jenny se dedicaba a ayudar en el puesto de comida de su suegra, sirviendo a los clientes o ayudando en la cocina. Una vez que su suegra tuvo que abandonar el negocio por motivos de viaje ella se encargó de manejar el negocio. Hoy en día ella trabaja todos los días ofreciendo desayuno, almuerzo  y lonche a los clientes.

Ahora con la ayuda de su hermana también ofrece el servicio de reparto de menús. Recibe el pedido de algunos trabajadores cerca de su local y ella prepara los paquetes a ser repartidos.

Gracias a su trabajo Jenny puede atender a sus tres hijos. Las ganancias las reparte entre su inversión, ahorro y manutención de su hogar. Dentro de un tiempo le gustaría ampliar el local que tiene actualmente o alquilar uno mas grande y poder mudarse fuera del mercado.
texts.en:
Thirteen years ago, Jenny used to help her mother-in-law in her restaurant (food stand) by serving clients or helping around the kitchen. Since her mother-in-law had to leave due to some traveling issues, Jenny took over the restaurant business. Now she works everyday serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. With the help of her sister, she also delivers. She gets orders from the local workers and she prepares the food ready to go. Thanks to her job, Jenny is able to look after her 3 children. She splits her profits by puting money back on to her business, savings, and by paying the household bills. In the near future, she would like to add on to her present location or rent a bigger one and be able to move out of the local marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase main ingredients for the month

loans.name: Las Paraguayitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo de Señoras, con el espiritu emprendedor que poseen, se agruparón para la formación del comite y crecer todas juntas para el progreso personal y economico de las mismas, saben que la situación economica actual nos lleva a trabajar mas, porque son señoras que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia, son amas de casa que trabajan para sobrevivir, y con este apoyo crediticio que se les otorgara sera una herramienta muy útil para sobrellevar la situción economica actual.
texts.en:
This group of women, with the entrepreneurial spirit that they have, have gathered to form a committee and grow together for personal and economic progress. They know that their current economic situation requires them to work more, because they are women with responsibility to support their families. They are housewives that work to survive, and this help in the form of a loan will be a useful tool to overcome their current economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items that each will use in her respective business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is a 29-year-old mother of three: Raniel, seven years old; Patricia S., six years old; and her youngest, Angel. They live in a peaceful community of Minante 2 in Cauayan City. She is married to Ramuel S. Jr, her partner in business and in taking care of their three children. Most of his time is devoted to maintaining their small farm lot where they generate their major source of income. 

Prior to starting a community store, Lolita was engaged in the food vending business for almost two years. Then she decided to shift into poultry production (livestock) and the sari-sari store (community store) business. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more goods for her store to increase her weekly income and support her children’s education and her poultry raising business.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Domingo Asilo

texts.es: El señor Domingo A. B., tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el barrio san Juan de la concepción junto a su esposa  la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos una hija de 17 años que estudia en la universidad, una de 16 que estudia su secundaria y una de siete años que estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es darle mejores condiciones de vida ; el se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio ,desde hace veinte años trabaja en sus tierras , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que atacan al cultivo por la falta de fertilizantes ya que el no tiene capital suficiente  para hacer esta inversión , el inicio la actividad agrícola por sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar su producción y compra mas terreno , con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y vender mejor la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo A. B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife in the Juan de la concepción neighborhood. Domingo's wife works as a fruit vendor. The couple has three children: a 17 year old daughter who attends university, a 16 year old daughter who is in high school, and a 7 year old daughter who is in primary school. Domingo and his wife would like to give their family the best quality of life. Domingo has been a farmer for 20 years, and also sold his produce. He became a farmer because his parents were also farmers. The greatest challenge is the plagues which attack the crop because of a lack of fertilizers. Domingo doesn't currently have sufficient capital for this investment. In the future he'd like to improve production and buy more land. With this loan he'll purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve the harvest and sell better crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
La Sra. Albina T. es nacida en la cuidad de chuquisaca, pero hace quince años que vive y trabaja por esta zona, Santa Cruz, es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos.
Cuenta con una parcela en la que siembra maíz, arroz y  yuca. 
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la siembra de papa ya que es su época, las siembras lo realizan por temporadas de acuerdo al producto. Es una persona muy trabajadora ya que es madre soltera y sola mantiene a su familia de 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Albina T. was born in the city of Chuquisaca, but has lived and worked in Santa Cruz for the past 15 years. She is a single mother with five children. She has a plot of land where she harvests corn, rice and yucca. The loan she is requesting will be used to plant potato since it is in season. She plants her crops according to the time of year for that product. She is a very hard-working woman since she is a single mother and is the only provider for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia T., 43 years old, lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with six children. Her husband works as a motor cab driver, but his income is not enough to meet their daily needs. Therefore, she has started a pig-raising venture.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00, which she will use for purchasing pig feed. Her pig-raising venture will help them to support the family and pay for the education expenses of the children.

She plans to purchase more pigs for her business, hoping to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: La Alianza, Group 4

texts.en:
The five entrepreneurs taking part in this loan are on their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza International. Ysabel S. is their coordinator.

Ysabel and her husband have three children, but they are all grown up. Ysabel has hairstyling skills, but doesn't work as a hairdresser. Instead, she sells a variety of products: from accesories, to personal care, to home products. She will use this loan to buy what her customers have been ordering from her lately.

Ysabel doesn't want to go back to beauty. She dreams of becoming an important supplier in the San Pedro area and own a large warehouse. She also hopes her profits will help her support her children's education and help them go to college.

Ysabel has come a long way, but has not lost her determination or initiative. Please help us continue to support her and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchasing varied merchandises to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells provisions like tissue paper, bathing soap, beverages, etc. She is married, has 4 children and she is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva loan lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell .

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71115&_tpos=12&_tpg=1
Lisseth es socia del Bancomunal el roble
Lisseth es conviviente, tiene 27 años.
Lisseth terminó la escuela estatal, pero no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de dinero, se puso a trabajar en el mercado de productores en el área de abarrotes al por mayor, al tiempo se junto con su esposo tuvo sus hijos, ella decidió ponerse a  vender menú en las obras constructoras que su esposo trabaja, también reparte menú   a los inquilinos por la zona  donde vive.
Desde que Lisseth esta en Finca, tiene un respaldo económico, aprendió a ser perseverante., su economía ha mejorado  
Lisseth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de utensilios, taper y compra de víveres para la preparación del menú.
El sueño de Lisseth es tener un restaurante y comprar un carro
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71115&_tpos=12&_tpg=1

Lisseth is a member of the communal bank, El Roble. She lives with her partner and is 27 years old.

Lisseth finished state school, but was unable to continue studying due to lack of money so she started working in a producer's market in the wholesale groceries section. While there, she met her partner, had her children and decided to start delivering food to the construction workers where her companion works. She also started delivering food to the renters in the zone where she lives.

Since lisseth started working with Finca, she has gained economic support, learned to persevere, and her standard of living has improved.

Lisseth needs a loan of 800 soles in order to purchase utensils, tupperware, and ingredients to prepare food for her customers. Her dream is to have a restaurant and to someday purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils, tupperware and ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is a farmer. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to hire more laborers to enable her clear her farm. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Aquilina es soltera, tiene 53 años y 1 hijo, Aquilina se dedica a la agricultura en la comunidad de Compañía , produce verduras, alfalfa, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Aquilina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas.
Los sueños de Aquilina son techar el cuarto piso de su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Solución Community Bank. Aquilina is 53, single, and has one child. Aquilina is a farmer in the Compañía community. She produces vegetables and alfalfa. She sells in the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho. Aquilina needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy seeds. Aquilina’s dreams are to put a roof on the fourth floor of her house and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Maria Felix P. tiene 38 años de edad. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y que desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para mantener a sus 2 hijos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por su suegra ya que presentaba problemas de salud y ella sabia elaborar muy bien los nacatamales y además conocía muy bien la venta de los derivados. Por lo que más tarde observa que con este negocio logra obtener los suficientes ingresos para  salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es par capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, leña, maíz para la elaboración de los nacatamales. Su mayor sueño es obtener un vehículo que le ayude a movilizarse.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen V., 38, is married with two children and resides in the Kompong Cham Province. To make a living, her husband (pictured) has to travel from place to place to find work as a construction worker. He is able to earn a daily income of $4, which is the primary source of income for the family. The family is also assisted by the two children, who are currently working as their father does with a reasonable income to earn a good living.

V. really wants to take a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer for her rice fields. She hopes she will be able to make her rice fields efficient enough to produce maximum outputs.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bethleem Plus Group

texts.fr: Marcelin est micro entrepreneur depuis 2003. Il est dirigeant d’une banque communautaire dénommée « Bethleem Plus » composée de 25 membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des crédits des prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC. Son activité consiste à faire louer des chaises au marché central de Kinshasa. Il est client fidèle qui a reçu 7 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés totalement à temps. Le prochain crédit lui servira d’acheter d’autres chaises à faire louer pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et augmenter son capital. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un poulailler en vue produire et vendre des œufs et surtout le souci de diversifier son affaire dans le but d’accroitre le bénéfice. Marcelin est âgé de 47 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants âgés de 10 à 15 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Marcelin has been a small business owner since 2003. He is the leader of the village bank "Bethleem Plus", a group of 25 members who are jointly liable for the loans that lenders worldwide grant them through Kiva and microfinance institution HOPE DRC. Marcelin's business consists in renting chairs at the central market in Kinshasa. He is a regular client who got seven loans and repaid all his installments on schedule. He will use his next loan to buy more chairs to meet the demand of his customers and increase his working capital. His ambition is to open a henhouse to produce and sell eggs, thus diversifying his business and increasing his income. Marcelin is aged 47, married and the father of three children aged 10 to 15. They all attend school.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs to rent

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a young man who owns a small shop in Tulkarem city. He sells all kinds of women’s accessories including necklaces, bracelets, earrings, in addition to makeup, hair-treatment products, scarves, and many other things.

Jamal established this business 3 years ago and now he plans to take a loan from FATEN of 1,000 USD in order to redecorate his shop and to increase the space for showing his products.

Jamal is not married and he lives with his family. He doesn't contribute to the overall family income since his father asked him to use all his profits to improve his business.

Jamal appear in the photo at his place of business.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop and increase its space

loans.name: Khulafai Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are some of the teachers of the Khulafai Primary School, located in Makeni, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. The school serves a total of 805 students (338 boys, 467 girls) and employs 23 teachers. In operation for 12 years, it receives a small annual stipend from the government to help cover its operating costs (very few schools in Sierra Leone are funded exclusively by the government). The school reports many successes, including the fact that the external (national) exam scores for their pupils have been steadily increasing thanks in large part to the teachers' hard work. For many of the teachers here, however, life can be a struggle. The school has fallen into disrepair, and there are no funds available to build additional classrooms, repair walls, replace broken desks, or make other necessary adjustments. Furthermore, many teachers' salaries are long overdue, with some that have waited over two years to receive a paycheck. Many teachers engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries, and Khulafai's teachers are collectively seeking a loan of SLL 11 million from SMT and Kiva Lenders.

Momodu K. (pictured second from right, back row) is a senior teacher at the school and has taken on the role of group leader. Momodu is 46 years old and has been teaching young children for 25 years. He is married to a petty trader, and together they have eight children (three boys and five girls). Five of Momodu's children attend school and three are not yet old enough. Some time ago, he purchased a plot of land on which he dreamed of building a house for his family because he believes that "once you own a home, you have something for which you and your family can be proud." He plans to use his portion of the funds to finance the purchase of some materials so that he can begin construction.

loans.use: Construction of a family home on already-purchased land

loans.name: Marcos Genry

texts.es: Marcos Genry R. M. de 22 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Ilobasco, junto a su esposa y su pequeño de hijo de 8 meses de edad. El cuenta con un taller de serigrafía, negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora. Marcos solicita un préstamo, ya que desea comprar material nuevo para su taller, haciendo un viaje al país de Guatemala, lugar en el cual podrá comprar dicho material a mejor precio. A pesar que hasta ahora Marcos ha tenido muy buenos resultados con su negocio, el desea mejorarlo, ya que su hijo es la razón la cual lo impulsa a trabajar aún más.
texts.en:
Marcos Genry R. M. is 22 years old. He lives in the town of Ilobasco with his wife and their small eight month old child. He has a screen-printing shop. This business has been going very well for him. Marcos is asking for a loan because he wants to buy new material for his shop. He will travel to the country of Guatemala where he will buy this material at a better price. Even though Marcos has very good results with his business, he wishes to improve it. His child is the reason that causes him to work even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for screen-printing

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia NELIDA tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia NELIDA tiene cuatro hijos: Sergio tiene 29 años, Giovanna tiene 27 años, Milagros tiene 24 años y Lucero tiene 19 años todos estudian en la universidad.         
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de sabanas, colchas y cubre camas. Ella tiene su stand en el centro comercial “El Molino”. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia madre y padre para sus hijos y también es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como sabanas y cubre camas pues para esta época del año es cuando más vende.   
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NELIDA, 52, is from Cusco. She is a single mother of four children: Sergio, 29, Giovanna, 27, Milagros, 24, and Lucero, 19; all of them are university students. Nelida is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. She alternates her domestic responsibilities with the sale of sheets and bedspreads. She has a stand in the "El Molino" shopping center. She has been in this line of work for several years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is both mother and father to her children and a very hard-working, enterprising woman, who struggles to get her family ahead in life. She needs financing to buy more stock items like sheets and bedspreads because this time of the year is when she sells the most. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Juan Inocente

texts.es: Juan Inocente tiene 64 años de edad, es casado con 1 hijo mayor de edad. El tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general. El dio inicio a este negocio hace 15 años. A base de no tener un medio de trabajo decidió comenzar a vender muy pocos productos. En los últimos días el señor ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a la venta de sus productos por lo que las ventas han bajado, sin embargo con una buena técnica de mercadeo ha logrado quedarse en el mercado. El crédito será invertido en la compra de calzado, cosméticos ropa interior y de vestir. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante y si es posible empezar a tener vendedores que viajen a los departamentos a dejar su producto.
texts.en:
Juan Inocente is 64 years old, married, and has one adult son. He has a business selling general merchandise that he began fifteen years ago when he had no other employment and began selling a few items. Recently, Juan has had a few difficulties in regards to the sale of his products, as sales have decreased. However, his skills as a merchant have enabled him to stay in business.

He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and clothing. His goal is to grow exponentially, and, if possible, to begin to have vendors who travel to other regions distributing his products.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret C. is 30 years old and lives in Sophi village, Takeo province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are too young to go to school or to work while the other one is enrolled in primary public school.

Mrs. Ret C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Neng Hoem, sells cows. He is shown on the left in the photo.

This family tries to work hard with their businesses but they earn less income than required because they do not have enough money to expand them. Thus, Mrs. Ret C. decided to ask for a loan to buy some cows for her husband to re-sell. She hopes her husband can earn a higher income from his business because they will have enough capital to expand it.

loans.use: To buy some cows for her husband to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio Dávila, vive en el Barrio 31 de diciembre tiene 58 años y tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente y le apoyan económicamente, él sobrevive gracias a su negocio el cual es una pulpería y la cual le es muy rentable y es gracias a los créditos, que anteriormente le han otorgado, es que la venta se mantiene prospera, con las ganancias que le han generado estas, ha podido comprar su moto y un carro, tiene el objetivo de invertirle nuevamente al negocio para convertirlo en una miscelánea y generar mejores ingresos, esto le ayudaría a llevar a cabo proyectos que tiene el señor Dávila en mente y al crecimiento continuo de sus condicione económicas y sociales.
texts.en:
Gregorio D. lives in the December 31st neighborhood, is 58 years old and has 5 children who all work independently and support their father economically. He gets by thanks to his business which is a small store that he runs; it is very profitable and thanks to the loans he has received, he has been able to keep it prospering and been able to buy himself a motorcycle and car. He would like to continue investing in the business to make it a small general store and generate greater income. This will help him carry out projects he has planned and help him improve his economic and social standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for his business

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA AMELIA R. D. C. tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito D. TRUJILLO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESUS EN TI CONFIO; La socia  presenta estudios superiores D. la carrera profesional D. TRABAJO SOCIAL, pero debido a falta D. recursos económicos no se tituló y por ese motivo no ejerció su carrera. 
Tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. MARIA se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos como: colonias, desodorantes, labiales, bloqueador solar, shampoo, etc. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra D. cosméticos como: labiales, rubores, colonias, perfumes, etc. para aumentar su stock y así estar preparada ante cualquier pedido D. sus clientes.
Con este crédito D. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará mas cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, gel, shampoo, rubores, delineadores, etc. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias para así poder continuar apoyando en la crianza y educación D. sus hijos. 

Maria esta afiliada al seguro D. vida que le ofrece Manuela Ramos, ella opina que el seguro es muy importante y necesario, puesto que nadie esta libre D. algun accidente en el trabajo o en las calles.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department in Peru and belongs to the “Jesus en ti Confio” (I believe in you Jesus) communal bank. She is educated as a social worker, but due to lack of financial resources, she did not receive her degree and therefore did not begin this career. She has four children, of whom two depend on her financially. Maria sells cosmetics, such as: colognes, deodorants, lip products, sun block, shampoo, etc. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to increase her inventory in order to be prepared to meet any of her customers’ requests. She will use the money from this loan of 1,300 PEN ($$$$) to buy more cosmetics. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and income in order to continue raising her children and providing for their education. Maria is affiliated with the life insurance that Manuela Ramos offers. She believes that insurance is very important and necessary, because no one is completely immune from accidents on the job or in the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Jonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn L. is from the village of Minanga Proper, in Angadanan, Isabela province. She is 32 years old. Jonalyn is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jonalyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 29,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan Jonalyn has taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Josephine C. believes that one day, her dream of making her backyard poultry-raising business stable will come true through the loans she can access through ASHI. Presently, she is requesting another loan, which she will be using as additional capital for her business. Her husband supports her desire for this because they both want their three children, whose ages range from 6 to 11 years old, to go to college in the future through her business profits in addition to the small income her husband is earning through his small fishing business.

After 45 days of raising, Josephine’s chickens will be sold to be slaughtered or sold alive to people around their village or sold to meat vendors in the public market.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for raising

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina E. es una mujer que ha salido adelante con su hijo a pesar de ser madre soltera, ella se desde hace siete años tiene un negocio de abarrotes en el que ha podido sacar a su hijo adelante. Con este crédito será el cuarto en el que ha demostrado ser una mujer cumplidora en sus pagos. Ella se preocupa por el bienestar de su hijo es por ello que quiere ir haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio. Este nuevo préstamo es para hacerle acabados externos a la planta alta de su casa.
texts.en:
Paulina E. is a woman who has gotten ahead with her son despite being a single mother. For seven years, she has had a grocery business with which she has been able to get her son ahead. This loan will be the fourth with which she has demonstrated that she is woman who makes her payments. She is worries about her son's wellbeing and that is why she wants to make improvements on her housing to offer him a better quality of life and a better inheritance. This new loan is to do the exterior finishings on the upper floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishings on the upper floor of her house.

loans.name: Janchivsembe

texts.en:
Janchivsembe is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Both of his children, ages 15 and 12, attend a local secondary school. Janchivsembe operates a raw materials trading business with his wife. Between 2000 and 2002 they were a herder family with a few head of livestock. They have been operating their raw materials business since 2002. Since starting the business, their family's quality of life has improved.

 In addition, since Janchivsembe's sister purchased a counter in a recently built trading center, they have been planning to cooperate with her to operate a consumer product trading business. Janchivsembe is a very hard-working person. He says, “Since I have received a loan, my family's quality of life has been improving. With my earnings, I purchased a car for my family, and built a garage for the car. My next plan is to build a house for my family in my yard.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to increase the working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase merchandise & an industrial machine

loans.name: Lucelli

texts.en:
Lucelli M., 54 years old, is from the village of Pagatpat Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and has 3 adult children.

To make a living Lucelli operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Lucelli has been doing so for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Lucelli joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva,  de 22 años,  es una joven con ansias de salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de  sus 2 hermanos.Trabaja e invierte su dinero en la tienda de comestibles que tiene su madre. Los días que no labora  se dedica íntegramente a este negocio, pues el 30% es su capital. Sus  clientes son sus vecinos del barrio  y algunos  transeúntes, a quienes les atiende calidamente. Desde que tiene 17 años trabaja en diversos oficios relacionados a las ventas, y siempre muestra sus ganas de salir adelante, por ello de a pocos viene forjando su capital de trabajo. Trabaja  en sociedad con su madre; y lo que le parece difícil es que no puede surtir el negocio como quisiera, además su mayor anhelo es ampliar la tienda de comestibles, y después quiere independizarse del negocio de  su madre, y tener el suyo propio.Este es su primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente.Elva tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en incrementar su mercadería en comestibles, y de ese modo desea tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Elva, 22 years old, is a young woman with hopes of succeeding. She lives in her parents' home with her two brothers. She works and invests her money in a grocery store that her mother has. On days that she's not working, she's paying attention to the business; 30% of which is her investment. Her clients are neighbors from her neighborhood and some passersby, whom she waits on graciously. Ever since she was 17 years old she's been working in diverse roles related to sales. She's always had a desire to go out on her own and be successful, and because of that, she's forging her working capital. She's working in partnership with her mother, and what seems difficult is that she can't operate the business as she would like. In addition to that, her biggest wish is to expand the grocery store and later, she wants to become independent of her mother and have her own store. This is the first loan she's had with MFP, and she knows that the loan with help her increase her capital in the work, and for that she promises to make her payments on time. Elva is planning to invest the money in increasing her grocery supplies, and in this way she hopes her business will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries (food supplies) to sustain her business

loans.name: Deodima

texts.en:
Deodima H. is a married woman who lives in the Santol zone of Jonobjonob village, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ronnie, who is 43 years old, works as an auxiliary to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have one child who is six years old. 

Deodima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Deodima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500 - uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store, so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business. 

Deodima H. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan is married to M. Y. who is involved in a scrap business. They all live in a city called Pakpattan in Pakistan.  She sells bangles to financially support her family. She started this business by taking a loan earlier from Asasah. 

Now she has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband who wants to increase his sales and profits by adding more scrap material to his shop. Hamidan has a son who is also a scrap dealer and works with his father in his shop. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s profits will be increased with the help of an investment that will make possible for her son to open his own scrap shop in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry P. is from the village of Nipaan. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry operates a family member's business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Cherry joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cherry from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. sells fruit, bags of water, and other items at Takoradi. She has been educated up to the senior high level. She is divorced and living with her four children. Nana uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Nana will use the loan to purchase other types of fruit to bring variety into her inventory. With the new profits from her extended business, Nana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase other types of fruits to bring variety into her inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth U. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elizabeth works hard to provide her family food on the table, clothes to wear and their other needs.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elizabeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy C. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old and is married with six school-aged children. Nancy owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
Ashery S. is in his early 40s and is married with four children. He has been running a cobbler business for five years. The shop is open between 6:30 a.m. and 7 p.m. and earns Ashery a good monthly profit.

This will be Ashery's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Ashery aims to buy a sewing machine so that he can expand his cobbler business in order to repair shoes as well. 

Ashery will share this loan with his loan group Lugano, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Ashery can be seen to the far right, wearing dark glasses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon R. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Ilaya within the barangay of Balulang, a part of Cagayan de Oro City in Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Corazon runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Corazon has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en: Mrs. Yeu M. is 44-year-old married mother who currently lives in Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. Mrs. Yeu M. is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies, while her husband is motor taxi driver around her community in Phnom Penh. The family includes two devoted children, one of whom is single and the other one is married. Mrs. Yen M.’s husband wants to buy a trailer for picking up more customers, but he complains that he doesn't have enough money to make it possible. To solve this problem, Mrs. Yeu M. will use her loan to purchase a trailer to connect with an existing motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Yeu M. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect with an existing motorbike for her husband business.

loans.name: Reginah Karimi

texts.en:
Reginah is 29 years old and married to Samuel Muendu. Together they have one child, age 4. 

This will be Reginah's first loan from KADET, and she intends to use it to grow her beauty salon, purchase a blow dryer, and add stock for the store.

She intends to use the profits to employ an extra staff member and educate her child. In the future, she hopes to run a more elegant salon and create a college for hairdressers.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en:
Germelina P., from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married and has grown children. To make a living, Germelina has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over three years, earning approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Germelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting her third loan in the amount of 25000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Germelina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Lucienne est née en 1976 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à René et est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de cinq ans que la famille s'est installée à Akossavié, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Lucienne vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales. Pour assurer ses besoins, Lucienne vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, conserves de tomate et de sardine, huile végétale, plats en séries, etc. dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Lucienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lucienne est également une couturière, mais elle mène cette activité de façon secondaire. C'est la troisième fois que Lucienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Lucienne was born in 1976 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. Lucienne is married to Rene and the mother of four children, some of whom are attending school. It has been nearly five years since the family moved to Akossavié, in the town of Abomey Calavi. Lucienne helps her husband and with him provides for her family's expenses. 

In order to take care of her family's needs, Lucienne sells various items (pasta, couscous, canned tomatoes and canned sardines, vegetable oil, dish sets etc.) in a shop in her home. Lucienne buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Lucienne is also a seamstress, but that is a secondary business. This is the third loan Lucienne is requesting from ALIDé, she will use this loan to strengthen her business and grow her income.

loans.use: To purchase various products (pasta, vegetable oil, canned sardines, etc.)

loans.name: Together Towards Progress Group

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal  “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Esmircinia; L. socia tiene 26 años D. edad, L. socia tiene 1 hijo, y elL. se dedica al comercio minorista, L. socia compra al por mayor zapatillas, elL. viaja a diferentes ciudad en diferentes fechas del año y trae zapatillas, D. diferentes tallas y modelos, elL. ahora desea traer su siguiente campaña para el año que viene y surtir su mercadería. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatillas al por mayor.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes tareas como por ejemplo en su mayoría son comerciantes minoristas, estos socios compran y venden ropa, también venden cosméticos por catálogos, y dos socias venden huevos cocidos D. codorniz. Los socias invertirán su dinero en L. compra D. sus mercaderías como capital D. trabajo. 

L. socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
