She owns a refrigerator that she uses make and sell ice cream and natural fruit juices. Her revenues allow her to support her children and help her husband meet some of the household expenses.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Epifania is living in Norala, South Cotabato. She has a hog-raising business and a rice-farming business. She started her businesses in 1982. She can have a good harvest, but sometimes fails due to pest attack. Her businesses really help in providing for the basic needs of her family.

Requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., worth 12,000 Philippine pesos, she will be able to buy farm inputs and feed for the pigs.

loans.use: Farm inputs and feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años, es madre soltera y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Juana apoya a su hija Caty que estudia Turismo. Juana alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de fabricación de artesanía  de tipo muñequería. Juana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante que esta abriendo en la Av. Collasuyo en el distrito de Cusco pues va comprar ollas y cubiertos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old, a single mom and belongs to the community bank "Las hijas de Maria" (Maria's daughters) from the Arariwa Association. Juana supports her daughter Caty who studies Tourism. Juana alternates her housework chores with her craft business making dolls. Juana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman that requires a loan to implement a restaurant to be opened at Collasuyo Avenue in the district of Cusco, she needs to buy pots and cutlery. The member is grateful for the opportunity and commits to meet the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots and cutlery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta tiene un hijo a su cargo  y este se  encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, es el cuarto crédito que a Trabajado con CEPRODEL, y estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás del patio de su casa de habitación para  darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia. 

Ella dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
This client is a single mother who has one dependent child attending school. This will be the fourth loan she has received from CEPRODEL. All of her previous loans were used to improve her living conditions. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and iron, and pay for labor to build a security wall in her backyard. This will provide better living conditions for her family. She expresses her thanks to CEPRODEL for providing loans that allow her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for materials & labor to build a security wall.

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en: Chagnaadorj is 56 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rented ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living in their current home for two years. Their youngest daughter attends a vocational training center. Chagnaadorj's wife operates a sewing business at their home. In 2001, Chagnaadorj started manufacturing wooden products, and his family has been very supportive of him and his business. Since Chagnaadorj started his business, the family's quality of life has improved. When the business first started, its working capital was only 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD). However, as a result of his hard work and determination, the working capital of the carpentry business has grown to 300,000 tugrugs (~ 211 USD). He has been planning to expand his business in the future. Chagnaadorj is a very hardworking person and he has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to continue to grow my business so that I can help my children as they get married and eventually start families of their own.” Chagnaadorj is requesting a 600,000-tugrug loan to purchase planks for the wooden products that he manufactures.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden planks

loans.name: Elmie Fernandez Group

texts.en:
Elmie F., 20 years old, is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elmie F. Group.

Elmie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Elmie operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Elmie has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elmie joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmie is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel L. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Ruel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a business selling snacks like fish balls and tempura in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Soutoura  (Prendre Soin De Soi) Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe Soutoura fait l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d’habillements et de condiments alimentaires.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. 
Sali Traoré  qui est un des membres fait l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes (huile, oignon, Sounbala, tomates, cubes magies, ail, épices etc.) Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au cœur du marché sous le hangar des bouchers.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Sali Traoré  elle,  compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well because they live together in the same district, in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives. They are, on average, 35 years old, married and have at least three children each. The Group Soutoura buys and sells cosmetic products, clothing and food condiments. To grow their business, the members of the group decided to get involved with the credit institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. Sali Traoré, one of the members, buys and sells all sorts of food condiments (oil, onion, Sounbala, tomatoes, Maggie bouillon cubes, garlic, spices, etc.). She is very much in demand because she occupies a good place in the heart of the market near the butchers. She plans to use her loan to buy a considerable quantity of food condiments. She gets her merchandise in bulk at the main market in Koutiala and resells it at retail for cash to a clientele composed mainly of women. While the other members of the group Soutoura plan, on average, to clear a profit of 105,000 FCFA each during this loan cycle, Sali Traoré plans to clear 120,000 FCFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they use a part of their income to meet daily family expenses. They hope to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they can diversify their business activities.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Unidas Para El Futuro 4 Group

texts.en:
Elipadia is the coordinator of her group Unidas para el Futuro (United for the Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Epiladia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her business, which sells silver jewelry, by purchasing more anklets, bracelets, rings and necklaces. She will use the profits to save towards owning her own home and helping her daughters. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Saquio

texts.en:
Saquio B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 65 years old. Saquio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Saquio owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Saquio has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Saquio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Saquio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional products to sell. Saquio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Saquio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Big Five Group

texts.en:
Peter Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Big Five.  He is 38 years old, married and has four children who range from five to 20 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For five years, he has been charging mobile phones to make a living, on Johnson Street in Monrovia, Liberia. 

Peter plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more mobile phone chargers. 

He describes himself as very gentle.  Peter's goal is to improve his business, build a house and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more mobile phone chargers.

loans.name: Dionesita

texts.en: Dionesita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 68 years old and has five adult children. Dionesita owns and operates a business raising pigs to fatten them for sale. She also farms and plants rice crops. Her children help her maintain the farm and sell the harvest. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years. Dionesita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dionesita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda L. is from the town of Surallah. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. Rhoda's main source of income comes  from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rhoda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Rhoda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rhoda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. sells snacks with soft drinks at Takoradi. She is married but has no child yet. She has not received any formal education. Her husband is a mason.  Adwoa uses her income to help her husband support the household.  

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase more goods to bring variety into her sales and to meet the demand of customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to build a shop for her business.

loans.use: purchase more goods to being variety into her inventory

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 54 years old. Marianita is married. To make a living, Marianita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Marianita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marianita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine Naliaka

texts.en:
Josephine Naliaka M. is a 24-year-old single woman. She lives in Likuyani center, 26 km from Eldoret town. Josephine has a grocery where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past two years with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Josephine was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES with KADET which she plans to use to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho (hot pepper sauce), Irish potatoes and half a sack of green grams and beans each. She hopes to operate a large-scale grocery with the monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase more green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho, Irish potatoes, half a sack of green grams and beans each

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Domina is 33 years old and is married. She is a self-employed businesswoman selling Irish potatoes. She has been in this business for about ten years and her business hours are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Domina needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business seling Irish potatoes. By using this loan, she hopes that she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

If successful, Domina has a goal of expanding her market through creating more sources of income, thus creating jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida G. is SEF International's longstanding client. Aida is married with four children. Aida’s husband is working as a physicist in Russia. Two of her children live separately and the other two are students and live with their mother. Aida has been managing her current business since mid 2010. She sells women’s clothing from a rented trading booth at Malatia market. The business income supports the household and the students' school fees. Aida has applied for the loan to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.en:
T. Radjabali is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He owns a mini-bus, which generates the income necessary to support his family. Radjabali needs this loan to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel change, as this is cheaper than petrol. And also with part of the loan, he will purchase spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better so he can save more money in order to provide for his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 32 years old.  He is from Kisumu city, married to Carolyne, and they have three children: Sharon, 14; Paul, 10; and Beatrice, 6.

Peter sells electrical goods like cables and bulbs and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client here. He will use the money to buy more electrical goods to add to his stock.

His desire is to expand his business and be able to open up an electrical shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a forty-two-year-old widow who lives with her three children in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to own a permanent house and educate her children. 

She sells second-hand clothes for a living. She has been in business for twenty years. Her business has allowed her to pay school fees for her children. Alice intends to use the money to buy clothes because we are nearing the festive season.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes en Yanatile que queda ubicado en la provincia de Calca que es a una hora de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la docencia enseñando en un instituto, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a member of the "COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Juan Carlos is 48 years old, married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business raising chickens and guinea pigs in Yanatile, which is in Calca province, one hour from the city of Cusco.  He also teaches in a school.  Juan Carlos would like to improve and expand his business raising chickens and guinea pigs.  He is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Juan Carlos is happy to be receiving a loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 32 years old farmer married with two children. His spouse is Carolyn Koross who is a house wife. He is the sole breadwinner for his family.  He is in the small scale horticultural farming business in Elkeiyo-Marakwet County. He has been in the business for the last 15 years, when he first started tending fruits seedlings for sale and he later started growing them in his farm. From his farm, Stanley gets an average monthly income of Kshs 25,000. 

Stanley has borrowed a second loan of Kshs 13,500 from KADET LIMITED after successfully paying his first loan. He intends to use Kshs 7,000 to purchase fertilizers, Kshs 4000 for wages and Kshs 2500 for transport and miscellaneous expenses. He anticipates using his profits to save for the education of his children and to plow back into the business.

His future dream is to expand his business to a large scale and build a permanent residential house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Aouth Guenold

texts.fr:
A 22ans, outh est déjà bien fixé dans son métier de garnisseur. Célibataire sans enfant, il se lance dans la menuiserie après son  B.E.T. (brevet d’études techniques).
                         
L’argent du prêt passé, lui avait permis d’acheter un certain nombre de matériaux tel que : planches, colle, papier verre, pointes, éponge, tissus de garnissage, contre-plaquée.
Quand il  fabrique des petits meubles  utilisés par des ménagères, les tabourets, les pouffes, les tire –lire en planche, les bancs de cuisines et autres dépannage ; il a des recettes qui vont de 15.000F à 75.000F par jour ou par vente.

Avec le prochain prêt, il va plus se concentrer à son apprentissage des différents modèles des canapés et acheter des tissus luxueux pour réaliser cela.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Outh is already well established as an upholsterer. He is single and has no children, and began his career after completing his BET (technical qualification). 

The money from a previous loan enabled him to purchase a range of materials, such as planks, glue, sandpaper, nails, a sponge, filing materials and plywood.  He makes small pieces of furniture used by carpenters, such as stools, pouffes, wooden stools, kitchen stools and other items; he takes in 15,000F to 75,000F per day or per item. 

With his next loan he is going to dedicate himself to his craft by making different styles of sofas, purchasing luxurious fabric to do this.

loans.use: Purchasing materials like plywood, nails, glue, sponge, velour material

loans.name: Ndef Leng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NDEF LENG est créé le 03 mai 1997. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui sont issues de la même concession. Elles sont liées par des liens de parenté. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA

Madame SALIMATA C. à gauche de la photo, levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge et deux autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un élevage de poulets de chaire. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de prétendre à des bénéfices qui l'aideront à participer à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en: The joint group, NDEF LENG was created May 3, 1997. It's made up of 7 women who are from the same family residence and they are linked by their family ties. Their main occupation is petty trading. The group is part of the Sanghe Douka village association. Madam Salimata C. to the left of the photo with hand raised, is leader of the group. She is 56 years of age. She is married and the mother of 7 children at her care and two other entrusted to her by close relatives. She does poultry farming for meat.  As a side business, she sells peanut butter. Her new loan will enable her to grow her business in order to make profits which will help her to be involved in taking care of the family.

loans.use: Echeter des poussins et aliments volaille

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the group Primera Persona 2 & 3 ("First Person"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three of her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Rosa is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to invest this loan in her business by buying perfume, cosmetics, underwear, etc. She will save the profits to pay for her children's transportation (they attend university in another city and they have to travel weekly).

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an area famous for agricultural activities and the rural scene. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy perfume, cosmetics, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon is 24 years old, single, and a resident of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been doing poultry farming for two years now with his egg produce being sold to the local market. He has employed one farmhand. He earns additional income from dairy and tea farming.

Yegon has requested for this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business. He believes the expansion will generate enough income to repay the loan and he can save the rest for greater expansion.

Yegon says animal feed and treatment of poultry are a great challenge since they involve heavy expenses. He is grateful  for the support Juhudi gives farmers.

loans.use: to do poultry farming.

loans.name: Delmis Carolina

texts.es:
La profesora Delmis  Carolina de 30 años de edad,  trabaja como docente en la Escuela Rubèn   Dario  # 2 desde hace 7 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria a niños campesinos de su comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su  compañero de vida que trabaja como agricultor en la parcelita que ellos poseen, ambos comparten sus gastos familiares. Delmis se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora, con buenas relaciones sociales y muy respetuosa, es seguidora de las cosas de Dios, profesa la religion Catolica.  

Solicita su cuarto credito para construir una habitaciòn, asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de estabilidad laboral y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Delmis Carolina, 30, has been working as a primary school teacher in the Rubèn Dario school for the past 7 years with the village children of her community.  She has a common-law-husband who is a farmer on the small lot that they own and both share the family expenses.  Delmis is a honorable, hard-working woman who has good social skills and is very respectful.  She is religious and a Catholic.
She is requesting a fourth loan to build a house so she can give her family a better life.  Her greatest dream is to enjoy steady work and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Teresita is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing scooter for better transportation service

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Vun S., 55, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. is a traditional weaver, earning an income of about USD 1.3 per day. Her husband is employed to transport goods to the city, earning an income of USD 5 per month. Each month, the family has to spend USD 28 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new truck for her husband to replace the old one. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new truck for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.name: Zihué

texts.fr: Femme dévouée de 47ans, Mme Zihué a 03 enfants et est commerçante de mèches, canette, foulard. Son mari est carreauleur. Elle se donne à cette activité depuis 2007 et s’y plait énormément. Elle achète ses produits au Grand marché et revend au même lieu dans une boutique. Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter de nouveaux stocks afin d’étendre son activité pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants et participer à la charge de sa famille et pourquoi pas ajouter une autre activité parallèle.
texts.en: A dedicated woman aged 47, Ms. Zihué has three children and sells hair extensions, rollers, and headscarves. Her husband is a window-cleaner. She has devoted herself to her small business since 2007 and greatly enjoys it. She buys her goods at the Grand market and re-sells them at the same location in a small store. This first loan will help her buy new stocks in order to expand her business and thereby take care of her children and contribute to the family expenses, and also perhaps add an additional business activity.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and rollers.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ocas (es un tubérculo parecido a la papa) y también vende plátanos al horno, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ocas y plátanos al horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar plátanos y ocas para preparar al horno.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “WORKING MOTHERS” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province.

The member is Sofia; she is 42 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling ocas (a tuber similar to a potato) and also sells baked bananas.  She works as a street vendor from 9:00 am until 4:00 pm and, by means of this business, she helps her children get ahead.  She would like to expand and improve her business selling baked ocas and bananas.  She requests this loan to buy bananas and ocas to prepare in the oven.

She is very glad to have access to a loan, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy bananas and ocas (a tuber similar to a potato) to bake in the oven.

loans.name: Omar

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek rodilsya v 1977 qodu. On jenat i imeyet odnogo sina kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Omar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i sinom. Omar seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skototvodstvom i razvodit korov. Yego jena i on delayut sir i yogurt iz moloka i prodayut yego u sbeya doma. K ixney produkcii imeyetsya bolshaya potrebnost vot pochemu oni i xotat uvelichit kolichestvo molochnogo produkta.
texts.en: This young man was born in 1977.  He is married and has one son, who attends school.  Omar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and son.  Omar currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and increase milk production.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for five years and breeds cattle.  His wife and he make cheese and yogurt from the milk and sell it at their home.  Because their products are in high demand, they want to increase the production of milk.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a very supportive lady who operates a grocery store in her community where she sells daily use items to her clients at cheap rates. She has another business selling clothes, which also earns her a reasonable amount of income every month. 

Her husband works on the Pakistan railway on a monthly income. Mariam doesn’t have any children and she spends most of her time looking after her business.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will allow her to fulfill the timely demands of her clients and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for many years and hopes that an investment will bring more profits and improve her business conditions.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es: Rosalía  D. 53 años D. edad. Habita en su casa con sus dos hijas y dos nietos que se encuentran estudiando. Como toda mujer trabajadora y luchadora Rosalía ha logrado a través D. muchos esfuerzos establecer una tiendita en su lugar D. residencia. Ella trabaja D. lleno en su tienda para poder atender a sus clientes cuando necesiten D. sus productos los cuales son: golosinas, pan dulce, azúcar, macarrones, desechables, aceite, etc. DepenD. mucho D. su negocio y tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y poder comprar mayor variedad D. productos como: detergentes, maíz, arroz, leche, bebidas, desechables, etc. y D. esta manera poder innovar su negocio ya que es una mujer emprendedora sabe que debe estar al día con las demandas del mercado para así poder seguir manteniéndolo vivo. Con esto espera poder obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir en mejores condiciones junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 53, lives in her house with her two daughters and two grandchildren who are in school.  Like all hard working, tenacious women, Rosalía has managed through much effort to set up a small store in her residence.  She works all out in her store to tend to customers when they need products like: snacks, sweet bread, sugar, macaroons, disposable items, oil, etc.  She depends quite a bit on her business and she has much hope placed on her sales.   

Because of this she’s decided to request a loan to invest in the store and to be able to buy a larger variety of products like: detergents, corn, rice, milk, beverages, disposables, etc. to renovate the business since she’s an enterprising woman and realizes that she has to be up to date if she wants to continue to keep her business alive.  She hopes with this to obtain the necessary resources to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy detergent, corn, rice, milk, beverages, disposables, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos Alfredo tiene 22 años, Es soltero vive con una tia, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla son 12 miembros se en su mayoría dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz, actividad mas antigua.

Carlos Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial PRONACA y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo is 22 years old, single, and lives with his aunt in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 12 members, most of whom are long-time farmers who grow corn and rice.

Carlos Alfredo is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the PRONACA Commercial Center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan for growing corn and rice. Carlos will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. Some of the challenges he faces include diseases that could make his workers sick and the lack of money for making continued investments. His dream is to finish his studies.

Carlos enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 25 years old, married, the father of one child and the owner of a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the last four years, he has earned a living by running a retail shop which he spent 300,000 shillings to open but which is now worth more than 4,000,000 shillings. His main challenge is customers who fail to pay their bills, but he is determined to expand his shop into a wholesale operation and earn enough money to provide his child with a good education.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine and vinegar.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and lives in Bagong Silang with her husband and four grown-up children. She describes herself as a hard worker and one who wants to move her family ahead in life.

For about the last three years she has been working as a housekeeper, where she does all types of work.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of wood and other materials needed in wood lamination to allow her to do a better job.

By purchasing these items, she will improve the quality of her work and have more customers. Her dream is to have her own premises to set up her carpentry shop in a better way, and to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wood and glue for her wood lamination

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain his taxi by buying tires, shocks and ball-and-socket joints to provide a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 54 years old and she practices mixed farming, She is a single mother of one child aged 20 years. She has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from  KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Beth will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig keeping which will enable her to educate her child up to university level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the timber business for one year. She started with 3,000,000 and now has 4,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her challenge is her lack of capital and her vision is building a big timber store and educating her children. Jane needs the money to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Tierm

texts.en:
Tierm, 28 years old, works in a garment factory and earns $3 per day. Her husband provides a horse cart service and earns $2.50 per day. They have a 5-year-old child.  

Every month Tierm has to spend $77 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Tierm would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work and for other uses in the family. She wants to repair her house to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Javier Ludwin

texts.es: Javier es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, vive junto a su esposa en la zona de Pampahasi ubicados a treinta minutos del centro de la ciudad. Javier y su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes que atiende ella y él se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en una  calle de la zona,  La ropa usada que vende la trae desde la cuidad de Oruro y ya trabaja con esta actividad desde hace varios años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes como ser fideo, azúcar y arroz para surtir su tienda Es la primera vez que Javier trabaja con préstamos de emprender, pero esta recomendado por su madre quien es clienta antigua y muy puntual de nuestra institución. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Javier es poder ahorrar el suficiente dinero para que en un futuro pueda comprar una casita propia ya que actualmente vive en la casa de su Madre.
texts.en:
Javier is a young and very hard-working person.  He lives together with his wife in Pampahasi, thirty minutes from the city center.  Javier and his wife have a grocery store in which his wife works.  Javier sells used clothes in a local street.  He goes to the city of Oruro to buy the used clothes that he sells and he has been in this business for several years.  He will use his loan money to buy groceries such as noodles, sugar and rice with which to stock his store.

This is the first time that Javier has worked with loans from Emprender.  He was recommended by his mother who is a long-standing and very punctual client of our institution.  One of Javier's biggest wishes is to be able to save up enough money to buy a little house of his own in the future as he currently lives in his mother's house.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en: Anjela is married and blessed with one child, who is in school. She has been running a beauty salon for the last twelve years to support her family. She also sells charcoal to supplement her income. She has employed one person to assist her with managing the business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. Anjela has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a responsible housewife who aims to become successful in the future. She is 39 and has only one child. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband to generate income to satisfy their family's needs. She has been in this business for almost five years and usually earns profits of PHP 8,000 for every two pigs she sells.

She planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital, therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and she hopes that she will make her business grow in future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober tiene 33 años, vive en compañía de su esposa e hija en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Saño. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a ofrecer su servicio de construcción a varios propietarios que le solicitan, su especialidad es edificación de casas a base de ladrillo y cemento, por la amplia trayectoria que tiene en la construcción, ya que anteriormente trabajaba de albañil, le ha permitido tener prestigio  que garantiza la demanda de sus clientes. Él contrata la mano de obra de albañiles que lo ayudan en la construcción y el mismo es uno de los que siempre está viendo que  toda la construcción se realice en orden. Este trabajo le ha permitido capitalizar rápidamente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro con miras a crecer en la calidad de su servicio y en la adquisición de nuevos clientes. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “cantuta” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Ober, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas y materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Ober is 33 and lives with his wife and daughter in his own house, situated in the district of San Pedro de Saño. He has offered his construction services to  various property owners who hire him for seven years. His specialty is building houses with brick and cement. The wide range of his experience in construction - he used to work as a bricklayer - has given him prestige that guarantees his clients' business. 

He contracts the labor of bricklayers who help him with the construction, and he is one of those who is always making sure that all of the construction is conducted in order. This work has allowed him to quickly capitalize his income and to improve his quality of life. That is why he will continue working in this field with an aim to grow in quality of service and in the acquisition of new clients.

He is part of the solidarity group "cantuta" and this is the twelfth loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support he receives, since it allows him to progress with his business. He also promises to be punctual with his payment installations; his association is made up of responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving his support, Ober will invest the requested funds in the purchase of tools and construction materials.

loans.use: to buy tools and and construction materials like cement and bricks.

loans.name: La Central ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama la central y se  integra de cuatro personas quienes cada uno se dedican a diferente actividad.
 Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama María Lucita quien  es casada con el señor  Constancio y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes están a su responsabilidad.
 
   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo  en  la compra  y venta de pollos aliñado en donde lleva trabajando hace   un año y ocho meses en la que comenta que le  va bien  ya que con el préstamo a  mejorado mucho su compra  de pollos.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que también quiere apoyar a su  esposo   con los ingresos  de la casa y así sacara a delante a sus hijos que están estudiando.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguirá delante para si agrandar mas su negocio que tanto la ayuda con su ingresos.

 Los que integran en el grupo son la señora: Teresita de Jesús  quien invertirá el préstamo en a la compra de cosméticos de la marca a von, Adi deleyma  invertirá en la compra  y venta de cosmético y la señora Guadalupe  invertirá en la compra de material para costurar ropas.
texts.en:
The "La Central" group is made up of four people, each with a different business. The person interviewed is María Lucita, who is married to Constancio, and has four children in her care. 

She applied for the loan in order to invest it in the purchase and sale of cut-up chicken, a business she has been working in for a year and eight months.  She says it is going well, since with the loan, she has greatly improved her chicken purchasing. 

She was inspired to start the business, because she wants to help her husband by contributing to the household income. In this way she will help her children, who are in school, get ahead in life.

Her greatest wish is that with this small activity, she will be able to keep moving forward. This will enable her to expand her business even more, which helps her so much with her income. 

The people in the group are Teresita de Jésus, who will use the loan to buy Avon brand cosmetics, Adi Deleyma will use it to buy and sell cosmetics, and Guadalupe who will use it to buy material for sewing clothing.

loans.use: To buy free-range chickens to then sell cut-up.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a proud farmer. He has been growing rice as his source of income for almost 20 years. According to him, he still needs to improve and further develop his business to increase his earnings. Romeo has three children that attend school and need daily allowances.

Romeo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy three bags of rice seed and eight bags of fertilizer. With the help of this loan, he will make his crop produce an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Romeo would like to provide a better education for all of his children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seed and eight bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Kpedenou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEDENOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Edwige est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Edwige est âgée de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Edwige a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Edwige est mariée à un certain Eric. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Edwige vend depuis six ans, des bijoux et des vernis à son domicile. Edwige s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Edwige sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEDENOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The KPEDENOU group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alide in order to grow their business.  The representative of the group, named Edwige, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Edwige is 26 years old and lives in Benin. She dropped out after elementary school.  Edwige is married to Eric. The couple have two children, both in school and their dependents.  In addition to their children, the couple have two other children in their care.  Edwige lives together with her husband and children. In order to take care of various family expenses, Edwige has been selling jewelry and nail polish from her home for the past six years.  She stocks up in a region of Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and income, Edwige together with the other members of the KPEDENOU group are asking for a fourth loan from Alide. The three previous loans were all completely repaid.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Loeung is a 33-year-old married woman who resides in the Baray district with her husband and two single children, who are attending school. She is in the business of selling fish, which are caught by her husband from the Tonle Sap River. She typically earns about $2.40 each day. 

Loeung would like to borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase some replacement fishing materials to support her husband’s business. Her business goal is to increase her sales and gain extra income to satisfy her family.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing materials.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 38 years old with 5 children. She lives in D'ban Calamba Mis. Occ.: Philippines. 

Concepcion is providing a recycling services business to local members to make a living and she's been 4 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP1,200.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP4,000.00 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the business improvements.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the workshop
